ierome osorivs byshopp siluane portingall slaunderous inuectiues aunswere apologeticall necessary defence euangelicall doctrine veritie first taken hand walter haddon vndertaken continued iohn foxe englished iames bell esay cap 11 65 shall man hurte slay holy hill sayth lord iesus christvs london printed iohn daye dwellyng ouer aldersgate anno 1581 christian reader experience hath taught gentle reader daungerous troublesome age cōmitt thyng printe thy behoofe farreforth hath frettyng cāker carping curiosity preuailed busily pryeth euery printer shoppe wayward churle zoilus diuers variable wittes disposition age readyer breake downe open roades thorough men hedge stoppe neuer little gappe frythe owne aunswered greatest barker commonly best byters falleth parte bytesheepe curres smell cudgell gentle houndes feede croomes leaue selues whose sinister iudgement litle regarde groape prayse onely purpose profitt vnlettered english men emongest gentle natured interprete best findyng ought amisse courtesie rather correct trust carpyng condemne course labour whose onely behoofe benefitt aduentured vpon translation published printe bytternesse speache occurre first blushe may happely breede offence call remembraunce sharpenes speach vttered kyng dauid apostle paule holy one selues almost feruencie zeale agaynst enemy god aduersaries crosse christ offence lesse offensiue respect opposed aduersary whose mouth ruffleth runneth ouer euery ruffianlike rascallike tearmes agaynst dread souereigne agaynst highnesse nobilitie agaynst subiectes whole state gracious gouernemēt vtter defacing gospell grace true harted englishman endure read without greeuous anguishe mynde licentious lauishenesse rayling tounge sithence outraged monstruously conuenient mette withal libertie free speache gentle prelate beyng otherwise squeymishe heare shrewde wordes might hereafter learne wryte modestly beseemyng pastorall dignitie functiō geaue lesse occasion iust reproche rest commende thy gentle consideration requiryng none guerdon thy handes trauaile thy frendly acceptaunce spare thyne idle tyme employed perusing thy better instruction shalt thou encourage knowledge shall increase oportunitie serue acquaynte fruites rest labour shall hereafter vndertake conduct god holy spirite enlighten thyne hart spirituall vnderstandyng glory name establishement thy fayth farewell thy fellow seruaunt lord iames bell right honorable good lord phillippe earle arundell grace peace spirituall consolation christ iesu might iustly wondered right honorable bright sunneshyne gospell grace plentyfully ouerspreading noble island resplendisaūt beames many englishe endimions could cōtinue long amazedly dazeled sight able lift vpp eye sleepy affection conceaue much lesse pearce amyable closettes thereof old auncient enemy mankynd sworne aduersary true religion vigilaunt lulle securitie sluggardes willyng awakened lamentable blindnes behold happy course floorishing continuaunce sincere religiō ponder vpright ballaunce vnstayned affection glorious manifestation auncient apostolicke doctrine withall looke maruelous discouery counterfaict synagogue rome could wonder blockishe sensibilitie manifest light man would haue thought though sathan hadd transformed selfe angell light yet long haue preuayled especially emongest sharpe sighted deuines cunnyng caruers scripture profoūde doctor schoole thorough anatomy vsually made manner artes discipline doctrine man would haue thought knowledge heauenly doctrine christ beyng partes forcible mighty operation able selfe drawe moue stirre renew chaūge men seàrch examine cutt quicke opē filthy soares sinne launce festered impostumes fowle affection pearce inward secrett partes hart sacke subuerte kingdome sathan destroy whole armye could authoritie maiestie thereof haue stayed holden backe crushed peeces deuises attemptes coū termoyles sathans minister sort either admiration amazed might astonyed mouthes stopped might vtterly confounded strength gospell accordyng read neuer man spake like vnto man iohn 7iohn 7 yet loe carefull watchefullnesse emperour darkenesse suffer carelesse drowsinesse scribe pharisee acknowledge promised messiah though come emongest owne yea though eye see blind restored sight dumme speake deafe heare man sinne sitt chaire pestilence moyling turmoyling peruertyng subuertyng razing defacyng reuelyng ruffling maner horrible abhominations euen iewes deluded fanaticall spirite cōceaued vayne foolishe opinion messiah come worldly pompe princely magnificence maner earthly potentate make lordes earth euen iewishe romanistes carryed like phancie forged vicar christ bewitched false persuasion stately royalty visible glorious synagogue haue myndes busied nothyng much magnifieng exaltyng glorifieng thereof blazing abroad world vayne glitteryng shewes stagelike ceremony friuolous tradition peltyng deuises drowsie dreames owne idle braynes deliuer ouer many oracle heauen contrary expresse word testament grace doth minister men aboū dauntly thynges sufficient obteinyng euerlastyng health saluation whole earth swarmeth euery bookes wrytinges testifieng age much pestered authours notwithstandyng allready may satisfied altogether cast ouer reprobate mynde manifold aū sweres many learned father faythfull seruauntes god euen full might ghostly byshopp ierome osorius vpon learned aunswere made haddon slaunderous libell presumptuously pearching highnes flattery lye haue stayed course scilēce prouided wisely creditt good name otherwise hadd bene made notably infamous world rayling reply agaynst haddon bene published abroad tell whether hath pleased lord rayse vpp iambres moyses styrre vpp proude popishe holofernes notable champion romaine nabuchadnezer make prowde challenge agaynst poore cittie bethulia tell lord haue appointed semey rayle outragiously agaynst dauid tell god haue hardened hart pharao people israell might greater glory passe fromout miserable captiuitie oppressing egipt great god israell maruelous workes onely touche small rodde deuided readd sea made become drye lande passable way people retournyng waues thereof vpon pursuyng enemy vtter ouerthrowe pharao charettes hoaste gaue headd stought warriour holofernes handes seely woman caused rodd aaron eate vpp roddes thenchauntours sorcerer egipt onely breath mouth hath daunted insolencie popishe challenger beyng esteemed emongest englishe papistes notable prelate age hand weake englishe pastour discouered colour nought el vayne bablyng rhetorician full wordes altogether voyde matter notwithstanding malicious peruersenes world onely alone beareth price carryeth greatest creditt estimation writer tyme euery whose sentence reputed oracle heauē odde man whole world ierome osorius able aunswered much lesse confused protestaunt whatsoeuer hartely wished authour selfe would haue deliuered trauayles herein englishe toung vnlettered englishe man argumentes herein comprised might haue bene able stoppe mouthes wayward english cauillers supporter quarell respected ende though plausible owne countreymen yet much cōmodious generall common weale christendome right well perceaued though osorius roaued england name yet bent shotte agaynst generall state christianitie therefore necessary osorius made challenge knowen whole world world also might made acquainted encounter would haue sayd vtter ouerthrow benefite whereof though haue redounded many particuler person within realme yet hath bene vniuersall needefull respect multitude onely regardyng name fame man sayd scarsely persuaded may possibly aunswered passe ouer worthy prayses booke selfe iustly deserueth excellencie matter worthynes maner faythfull seruaunt christ john foxe hath handled yet dare promise boldly pronounce men may readyng embracyng beleeuing followyng doctrine conteined booke throughly furnished well especiall principall pointes christiā religion namely iustificatiō election regeneratiō redēption onely merite meane pure precious bloudshed immaculate lambe slayne foundatiōs world layed singuler comfort soules also argumentes herein conteined armed pointes agaynst assaultes practizes massemoungers meritemoūgers pardonmoungers confessionmoungers popish rable whatsoeuer world trāslation dare affirme otherwise thē haue trauailed therein faythfully accordying measure grace lord hath geauen doughtyng atteyne wished successe mē vouchsafe simplicitie eye willingnesse hart read search examine stand vpright perusing haue poore abilitie trauayled therein certes purpose profitt countrey men generally fruites labour haue thought good present dedicate honorable patronage moued hereunto cōmendable report opinion men cōceaue honour godly zeale zealous godlynes singuler glory name vnspeakeable cōfort godly well acceptyng good liking whereof iudge altogether necessary seeke circumstaunce persuadible speech enduce honour saue onely bare cōsideration wōderfull fruite may reaped readyng contentes namely proceedyng frō well knowen spirite godly faythfull seruaūt god wherein albeit translation atteyne absolute excellencie perfection dignitie matter doth require right ought haue bene deliuered wise respect diminishe worthynes author yet much retcheth ende whereunto directed namely benefitt church god vtter ouerthrowe malignaunt church sathan minister dought honour vouchsafe thereof accordyngly iesu christ sonne heauenly eternall euerlastyng father preserue honour spirituall grace heauenly wisedome prosper proceedinges establish fayth fructifie study multiply consolation direct wayes finally blesse harte desire increase much honor world glorifieng body soule immortall glorious kyngdome heauen euer euer amen honour lord iames bell ¶ renowmed puissaunt prince sebastian king portingall euerlasting grace peace prosperous reigne lord sauiour iesus christ hadd vndertaken enterprise beyng enduced earnest cōsideration cause take hand present necessitie tyme allurement priuate commoditie presumptuous oftentation vayneglorious persuation mynde renowmed vertuous prince kyng sebastian onely haue bene accoumpted blameworthy iudgement godly also haue willfully plunged selfe deserued obloquy world beyng poore despised abiect seely wretched vnderlyng meere straunger farre seuered distaunce place without maner acquaintaunce either name title neither called cōmēded desert person cōmaū ded hereunto dare boldly presume write vnto highnesse beyng mirrour princely dignitie occasion moued attempt maiestie seemed small importaunce oportunitie matter selfe yelded vnto lesse euident argument assured affiaunce audacitie though vtter apparaunce vnseemely yet pardonable trust vpon due examination cause yet besides alleadged necessitie emplyeng reasonable excuse wanted many others commendable aydes defend enterprise like example applyed like cause may allowable ierome osorius beyng priuate man lesse estraunged societie common weale professed enemy religiō embrace englād prouoked either vayne glorious oftentatiō greedy desire maintayne owne religion deface vnder zeale pretensed good affection borne durst bold onely write long tedious epistle royall excellent queene elizabeth also vnprouokedly aduertize highnes matter inconuenient daungerous soules health condemned insolency inflamed sincere inclinatiō humble dutie towardes valiaunt prince sebastian kyng portingall lesse famous princely vertues valiaūt administration power allured notable reporte incomparable bounty send humble greetyng lord iesu two three wordes maiestie recommendyng highnesse gracious protection allmightie lesse increase perfect peace tranquillitie letter inwardly wishe maiesty frō bottome hart neither see reason contrary embraced cōceipte driuē endeuour hauyng many notable commendation vttered euery godly personadge behalfe famous kyng sebastian renowmed eche coast excellencie prowesse noblesse dignitie sithence osorius pleasaunt blast trompe fame hath presumed farre vpon vnspeakable clemency queenes excellent maiestie neuer sawe also highnesse aboundaunt grace hath great lenitie entertayned letter osorius gently perused though otherwise perhappes vnworthy noble personadge persuade selfe obteine much yea rather princely magnificence heroicall clemency especially sithence cann credible kyng sebastian beyng man cann ioate inferiour elizabeth womā queene princely ornamētes dutie humanitie peraduenture founde farre emongest v whō comparison make betwixt v two osorius seeme respect agreable much beyng constaunt frend true catholicke churche alleadge doth take vpon commē dable necessary cause defence say sett purpose proclaimyng opē warre agaynst aūcient catholicke church agaynst sincere religion agaynst approued supremacy byshop rome hath bene allwayes hitherto atteinted iudgement monarch consent degree condemned banished • ought meanes admitted courtes eares prince matter exempt protection priuiledge godly lawes obiection new thyng whereof haue long agoe well aduisedly debated selfe yea selfe thyng royall kyng wherein become presēt maiesties humble suppliaunt whereof determined beseech highnesse bowel lord god whose aucthoritie person represent realme ye would vouchsafe due consideration ierome osorius byshop syluain bandyng enforcing knowledge skill agaynst professed doctrine religion publiquely receaued england hath published printe three famous libelles vnder title aunswere maister haddon reply wherof haue framed accordyng slender capacitie apology conueniently purpose haue say successe come handes lord surely garnishment phrase stile thereof haue great regard contention tendeth blazyng excellency eloquence neither treate delicacy finesse speach neither descant lyke minstrelles warblyng stringes ne yet tosse question fro vaunt brauery witte sophisters vse argue moates sunne triflyng dunsticall schooles dispute deuines matter greatest importaunce true righteousnes way eternall saluation euerlastyng damnation true woshippyng allmighty god apology aunswere quarrellsome slaūderous reproches osorius simple soeuer appeare haue thought man meete presented maiestie excellēt kyng sebastian humbly craue desire wittnes iudge controuersie question wherewith osorius doth inueigh agaynst v suppose allready well knowen grace therefore petition desire obteyne highnesse effect much osorius hath vttered cunnyng eloquence meanes may possibly depraue v whō vnhonestly reprocheth name lutheranes onely vnto maiestie prince christendome also thereby bryng v vnappeasable hatred may please royall maiestie godly prince conspire geaue sentēce agaynst v matter heard debated betwixt v highnesse especially noble kyng portingall hauyng allready seene clamour brables osorius beyng best chiefest argument vseth deface order obseruation profession vouchsafe also like equitie patience minde admitte confutation thereof presence whereby eche partie beyng discouered according truth highnes may certeinly determine cause notable law othe established iudgementes auncient athenian heare eares indifferent eares open eche partie maner custome vsed dayes perplexitie cōbate opinion byshops armed aucthoritie prince doe stand raunged mayne battell agaynst manifest veritie doe bende whole cōsent fayth one partie libertie mutter vtterly cutte partie may contrary doubtfullnes paraduēture trouble royall thought much proceedyng gracious nature whyspered godly eares subtill slaunderous practizes glaueryng glosers vnder counterfaict vysour glorious coūterfaict church haue wonderfully bewitched eye eares many noble personadges vnder pretēce succeeding course many yeares make glorious bragges newfangled church wherein romish byshopp enthronized onely catholicke church supremacy thereof onely obeyed alleadgyng church empresse gouernesse church right ought esteemed aboue kinges emperours ouer christ hath substituted byshopp rome sole vicar vicegerent earth therfore degree ought may safely submitt themselues aucthoritie determination churche beyng continually vpholden power blessing holy ghost neuer seene hitherto haue erred ne yet could meanes swarue one title right lyne knowen trade true fayth taught holy scripture person whatsoeuer sequestering thēselues frō prescript rule cannon churche cann chuse runne headlong wandryng errours amazed blindenes extreme maddnes wherefore lutheranes hugonoughtes worthely expelled vnitie church deseruedly adiudged fier fagottes dampnable heretiques worthy fauorable protection writinges much touched mās handes bycause dare presmoūte quacke agaynst supremacy angelicke ierarchy touchyng slaunderous surmise albeit nothyng cann falsely shamefully imagined sorcerous enchaūtementes wonder much poysoned dolldreanche hath betyppledd sences many great personadges hath long preuailed great admiration sundry estate onely ignoraunce learnyng ouermuch credulitie godly prince vntill late incomprehensible prouidence almightie god worthy arte emprintyng erected meanes whereof good letter bookes came marte printer shoppes discouered foggy darkened cloudes olde mothe eaten barbarousnes hereby came passe tedious deepe doungeons lothesome ignoraunce beyng surprised certein new cleare dawnyng day purer doctrine also liberall science beganne shyne abroade leaue trust ouerspread brighte glisteryng beames dayly vntill inaccessible brightenes thereof either thoroughly vanquishe whole kyngdome darkenes least chaūge better countenaunce ende may conceaue assured hope good successe herein two thynges minister vnto v especiall comfort wherof one consisteth mearcy lord remayneth handes kynges prince next vnder god lordes watchman first haue infallible argument cann neuer deceaue assured testimony iesus christ hath prophecied holy scripture shalbe brought passe greater part whereof haue allready experimented accomplished dayes lord breath mouth shall confounde pride beast arrogantly vaunting selfe holy temple next small force meane vigilant wisedomes singuler godlynes causeth v cōceaue well prince lord infinite mearcy hath ordeyned exercize chief rule gouernemēt next vnder vpon face earth especially whenas selfe hath pronounced owne mouth reuelation saint iohn lende helpyng handes hereunto sayingapoca 17 tenne horne sayth thou didst see vpon beast • enne kinges shall abhorre babylonicall strampett shall make desolate naked shall deuoure fleshe burne carkasse flame fire lord hath inspired harte bring passe euen hath pleased apocal 17 wherfore awake noble prince christian captaines march god name atchieue exployte worthy noble race longer trayned trayterous sleightes subtill sycophātes pursue power godly guidyng lord hostes emongest humbly call vpon highnes singuler paterne princely royaltie ende teaze exercize cruelty agaynst viperous generation onely petition loue beare iesus christ owne soules health ye vouchsafe deliuer simple innocentes bloudy iawes rauenyng wolues horrible blouddsuckers enterchaunge thynges beyng made true pure word god may heard teacheth ye lett lowse reynes licentious insolency longer hereafter abuse iewes handle lord iesu christ whose facē blindefolded beate body whippes hath bene many broyles allreády emongest v christian much christian bloud hath bene spilte much crueltie horror hath bene exequuted while meane space whose power rested staye outrage either wincked bootchery least left poore innocentes succourlesse slaughter house long shall romishe nymrod vaunt throne long shall make scorne patience excellent prince royall harte noble courage daunte pride resume handes whole sword iustice better part whereof romishe russian hath bereft surcease bondeslaues vnto mighty god hath made vassalles lawfull regimēt long ye suffer mouthes mooseled eye muffeled blynde errours contrary manifest light gospell question whereof ariseth controuersie harde intricate exceeded capacity would haue entruded selfe presence maner persuasion would haue referred selfe rather censure learned much religion god holy gospell professe resplēdisant eye eares men bright shyning sunne whott sommers day doctrine say wherewith enstructed preacheth repē taunce bruysed cōscience agayne imputeth vnto penitent person free righteousnesse deliueraunce sinne fayth without workes christ iesu onely forbiddeth idolatry restrayneth adde diminish title prescript rule holy scripture forbiddeth inuocation dead prayeng straūge goddes acknowledgeth humanitie christ sonne god place right hand father approueth honest honorable estate wedlocke person indifferently hath made foode sustenaunce fishe flesh without choyse beyng receaued thankesgeuyng subiect necessary vse man taketh away confidence affiaunce vsually ascribed vnto merites workes calleth v away opiniō soules health set obseruation prescribed dayes monethes reduceth v naked elementes world worshippyng signes outward ceremony say cleareth harte myndes bondage men tradition dreames doth ensure establish v mearcy grace allureth person indifferently readyng holy scripture denyeth man participation cuppe new testament bloud iesu christ abbridgeth minister word desire worldly superiority stay frō reckoning vpp rest notable manisest bright shynyng sunne mydday cann maiestie atchieue worthy beseemyng highe excellency admitt secrett closett soule euident trueth heauenly discipline highnesse yet made acquainted therewith ye know infallible true ye longer shrowde vnder protection pestilent errours allready disclosed repugnaunt knowen veritie wherewith grace may one day hereafter paraduenture desire shielded dreadfull iudgemēt seate lord hostes accordyng promise iesu christ trueth sayth shall deliuer iohn 8 highnes shalbe persuaded reformatiō religion whereof haue treated doth apperteigne estate charge seculer prince doth wordes osori emporte thē wheras writyng gracious queene elizabeth doth carefully admonish maiestie vouchsafe especiall regard know glory christ meaneth law lord teacheth much rule sacred religiō doth exact highnes whereas epistle doth learnedly pronoūce speciall duty princely gouernemēt ought wholy employed preseruatiō true pure religion pag 10 el otherwise grace thoroughly conceaue true gracious restitutiō god holy word doth lesse cōcerne furtheraūce gospell preseruatiō royall estate saluation subiectes humbly beseech noble kyng redoubled linke pietie wherewith first bounde vnto lord maiestie shall playnly perceaue cause entred vpon varye decline iote awrye true touchestone liuely word neuer litle highnesse excellent clemency vouchsafe aduertize bysh osorius myndfull professiō behaue selfe debatyng state religion vprightenes iudgement cause requireth frō henceforth desiste frō backbyting neighbour clamorous lyeng slaunderous reproches haue rather deserued well respect offended opinion errours ought rooted church lett first cōuince errours gaynesayth shew selfe abler man make proofe argumēt thē resist onely cauillyng meanes deemed profitable member church procure selfe lesse hatred easie matter euery common rascall vomitt disdaynefull name infamous person protagoras diagoras cicloppes blindsinckes epicure gortellguttes monster fitteth comlyer learned men profitable christian congregation lay aside distompered choler instruct vnlearned reclayme obstinate sounde argumentes expresse testimony scripture order obserued euery carter may soone aucthoritie clayme cōmon rayler methode writyng requisite osorius effectuall edifie hath vttered bookes sufficeth reuile men odious name callyng madd impudent childish infaūtes declame whole cō mon place vsed agaynst heretiques doe know playnly confesse necessary oppugne erronious sectes heresy errour forthwith hath somewhat bitter smatclie vnsauory euery queysie stomacke neither allwayes trueth plausible eche fonde dotyng phantasie wise men ought chiefly haue considered euery man assertiō framed agreablenes word god yet dayes cann tell carte sett horse preposterous frowardnes person haue brought passe bycause men shall guided gospell runne men imaginatiōs shall obey beare principall banner right squaryer christian fayth hath none sure foundation onely grounded vpon holy scripture dutie hadd bene direct buildyng religion lyne leuell ramme fast wallworkes hereof cemente morter cann tell come passe many worke guyte contrary despise well fenced order hauyng litle regarde meanyng purporte word rayse selues church call catholicke assigne onely guide gouernesse yet notwithstandyng make demonstration whether church christ yea nay measuryng onely title romish see swiftenesse opiniō doe affirme church cann meanes goe astray whatsoeuer church doth denoūce commaunde doe greedely catche whole bente fayth defende tooth nayle sincke plumped first men tradition sundry preiudiciall opinion certein vnreproueable determination call vnwritten verity leysure cōferre scripture sorte whatsoeuer shall seeme serue purpose canonize inuiolable ought founde contrary expectation either submitt iudgemēt church violent wrestyng racke colour suggestion hereof sprang darnell cockell errours dissension bycause many men fashion fayth frameshapen chaungelyng simple conduct word church perceaued doctrine embraced witte romish see ought supreme empresse ouer church purgatory must beleeued pardon necessary vowes made remayne vnmaried meritorious mounckery cowled profession hadd certein wonderfull perfectiō image ought worshipped sainctes prayed vnto grace deseruynges iesu christ could selfe suffice attaynement saluation man could obteyne righteousnes fayth without workes christ selfe flesh bloud bone conteined sacrificed masse vnder bare accidentes lay person denied vse readyng scripture participatyng cuppe lord many like drugges though neuer could finde liuely wellsprynges holy scripture yet bycause perceaue shryned decree decretalles rome doe constauntly beleeue must autentique aucthoritie many oracle lettē downe heauen hereby cometh passe vnder vysour churche sondry deformed byshapes doctrine fostered vpp church vnder pretence christ true gospell christ small daunger vtterly defaced lamentable complaynte vttered chrisostome could neuer aptly applyed age many doe walke sayth vnder name christian fewe trueth christ bycause haue debated matter osorius hereafter large deteigne royall maiestie register thereof remayneth make humble intercession almightie god father lord iesus christ immeasurable mearcy loue wherewith disdayned disclose selfe vnto mankynde sonne vouchsafe beautifie establishe mighty power outstretched arme defende make permanent errours bloudy bootchery true light holy gospell bright beames whereof hath allready enlightened earth beseeche likewise trompett dewe administration gospell kyngdome darkenesse may dayly subuerted church kyngdome sonne iesu christ may dispersed abroad ouer face earth preached thorough nation tounges lastly pray endue christian kynges prince beyng sett aucthority especially puissaunt victorious sebastian kyng portingall princely ornamentes enriche perfect absolute clemency vertue true godlynesse enlighten knowledge glorious countenaunce establishe throne settyng forth glory aduauncement 504 b herefore hereof therefore godly reader walter haddon sendeth greetyng lord iesu christ yeares past certeine portingall named ierome osorius wrate tedious epistle queenes maiestic imagined many monstruous errours bee frequented church reprochful rayling vnreuerently depraued professours gospel publicke quarell nature countrey troubled litle particular pointes wherof thought good aunswere although generall partly bycause wated tyme thereunto partly bycause supposed osorius deluded malicious report aduersaries therefore hoped man would haue bene somewhat satisfied myne aunswere passed ouer one year • two meane tyme appointed queenes highnes agent flaunders lydgear bruges tyme one emanuell dalmada portingall borneemanuell dalmada portingall byshop angrence byshop angrence sodenly sprang vp bruxelles worshypfull prelate vndertaking defēce frend ierome osorius stuffe great uolume full wounders brabbles ende booke caused certein ougly picture portrayde thereby deface personage much might perused apologie entituled cōfused llipe neuer saw foolish vnsauery writing full ofskoffes absurdity two beyng taken away remained el nothyng besides whereupon debated selfe while whether might aunswere doltish asse last determined despise scely wretched dottarde one onely altogether vnlettered also dull blockysh nature many tymes voyde common sence became iestyng stocke among wiser sorte owne fraternitie two yeares sithence familiar frend thomas wilson returnyng portingall englādthom • wilson brought ouer thence request osorius certein volume osorius framed three bookes wherof one deliuered seuerally vnto receiued gladly perused ouer twise trustyng osorius beyng enstalled byshop would much modest thē matter fell quite contrary steede liuill sober person finde friuolous sophister graue diuine 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 nine childish counterfaite discrete byshop impudent rayler hereunto added store vanitie proude hawtynes respect thraso might well adiudged discret person sorrow speake much bene acceptable honesty according ordinary course commō conference haue debated matter frendly quietly rather cōbat together tauntyng snatchyng sithence osorius disputeth byshop neither argue byshop neither requisite myndefull osorius estate sithence forgetteth owne myne also standeth good reason haue takē pleasure euill speakyng loase euill hearyng gentle reader thought good premonishe partly thou mayest perceaue course processe writyng partly shall seeme sometymes somewhat sharpe myne aunswere thou mayest impute enforcement myne aduersarie rather bitternesse nature request two thynges thee first shall haue briefly throughly confuted foolish spitefull braules osorius thou wilt cōtēt therewith requiring many woordes matter small substaunce albeit osorius lunite selfe measure ende pratlyng yet temper talke neither abuse thy leysure myne owne bycause hard thyng matter rather difficultie fill whole uolumes scribling toyes odious accused yt selfe faulte wherof man doth condemne last request thou yeld thyne attentiue mynde voyde parcialitie opinion two thou graūt vnto shall easely appeare trust haue lesse godly necessarily entred honest defence countrey thou also playnely perceaue maliciously wickedly england hath bene accused depraued cursed enemy osorius farewell ¶an aunswere walter haddon rayling inuectiues ierome osorius entrey tragedie prattling brawler hath framed long discourse shewosorius beginneth double excuse booke certeine yeares publicatiō therof came hādes wherein supposed finde mysticall matter though know hee receaued booke iote yt purpose whereof doe entreate though man may doubt whether writyng sold euery shoppe might foure yeares space transported portingall myne aunswere publiquely imprinted could meanes el brought osorius vnlesse worshipfull prelate angrence come ouer flaūders nay surely maketh litle matter know tyme booke came sight credible wanted foure yeares imprinting doubt messēgers enough would haue conueyed vnto though byshop angrence neuer sene bruxels yea though neuer bene borne therefore friuolous painted preface might haue bene spared altogether bene accompanyed two iolly mate one ye might vp meanes yeld honorable testimonie frende emanuell whō aduaūce excellency aboue skyes come late osorius carrion emanuell departyng frō flaunders hath left behynd euident monument folly bewrayng blockyshnesse wherein alone hee hath vttered many proofes ignoraunce impudencie man beleue though extoll worthynes othe wherfore haue delight felowshyp vse rather couert owne countrey home el osorius shall neuer get honor honesty praysing emanuell secōd part narration declareth laudable custome countrey bookes corrupt religion may admitted therfore emanuell durst commit myne aunswere vnto vnlesse first obteined licence thereunto heare bookes dayly infamed slaunderous accusation fraternitie yet curiously deteined frō world doth acknowledge sturdy champion romish sea exāple reason learnyng doe iustifie writer publikely inueighe agaynst ierarchy wholy cōuince superstition enacted canon law reason yeldeth lesse writinges aduersaries bee deliuered vnto doctours pillers churche pardye may burne broyle authours come clawes reason doth require custome hath farre forth preuailed also established doctrine yet onely portingall squeymish writynges osorius beyng himselfe couragious champion romishe facultie may handle leafe therofemanuell byshop angrence portingall popish inquisitour emanuell bishop angrence may dare send title therof familiar felow osorius though otherwise emanuell pestilēt enemie gospel visitour reporteth selfe inquisitour heretiques pleasaūt parasite delicate deuises tully hath pretie sentēce worthy noted place sayth hee wonder ése two southsayers talkyng together refrayne frō open laughter make mentiō blind superstitious opinion euen much marueile truely two worshipfull prelate cā keépe countenaunces meéte together vsing fonde dotyng ceremony touchyng reiectyng bookes name comprehend two alone selfe sweéte brother emanuell rest bicause know certeintie conceaue frendly reason requireth superstitious nycetie begyn declare cause moued inueigh poore defencetwo cause shewed osorius hee writeth agaynst haddog note especiall cause wherof one assigne holynesse religion beyng defiled must necessitie purifie agayne though accused religion rather defend owne though moued cōtrouersie first rather prouoked vndertake defence coūtrey agaynst malicious snarling except perhaps ye opinion porting borne may greater reason cauil agaynst englād english man stād succour see hereafter whereunto tendeth second cause say proceéded dutiefull charitiethe second part excuse osorius might depraue lacke modestie iudgement writinges doe represent know arrogancie seeme place ouer reache much standyng still amased myne owne cōceite seéme gape frendes cōmendations new kinde charitie truely viperous rācour wordes charge christiā brother horrible crime arrogancie neuer saw knewrom 2 paule doth detest charitie pronouncyng man inexcusable whiche iudgeth therfore redreth reason bicause saith iudgeth cōdemneth selfe therfore osorius hym selfe vayne arrogant mā bewrayeth owne beastly canckred stomacke vpbraydyng hawtines haddō especially sithēce demeanour haddon testimonie trust doe know doth farre differre hawtines poysoned pamphlet osorius voyde ciuilitie shamefastnesse shall say babler captious admit one good word mouth hee vtterly disdayneth prayses geue hym denounce artificiall wordes phrase hee thinketh mocke el doe commende vtteraunce stile otherwise doe discommend lacke iudgement knowledge nyce osorius prye narrowly prayses yet cōfesse truth simply reprehended thus iudged first euen iudge still plentifully flowyng apt wordes drowned haue slender vnderstandyng science neither shall neéde long search discouer gallant writyng euen hand exquisite discourse vpon worde priuate whiche expresse peéce meale world may discerne much skill wit osorius name priuate persō signifiethfirst repeate wordes whiche seéme reprehend saweynesse beyng priuate man meére straunger common wealth farre distaunt land sea would yet malapertly write queénes maiestie forthwith moue deépe questiō desire know thought word priuate might signifie carter knoweth doubt therof must sent woman childrē schoole demaūd whether word reproche though time doubt hereof wherein doe erre childishly name priuate doth alwayes signifie difference degreé neuer named way reproche yet contented require taught farther whether person maisters requestes ought restrained prince presence euer heard say came braynes vayne tritler seémely old mā yea bishop daunce thus net doth osorius openly shewe selfe vnskilfull mēs sight hearyng last come pricke yt seémeth rubbe gal ye vpbraide say name priuate though ye iudged word reproche owne dreame osorius fitte rotten mazer name priuate mā deéde truly mē knew bee true wrote letter queénes maiestie yet purchased dignitie byshop yea long time receipt famous epistle reported bishop elect obiect name priuate reproche ye say pray whē name priuate respect contuinelious nay rather many tymes applyed selfe doe know honest honorable personage may therfore know playnly meanyng therein withall learne witte word priuate respect estate onely whē priuate person scarse peépyng cowle yet credited administration publicke functiō nothing sitting personage entermedler fore prince cause especially already established firmely ratified expresse edict agreable cōsent estate meanyng hereby call home vnaduised rashnes nothing seémely degreé purpose thought meanes frendly aduise supposed would better bee reclaymed modestie beyng otherwise vndiscreét nature yet ye make end triflyng immediatly proceéde wise though would say came clownes race fostered base villadge neuer beheld kyng face therefore committed haynous offence worthy punishmēt durst presume write queene elizabeth honor due princely maiestie alwayes name gracious ye ashamed many lye couched one sentence though tooke exception birth parentage could ignoraunt sene kynges personage knowyng certeintie ye dayly conuersaunt kynges court though displeased writyng queénes maiestie whenas reprehend nothing sawey arrogancie slaunderous pen matter great importaūce wherewith nothing acquainted though tedious quarell word priuate ought el bewray grosse ignoraūce shamelesse impudencie whereof one denounceth voyde learnyng dare impudently attempt thinges may easely discerned proude speach aunexed thereunto say aduaunced byshop surmoūt many order fauour authoritie dignitie pray sir whether doth modestie christian prelate appeare disdaineful craking glorious souldiour plautus plautus milite glorioso borne day iupiter came opis c say haue thus stage osorius newly sprong vp proude braggyng thraso vnder visour reuerend prelate vayne painted peacocke make follie apparaunt demaūdeth profoūd questiō end letter deuised first whether make absent distaunce place acquainted enterchaūged affaire yes forsooth doctour euen scholemaisters instruct boyes common scholes hereof pray wherfore doe impute say fault distaūt seuered queene farre land sea loue owe maiesty aduertised letter highnesse matter apperteining establishment estate blamed nothing wrote bicause bent force penne maliciously slaunderously agaynst natiue countrey whiche lesse deare vnto portingall vnto herein surely noted lesse default loue defect wit knowing familiarly acquainted comicall nippe videl owne businesse nothing worth lookyng vnto home may carefully attende affaire others yea also concerne nothyng haue pleasure enough daunce nette selfe vnlesse drawe also rebuke follie makyng speake wordes neuer myne owne deuising though speach write vnto acknowledge pray vnaduised remeritie toung talke face dare presume attēpt queenes maiestie letter mā neuer trayned court neuer aduaunced office common weale altogether vnskilfull ciuill law haue tyme exhibited prince billes supplication whiche right belongeth onely thus concludyng vpon wordes doe perceaue say childish sentēce must needes diudge man halfe frāticke owne foolish lying wordes properly osorius forged hammerhead first would haue yeld wordes bee myne whiche neuer knew thought vtter monstruous speaches wherof neuer dreamed much one sillable mydas would acknowledge aliue much lesse wise sober person would blūder vnlesse bene instructed therunto vayne glorious gentleman osorius tearme thē blockish vnderstand childish former sentēce gladly yeld simply confesse selfe naturall dolt could seéme ignoraūt either either reknowledging momish communication applied vnto bee doltish selfe also deuisor thereof bee wise walthams calfe doe know aud acknowledge much also abuse name colour scoffing toyes already enstalled brawlyng byshop might inuested delicate sicophant accuse one yt doth prohibite godly personage frō due accesse maiestie chargyng also ambition trust dayly conuersation cleare crime myne innocencie shall appeare greater mē much lesse wil venemous quarell preuaile cracke credite person knoweth seémeth also vnto man meane capacitie basenes myne estate become lofty stately lofty pray pouedo chalēge selfe preéheminēce others fauour authoritie dignitie yet self ashamed bragge title whē priuate man boast surmoūt others wit learning yet litle spare vaunt self arrogātly would god osorius would god horned cockescombe puffe vp pride thē seély hūble bils requestes truly thē threé inuectiues haue vomited lesse slaunders reproches denounced charitable man farre deéper diuine ye take occasion yet charge bycause affirmed accused england guiltie horrible noueltie perceiue must plucke spectacle turne owne epistle haue set downe wordes doctrine new gospell new religion brought england brought therewithall also honestie integritie life c little none performed studie new doctrine nay rather euer sithence rashnes vnshamefastnes lechery haue bene embraced place intollerable pride arrogancie haue taken suter footing seditiōs vprores rebelliōs haue bene easily raysed treason haue boldly attēpted royall maiestie haue freely pursued bloud prince c doe hereby name condēne england certeine new gospell accuse gospell forge wickednes confesse say accuse englād england haue smatch logicke wil prayse disprayse london olyssipone england portingall name doth vnderstand england thereby portingall chattering rethorician lumpish logiciā cōceaue indefinite propositiō vse schole terme doth reteine efficacie vniversall whereas write reported vnto great number subiectes remaine old mumpsimus either true vntrue true would easily argue common lyar haue slaundered england certeine new religion generally yet alledge persō particularly turne also reproch promising vndertake defence countrey without dissente mynde yet contrary promise wonderfully dissente frō may man beast iudge mad would promise differre myne aduersary without cōtrary affection mynde haue thē professed haue spoken myne aūswere extant referre bee tryed wherefore good reason haue pardoned english man borne queéne highnes subiect myne aunswere vnto deale somwhat franckly without rācour minde without bitternesse dissention c make promise dispute without disagreéyng stomacke without bitternesse contention peruert saying would differe frō without contradiction cōsent mā cā honestly promise much lesse performe ashamed cold friuolous quarell surely may ashamed therof childish fault commō make euident hereafter place fit ensueth lamentable complaint concernyng death bishop rochestersyr thom thomas moore certein charterhouse monckesiohn fisher byshop rochester say must cruelly murthered england hath euer sithence remained marueilous infamie uerely confesse moore rossens endued great store singular learning lament seé excellent learned men runne headlōg absurde pesfilēt errour preferre foreine extraordinarie power liege soueraigne kyng enacted law land crime deémed high treason requisite subiectes would wilfully infringe law incurre punishment prouided behalfe charterhouse monckes losse lesse much liued selues vnprofitable countrey could alledge nothyng defence custome contumacie statute lawes behalfe prouided could iustly challēged accoūted blameworthie tyme vnlesse whose disliking accept prayse trifle myne aūswere hunt great kennell superfluous wordes plodding often vpon one thyng passe thē ouer bicause note nothyng worthy defence two point carpe ye ordering lawes one euery man particularly may geue voyce though cōmon wealth doth admit custome sūmons made wordes courtes hundred neuer seéne euery particular person bee required poll therfore sentēce liuie greater part preuaileth oftentymes agaynst wiser hath alwayes bene seéne auncient age predecessours also speciall choise beyng selected estate adiudged law greater number approued whiche fewer liked order obserue making lawes doe take together cobbler tynkers butcher cooke mullettours c like dregges outcaste people enquire seuerall opinion ye reduce infinite multitude choice wiser citizes ye accuse v voyces wrested v violently agaynst willes truely el freédome whiche wel knowen mē meanely acquainted proceédynges assembly name parliament vrge v exāples vnsatiable practfling runne backe agayne moore rochester demaunde holy pure person committed small offence pardyemore rochester rightly cō uicted condemned traytors law tell offended nothyng forsooth condemned high treason accoumpted execrable horrible fact vnder heauen cauill say force vsed law iudgement agaynst neither thē syr orderly proceéded agaynst accordyng auncient custome statute realme violated dutie allegeaūce owe vnto coūtrey ordinaunces liege souereigne lord lineally discended true inheritour crowne erected thē selues foreine romish monarche waywardnes opinion worthely punished decestable traytours coūtrey point seémed vnto iudgement propre holy pretie religious men syr expect bald sentence esteéme rushe doe preiudice ordinaunces meéte entermedle v statute whereas haue placed headroll terrours imprisonement chaines horrible punishmentes late byshops endure doe playnly confesse rebellious obstinacie whereby refuse lawfull authoritie intollerable pride pestilent example refused bee ordered expresse knowen authoritie law lament therfore howle loude ye list neuerthelesse rightfully punished well ordered common weales high treason hath bene alwayes accoumpted horrible worthy death prayse purpose writyng queenes maiestie procoedyng zelous affection beare truth publicke sauetie soules auowe solemne protestatiō osorius writing quene vnder pretence charitie goodwill couereth extreme hatred true religion touchyng secretes thoughtes referre ouer god whō take witness herein farre men may discerne wordes phrase speache stile brought new religion england name england generall wordes twise thrise barcke ye whole state religiō accuse ye lawes made touchyng doe violently rend peéces whole ecclesiastical gouernement escape england vnderstandeth latine toūg well also ripe iudgement myndfull selfe hath done cā forget much greuously haue diffamed admit painted satisfaction threé wordes especially beyng manifestly false throughly cōsidereth ye ouerlauish backbytinges rest laboursome volume whereas persuade selfe haue iust cause quarell bycause write behalfe religion herein truly bewray ignoraūce euen rest doynges albeit appointed sphepheard ouer sheepe siluan portingall may therefore sheare fliece frō english foreine sheépe vnlesse bene called thereunto lawfull authoritie vnlesse paule paraduenture appoint ouer euery congregation seuerall pastours vayne especially paul doth charge euery v vocation vse wordes commaundeth v abyde syr beseéch hath called vnto v preach vnto v beyng sent doe gladly vse simple wordes scripturestrue charitie sooner pretēsed wordes thē truely performed deedes burnyng charitie trow whote bold bragges may beleéued shed bloud defence religiō bold bayard easie matter osorius despise tempest quiet calme perillous flaw shall happen sounde therof feare make glorious thraso eftsoones thrust head mousehole bee inuincible courage stand tackle home neéde shall hatred agaynst preacher euery sentence doth swarme manifest stinges scorpion like venime last come downe nearer flat accusation selfe bycause perceaued farced pestilent poyson creépyng couert queénes distinctly beleueth forsooth came late rethoricke dealing surely lord come tyme enough dole controuersie betwixt v doubt shal seare good whote yron printe therof shall remaine while world doth endure vouche agaynst euident witnesse say haue reckoned vp many monster religion confesse much number greater much deadly haue helped pastours cōsidering none founde england selfe seéme also somewhat doubt write monster haue inuaded england hartly reioyce commō wealthes behalfe confesse selfe errour thinke ilād vexed many fury ye confesse length wise wisard wherfore expressely pronoūce wordes recited epistle certeine sauadge herde swinish filthynes crept englād ye first diffame noble iland sincke horrible abomination euen queénes maiestie selfe afterwardes stand dumpe amazed may colorably pray pardon great crime maliciously conceaued doth charitie teach seémely byshop old mā wisedome osorius blameth lacke discretion others seéme satisfied bycause one worde haue ouerthrowen cursed babling sufficeth denied one worde verified one word haue taken vpon accuse spitefully maliciously accusatiō able iustifie must yeld sufficeth ye accused deny vnlesse cōuinced good proofe ought acquired cod de proba lib 〈◊〉 accuse man say iudge materiall sit iudgement court christian doth stretch farre wyde whole world extendeth selfe natiōs ierome osorius hath infamous epistle cited england vnto consistory guiltie doth earnestly perswade defiled maner monstruous abominatiōs yea prefence ye queénes maiestie ye accuse osorius ye much lieth deface nay rather vtterly subuert good estimation noble iland ye lacke argument furnish horrible enterprise ye beleue onely affirmatiue sufficient credite perillous pestiferous exāple deny perceaue haue displayed thing euidently deéde say admit haynously wicked common barretiours subuertours commō weales enemy mankind speaches acknowledge myne nay deéde pernitious pestilent wordes owne whiche though repeated myne owne wordes yet whole sentence wordes owne though ye speake selfe yet ye speake effect one like peruerse sophister also disclose filthy rayling much kynde ignominie crime haynous offence spot beastlynesse sparke impietie could almost reckoned therewith defiled doctrine gospell professours selfe slaunderous inuectiue extant abroad iudge yet though played proper speareman therein though sufficed doggishe eloquence one throughly swallowed vp toylesome irkesommes yet nothyng ashamed barke agayne eares truly greéueth encombred friuolous brauling bycause gallant pedler doth make proude crake braue ware let v seé sith must neédes note diligently metall made osor pag 8i sayd epistle myne quoth nonnes cōsecrated vnto god defiled incestuous mariage osorius cō plaineth subuertyng religion england sayd saintes image established blessed age sauiour iesus christ apostle beyng partes absolutely pure vndefiled neuer acknowledge durtie dregges filthy single life superstitious idolatry cold naked mockery sacramentes ceremony require euery seuerall proofes haue satisfied already euery point much neédefull bluntish aduersary moreouer controuersie debated indifferent iudges onely authoritie sacred tyme sauiour iesus christ lyued vpō earth next age wherein disciple preached would easely confounde crushe peéces scattered stinkyng maymed shadowes religion last alleadgyng nothyng selfe onely deny poysoned accusation onely might suffice reasonable men vnlesse make better demonstration assertion probable argumentes therfore sithence procure guiltie confesse seé must suborne witness accordyng promise meane space recite certeine wordes myne thesethe word haddon cited osorius exclame much may heapyng masse foule word together seeme haue hoorded vp purpose deface painted religiō cutte throates man doth know alone speach myne play tall man wordes hurle cancred stomacke obbraydyng dronkēnes forsooth hereunto haue pretyly stollen wordes cicero agaynst anthonius maisters tooles ye might wounde deéper false crime cicer anthon phil2 pray syr haynous offence blockish errour neuer heard wher milde sober father chargeth wishing sobrietie litle though alwayes drunken bearyng hand though furiously mad would commit monster writyng forsooth please prelacie found two first selfe made ougly new glased religion maner filthy taūtes added thereunto person throates cutte whō man knew selfe say syr true alledge example discouer matter clearely challenge v mainteyne kynde fayth whereby euery man settyng aside sorrow mynde regardyng good workes drowning endeuour charitie promi • eth selfe hope euerlastyng saluation osor pag 9no maner person v doth acknowledge glaueryng fayth man doth defend nay rather men doe abhorre spitte therfore fayth hammered forge owne lye cauill sithence selfe doe pursue opprobrious infamie doe selfe disfigure owne whelpe dishoneste owne creature treatise freéwill bring stage certeine kynde person decked apparelled owne wordes osor pag 9 b el say meant hereby keepe mās reason bondage bereue freedome aduisement man entangle fast snarled perpetuall chaynes whole man doe vnclothe iudgement sense turne ouer spoyled free choyse remaineth difference betwixt stone maner thynges men doe imagine braynes endeuour practise theyr action whether good bad men ascribe god authour therof doe linke together certeine fatall vnaduoydable necessitie enduryng euer tedious talke haue forged vnto v certeine new tyrauntes fearefull deéde neuer haue heard mention tyme meere straungers vnto v broyle gredyerne therfore burne fagot firebrandes eloquence doe scourge none
