therof euer vsurped authoritie exalteth selfe aboue earthly power challenge proclaime open warre agaynst while breath body except finde stronger goliath hetherto returne fox whereof haue noted ouerthrow sondry subtill craftie papacie later age praysed god doth punish vtterly suppresse whole sect heresy although doth acknowledge papane principalitie dare bold vouch england conceaue lesse frendly common weales agaynst forge probable reason contrary vniuersall monarche churche sittyng stately chayre rome ought estoppell byshops england scotland poland germany yea spayne portingall dominion common weale may apprehend hereticques yea punish haue magistrate lacke lawes voyde sense vnderstanding put spectacle osorius behold christian nation marke wel maners people sufficiently prouided common safetie tranquilitie owne peculiar lawes prince gouerne seuerall territory orderly pollicie may administer matter well confute absurdity heresy without tyrannous ierarchy rome touch heretique region like furthermost part world seuered costes italy except gad rome pelting oracle iustifie osorius wisedome old man altogether voyde learnyng experience discretion also yea rather pope heretiques layd handes vpon euen also rigour law executed agaynst neither foxe foside crafty reason alluded vnto thē vtterly friuolous vnskillfull ye skippe salomon paule write maner osorius pag 18 b therfore paule second epistle thessaloniās denyeth may come passe antichrist shall come departyng fayth first somewhat straunge note place surely good tyme haue ye done euen vnshamefast imprudencie taken tardy paule pronounceth place lord iesu christ shall come departyng fayth first lord sauiour christ haue placed antichrist paules wordes thesead thessa 2 cap 2 let man deceaue meanes lord shall come except come departyng first sonne perdition reuealed caught osorius entangled snatch ye escape ashamed depraue paules sentence blasphemously execrable impietie horrible ignoraunce place antichrist steéde christ sonne perdition place lord iesu though paule spoken deéde beastly proceéde confirmation babylonicall empire sentence paule pestilently peruerted profession byshop diuinitie osorius downe pecockes tayle away arrogancie collhardy write hereafter aduisedly take better regard penne lest bryng name odious contempt christendome take pleasure wordes wrest ye list handle paule discreétly learnedly plentyfull example heaping together iohn husse ierome prage martin luther many others affirmeosorius pag 18 b haue reuolted romishe monarche set purposebycause beyng exempt frō iurisdiction might freely licentious writyng speakyng doe ye coniecture vayne southsayer men laudable conuersation voyde maner ryotte culpable notorious haynous crime therefore may duely charged suspition dissolute behauiour lyued alwayes discreétly soberly trifle defame fewe person name rushe vpon england open mouthpag 19 though abolishyng romishe monarche forthwith caried violētly vnbridled lust false suggestion leaue syr assoone shaken foreine yoke shoulder yelded selues lawfull authoritie souereigne prince thynges went better peacibly v especially later age gospell renewed beyng cōpared elder yeares wherein romish prelate insolently treade vpō triumph ouer v may wel adiudged haue enioyed blessed prosperitie heauēly benefite victorious ilād doth thākefully cōfesse neuer haue receaued greater hand god god inestimable mercy graunt may permanent vnto worldes end weé humbly submittyng selues naturall liege souereigne vnited together duetyfull amitie may estraunged extraordinarie babilonicall idoll turnyng ouer fraternitie euer ye runne foreward lye rehearsing rable sectes doe imagine haue entred sithence banishmēt pope pag 19 though old time great swarmes sectes wherof paul doth oft premonish v though raged wonderfully tyme godly father augustine whose hart boyle wrate great volume pestiferous errours though sacred father peter successour pope liberius mainteyner poysoned canker arrius though celestine anastase second stoute champion horrible scorpion nestorius obiect sectes age euer wanted dare boldly name sectes threé romish graundsiers mighty patrones selues two pernitious errours affirme godly father maliciously belyed call forth alphonse alphonsus de castro contra haeret lib 4 cap 4 moncke spanyard borne ought bee credite beyng prelate portingall worthy successours peter excellent pillers christ church forsooth cōmit sheépe vnto wolues deliuer people god bloudy butcher yet blush nothing blame faction sectes v whiche reporte exercise perpetuall warre one diuersitie contrary opinion proceéde hereof pardy bycause seruitude libertine celestines say arrians nestorian would haue contrarietie amongest later sort writer bee monstruous dissention hath burst amōgest frier monckes hath euer sharper stormes bene raysed betwixt schoolemen brawlyng oftentymes moates sunnepag 19 rush vpon lutheran zuinglians name first doe besides matter bycause defend stand countrey defende england vndertake cause litle britaine wherein abide while breath body prouoke enemyes el doubt shall easely finde yet meane space recite wordes whereby men may know manifest iniuries vomite agaynst soules sweéte personage vsually blunder aduenture whatsoeuer franticke braynes doe imagine proceéde accusation zuinglians doe inueighe agaynst lutheran anabaptistes keepe continuall warres zuingliās osori pag 19 b thrust also coelestianes interemistes name scismes first contradiction betwixt luther zuinglius principall pointes christian religion doe differ sacrament eucharistie substaunce thereof maner presence christ yet perhaps quarell wordes matter haue onely wickedly transubstātiated speake like schooleman sauiour iesus christ bread monstruous deuises also thrust vpon v vj hundred lye euery one contrary while amaze eares myndes christian absurde newfangled doctrine therfore graund captaine schoolemen peter lōbard peter lombarde doubtfull conflict broyling turmoyling selfe throughly wearied mockery doth conclude last transubstantiation ought bee inuiolable autenticke authoritie church rome cā founde scripture anabaptistes name without reason ignoraūt vniuersall consent church haue condemned vnto luther zuinglius earnest enemy maistershyp brotherhoode surely common wealth reteine footyng coūtrey know cā heare maner men celestianes would fayne learne durtie cōpanion angrence bycause haue geuen name first farre perceaue sortes interemistes name gesse notyng men make certeine qualification religion haue patched vp certeine booke peéuishe romish dregges haue entituled name interim true came braynes reckon two souldiours graundcaptaines vnder banner commentarie interim say owne owne doctours whole doctrine tractable tyme mariage priestes receauyng sacrament vsing necessitie present tyme rest much gorgiously garnishe romish kyngdome therefore last place fondly foolishe affirme owne chieftaines displayed banner vnder enemyes enseignes truly either memory slipperie wittes went wollgatheryng ouer earnest slaunderous imagination yet much miscontented men likewise bycause seéme varie amongest selues correct vse intricate wordes leaue alter turne blotte old make new place c name place suppose meane common place scripture litle bookes common place ought haue remembred grecian prouerbe secōd determination accōpted wiser first neither thyng resemble christian modesty nearely amend selues neéde requireth haue notable example hereof aurel augustine made booke errours entitled retractation retractation august predicament say apprentice addicted bondslaues drowsie dreames dayly practize whereof hath betwitched sens strēgth truth cā mollifie hart cloyed altogether phantasticall puddle schoolemyre howsoeuer shall remaine stiffenecked selues ought yet reproue modestie others whiche fashion selues nearest christian simplicitie neither exāple tyme cōmendable church christ augustine seé stinckyng reward haue gotten pursuyte sectary yet besturred stumpes hādsomely triumph wordes replie generall consent betwixt sprang luther disagreement contradiction opinion much better bene haue reuerenced lead whereat scorne much haue opened gappe mōstruous pestiferours errours aunswere metie question concerne nothyng english man lutherane stand england luther agaynst yet pronoūce also generall consent amongest lutheransthere disagreement amōgest lutheran disagreément contradiction opinion sticke fast augustine cōfession suffer selues drawen confession say allow neither matter question maner confession howsoeuer certeine lutheran perseuer stedfastly thereincoelest anabap interem rest whiche heape together either fayned coyned banished men well v el owne sweéte sworne brother sauyng haue somewhat modestie discretion therfore slender argumēt enduce reuerence lead except leaddish nature sithence haue shronke tackle forsaken leaden bulles monarche succourlesse shipwracke without helme cable dispayred perplexitie esteémed onely leadden woodden durtie aduocate also romish monarchie least thyng may filthy durte yet ye may better proceéde spitte handes take hold wordes came thundercracke eares heauenly authoritie sacred scripture made conscience afrayde compelled v abandonne forsake men tradition putte whole confidence onely freémercy god well acknowledge speache myne owne yea gladly also finde nothyng therein blameworthy sayth osorius grace doe ye say gramercy luther sayth hee linked fast singular benefite abandonne fearefulnes matter lord planet hath distempered haue nothyng luther doctrine fayth shewed conscience terrified authoritie sacred scripture constrained fleé freé mercy god say luther hath written erroniously touchyng fayth forsooth two hang together like sicke man dreame man would argue wise osorius impudent rayler ergo companion angrence perfect logician ashamed cite whole sentence writer beyng vnable frame probable obiections agaynst one concernyng luther albeit haue vndertaken defende haue oftentymes protected yet doe suppose neither interpretour yt scripture ought bee admitted vpon euery particular assertion haue relation whole discourse meanyng authour especiall regard bee vnto luther deéde ought shalbe founde profounde scholemaster fayth good workes farre excell learnyng ye shall worthy beare bookes howsoeuer delight selfe gnaw vpon wordes vnaduisedly throwen heate disputation way stūble also straw myne bycause wrate haue forsaken reiected tradition men many • gglyng wordes challenge v beholdyng herein luther zuinglius melancthon bucer caluin peter martyr ouer tedious toylesome lucke hoped dispute learned discrete diuine would without good grounde haue blamed nothyng vsed cauillatiōs finde contrary pestered fonde brabblyng clatterer delightyng altogether vncessaunt chatteryng snatcheth snarleth thynges ratified approued men therfore constrayned play child agayne principle diuinitie doth question must debated wherof man hauyng skill ignoraunt maner therfore haue cast away traditiōs men lord sauiour iesu christ hath pronounced gospell vnder person esay propet vayne worshyppe teachyng doctrine tradition men lord iesu litle rebuked phariseismath 25 haue made frustrate sayth commaundement god owne tradition geue eare vnto men men one teach contrary god despise set naught enen doe allow luther bucer rest long explane mystery sacred scripture vnto v wherein famous men haue oftentymes trauailed cōmendably though iangle neuer much agaynst beggerly fragmentes man inuention beyng without couer scripture yea rather contrary though also doe warraunt vnto v receaue taught sufficiently enough thinke haue forsaken peltyng phantasy men likewise conceaue notable learned father whose workes wilbe thākefully embraced while world doth endure though slaūderously barcke neuer much yet deny subiect sinne errours happened also auncient father augustine tertullian origine cyprian sometymes wandred way estranged truth yet compare time heretofore compare • ate writer auncient father cauill agaynst iudge beseémeth professe seruauntes god whereas vpbrayde v maner lyfe reportes cursed enemyes follow herein owne gyddy brayne true innocencie neuer desire better witness filthy slaunderous backbyters wherin request pardoned much vnreasonable much boldly defend without regarde grauitie byshop naturall duetie honest man scattered rumour rashly conceaued headles report steéde well knowen approued offence also seéme mislike matter intollerable commende prosperous raigne queénes maiestie herein coūsell seé tyme come troublesome estate prince queénes highnes belike without aduise osorius cōceaue matter wherof man ignoraunt meanely practized dayly action mās life haue eye owne charge siluan ye carefull maiestie surmountyng knowledge wisedome regardeth peéuishe dotyng counsell especially beyng conceaued rather malice true religion loue safetie ye keépe great sturre tumultes fraunce complayne much treason conspired agaynst kyng safetie person aduersaries required bloud onely whole bloud royall rooted fraunce licencious venemous toūg worthy pluckt rootes execrable mouth except recant tyme dare presume impudently make guiltie cruell horrible treason many worthy personage ye florishyng realme namely kyng selfe open proclamation acknowledged agaynst rayle pestiferously deare kinsman beloued subiectes beyng armes concerned generall safetie fraūce many variable vnciuill malicious rumour haue bene blowen abroad many place touchyng ciuill warres neuer man heard haue spoken blockishly barbarously voyde reason monstruously gentleman speaketh beyng byshop old man therfore shall lesse wonder rashnesse impudencie controuersie religiō hereafter seyng sauadge boldnesse detestable bloudy accusation greater part fraunce without cause without reason without proofe matter reason doe openly fayle wrangle wordes bycause named luther doctrine agaynst stand stoutely doe deadly hate shall say captious bussardly sophister terme though defend bycause depraue bycause peruert iumble lyeng discerned haue mishapen whereas otherwise selfe comfortable treasure gospell somewhat infected poysoned contagiō childish errours latter dayes inestimable benefite god discouered clensed commendable industrie singular learned diuines luther bucer caluin melanchton others though despise pleasure yet whē osorius shalbe dead rotten name reuerend prelate portingall remembraunceosorius ignoraunce iudgement triflyng word name wilbe commended eternitie immortall prayse man esteéme besides foolish vnskilfull handlyng matter wherof entreate altogether ignoraunt proprietie wordes wherein may seéme make pretie shewe thinke spokē vnproperly videl sluggishnes awakened dulnes pricked forward say drousie prelate truly sleape soūdly yt snorte agayne cā deny kynde speach mā may awakened sleape pricked forward beyng dull learne gospell blynd see lame doe walke leaper cleansed deafe heare dead ryse agayne luce 7 wordes sauiour doe argue blynd see lame doe walke whiche blynde lame restored sight walkyng learne againe cicero cicero pro mar coelio speaketh wise let yoūg men obserue boundes owne chastitie lest defile chastitie others lest consume patrimonie deuoured wt debt let offer force virgines dishonestie chast infamie ye vertuous c virgines defloured surely long virgines allurement may carried frō shamefastnes cā chast defiled truely yet chastitie may seduced processe tyme loosenesse learne last old prouerbe emplyeth whereby forbidden pricke foreward willyng prouerbe admit also spoken properly enough dull bee pricked foreward sluggish awakened neither would haue euer gaynsayd vnlesse malice owe vnto drowned sences good sooth ashamed osorius haue bene lōg agoe neither would contend bluntish blockish person determined open euidētly senselesse aduersary holy father england hath vnmeasurable bragger besides vayne sounde friuolous wordes mettall founde hereafter therfore spende litle labour may willyng touche ought huge lumpe idle wordes scattered abroad euery without reason measure necessitie cause require haue waded accustomed grosse rayling agaynst lyfe preache • imputyng vnto maner wickednesse sinagogue swarmeth euidently recite last certeine wordes vouched augustine followeth augustine doth greuously cōplayne tyme rabble beggerly ceremony ouerwhelme churche christian estate iewes much tollerableosori fol 24 osorius affirmeth neuer read sentence augustine well cite augustine owne wordes theseaugust epist19 although bee founde agaynst fayth yet doe ouerwhelme religion selfe mercy god willed freély exercised vnder fewe euident sacramentes seruile burden estate iewes much tollerable though knew tyme libertie subiect onely ordinaunces law men constitution say haue cited augustine truly doth speake selfe wordes playnly speake doth hee render reason also state iewes tollerable ceremony beyng cō fessedosorius vanitie také tardy ignoraunce linked wt singular vnshamefastnes manifestly conuinced deny may rather bycause yeld truth open light manifest lyers winked though bee byshops lyke maner ouerseéne godly father ierome requiryng person searche scripture learne would notwithstandyng coyne v ierome iero ad marcel epist cuius initium est mensur charit non habet contrary doctrine bycuase wrate vnto paulinus certeine person hauing vnderstandying commendable cōuersation lyfe handle scripture licenciously whiche speach would haue vnderstoode el certeine wicked person doe abuse benefite scripture wherof wise mā doth doubt ouerseéne therfore ierome foolishly wyde matter obiect ierome agaynst hym selfe seéke satisfied herein peruse chrisostome chrisost 1 3 concione de lazaro hath written matter much plentyfully nothyng bee copious manifest praysed basile besides also later monckes obserued basiles rule men suffred lest losse osorius denyeth affirmeth doe contend men chastitie selfe say dotterell happeneth rehearse name chastitie whereof made mention face make nation guiltie monstruous barbarous crueltie though employed whole endeuour rootyng chastitie coastes whereas kynde sauagenes seéne amongest turkes proue example certeine charterhouse monckes forsooth whiche worthely executed hygh treasō xxx yeares past men say would haue yelded wicked decree mariage haue bene acquited punishment though estate wedlocke realme accoumpted punishment though constrayne monckes marry wiues agaynst willes though impudent father shamelesse byshop cā vtter thing word deéde sensibly bealcheth foolish filthy speaches agaynst common weale beyng voyde credite truth hauing droppe probabilitie let v heare worthy conclusion deépe wise man hath brought lurdeines mockemonckesof suppression monkes admit sayth hee greater part full filthynes therfore forth necessarie suppresse whole order first doe notably defend order confesse full vice deny subuerted order disorderous runneagates reduced commō societie subiectes commoditie meanes wholesome statute lawes deéde traytours executed accordyng desert belonged equitie rest remoued stinckyng smynestyes defiled lazynes fithynes deliuered whole iustie publicke labour exercise prouide liuyng accordyng brotherly charitie meane space say forsooke order dominicke benedicte barnarde frauncisce portingall hath many perfect professours let portingall reteine ioselles god name hold selues contented heauenly oracle whiche heard heauenluce3 thou art welbeloued sonne well pleased doe attende vpon harken vnto prophetes apostle withall performe profession baptisme farre forth frayltie man nature permit teacher rule order neither esteéme admit also feéle throughly know superstitious vanitie herein inueigh bytterly agaynst bycause compare later deuines maner commēdation auncient father herein turmoyle selfe wonderfully shoote randone lord make comparison betwixt euer thought compare together therefore striue vayne whole turkish eloquence worthe straw meanyng declare auncient father agreé deuines example sake noted specially common place reseruyng rest conuenient place bycause expounded ouerthrow course abuse tyme myne reader friuolous lye seéme ouer eloquent haue aduersary highly offended bycause prayse luther let coūber prayse prayse worthy man posteritie also studious trauaile enlargyng gospell remaine yt worldes end euerlastyng renowme though chaufe fume neuer much agaynst yet thinke like vnto besides durty pigge angrence sweéte cabbemnate resemblyng seémeth nature maners nearestluther vntruly charged vprores germany accuse luther authour vprores germany herein reporte manifest vntruth man earnestly defend obedience due magistrate higher power luther whereas adde hereunto tumultes sueuya erre therein childishly switzers farre vnlike vnto nature situatiō maners discipline accuse also rayler agaynst prince amongest name emperour famous henry worthy memory george duke saxone helye caesar impudētly luther reuerence humbly deéde mainteine cause gospell agaynst kyng somewhat sharpely confuted epistle written agaynst first afterward beyng amended reformed doctrine hee embraced louyngly aduaunced kynde honorable title lōg tyme instructed george duke saxonegeorge duke saxone sweéte aduertisementes perswaded called vpon hym incessaunt prayer supplication duke hard harted selfe waxed insolently obstinate thynges would make ende spoyling turmoyling god people lurther beholdyng lamentable ruine christian brother round bitterly inueighe agaynst trayterous outrage duke george induced thereunto example holy prophet agaynst prince iuda • iesu christ sauior agaynst herode tetrarche1 kyngs 18 luke18 last conclude luther preachyngs tende prouoke people sedition shamelesse toūg would delude v man read luther bookes selfe would abuse age heapyng lye vpon lye witnesse agaynst luther left behynde many pledge christian humilitie wrote bookes man constantly mainteined authoritie magistrate mā often inculcate plentyfully preach vehemently imprinte earnestly exact christian obedience writyngs extaunt liuely florishyng whole searyng yron detractiō marke backbiter euerlasting reproch great manifest errour made ensueth greater farre horrible agaynst renowmed prince notable common weales yea matter high treason degreés reuerend prelase aduaunceth shamelesse execrable vanitie much men may iudge onely haue forgotten truth modestie also vtterly abandoned matter hee affirmeth apparaunt lewes kyng hungarie great multitude christian slayne battell folly wickednes luther luther charged ouerthrow hungarian vntruly hereof ensued conquest buda turkishe emperour venemous toung bee detested men haue loue truth regard humanitie doubt ignoraunt peruerse dissembler lamentable death king losse buda came onely outragious vnmeasurable rashnes cowled prelate tomorraeus archb tholossetomorraeus archb tholosse bewitched ye people hautie arrogaunt preachyng rushed headlong small weake handfull agaynst huge hoste inuincible power solyman much ye conquest solyman selfe could keépe countaunce smilingly scorned insolencie hungarian vnaduisedly yelded hand kyng slayne kyngdome spoyled true ye know perfectlypaulus iouius 23booke history doth paulus iouius chief counsell report story parcell meale yea euery title therof euer man besides franticke charge luther therewith place selfe doth conuince wherein tyme scarse lutheran set footyng tyme doth confute luther name yet scarsely knowen circumstaunces history doe condemne whiche doe cry agaynst monkishe archbyshop tholosse pityfull losse lamentable effusion christian bloud haue declared paulus iouius maruell hee franckely coyne lye agaynst region farre distant v hee spareth presse vpon v englishman english exectable lyeosorius slaūder touchyng death kyng edward sixt hee affirmeth edward sixt royall kyng famous memory haynously poysoned childhode monstruous beast beyng portingall borne impudently diffame region ye horrible crime without likely probable proofe swētie yeares spent gone sober discreét english man euer conceaue thought mynde phisitians reported dyed consumption affirmed groomes priuy chamber whiche keépe cōtinuall watch sicke kyng subiectes beleue confessed truth neither could slaunderous fable haue bene blowen abroad amongest tattlyng woman foolishe child malicious english loselles like vnto yet could rotten vnfauorie cauill haue discreét authour bene whispered asse head osorius coupleth hereunto caesar saith betrayed destroyed treason ouerthrow emperour truely caesar onely pursue also vanquishe germaines chasing germanie great army spanish italian souldiours ouerthrow germaines shooke well might last warres raysed maurice purported successe tooke passe ouer blame dead confesse victorious emperour hee lyuedosor slaū derous lye touchyng poysonyng queene mary ioyneth queene mary princesse raigned lately also auoweth haue bene destroyed poyson euer beleéued reported railyng scorpion english nation straūgers yt england manifestly reproue condemne malicious shamelesse impudencie raunged tyme certeine outragious burnyng feauer infected estate ye realme amōgest restthe death queene mary shortned liues richest honorable personage tyme queéne mary many thing commendable monethes dyed disease like maner cardinall poole death cardinal poole excellent learned mā beyng sicke quartan departed world tyme demaunde • ery mala • ertly matter manifest confessed whether vnderstode thyng conspiracie wherewith wicked men practized destruction queene mary cardinall poole ueryly simply confesse neuer matter spoken writtē fayned surmised vnlesse madde dogges selfe hauyng el nothyng snarle barcke houle ye cloudes moone starres many tymes owne shadowes tell v tale flying vapour drousie dreames osorius imagined rotten mazer clatter matter whereof neither man el euer heard could heare one word except might chaunceably light vpō synon osorius trayning could craftie conueyaunce make mowlehill seéme mountaine foreine mariage queene marythe foreine mariage queéne somewhat displeasaunt first gaynsayd men armes yet nothyng attempted agaynst highnes person neither man dreame returne cardinall poole englād tyme solemnization mariage proceéded peacyble order euery limme monstruous lye trusht peécesosorius doth accuse fraunce highe treason hereunto osorius annexoth place fit vprores treason outrage ouerthrowes religion fraunce haynous offence holy prelate boldly chargeth ye greater nūber nobilitie fraūce amongest enterlaced royall bloud many vertuous honorable personage whose godlynes integritie life much deteste outragious insolencie toung thraso voyde truth modestythraso many probable presumption conceaued person suspected sowe first seédes tragicall tumulte fraunce imitate iunaticke waywardnesse accusing nobilitie neither pursue man besides dotyng dearlyng dalmada angrénce yet much miscontentedly also cleane contrary milde inclination nature hautynes hath altered modestie excessiue pride hath distempered broken gall patience especially whose arrogancie passeth measure accompt sufficient pinche saély abiect grashopper dalmada chase let v returne henry scottish king whō affirme cruelly murthered high treason miserable murthering henry scottish kyng truly say well herein age neuer seéne horrible acte committed lamentable slaughter kyng ye disclose traytors name person ye conceale parcell fact notorious murther matter say manifest lutheranes executed bloudy practize lutheranes enterprised former abhominations lutheranes tyme age haue raysed trouble tumultes agaynst prince agaynst common weales cursed franticke scalpe blystered blasphemous toung cursed swynishe sens whiche wroote together rootes wickednesse oppresse poore innocent lutheranes withall false haue suggested surmise neuer entred thought discreét person much dreame haue shewed particularity kyng scotlād haue reserued last maketh agaynst sect marke say owne sect trayterously entrapped smoulthered death gunnepower could declare order thereof determined dwell former purpose vnto ende detect person besides agaynst whome neighter person exclame sufficiently also great blocke eye sayd luther man god gaue vnto right euen truely doe call vncharitable person voyde christian loue slaunderour prince backbiter common weales forge lying adde also hereunto truly ye bondslaue lucifer runne ouer certeine cō mon place luther rende peéces wonted guise shamelesse impudencie without proofe without reason without example without witte lyke lordly comptroller like emperour rather whose authoritie may gaynesayd wherof haue resolued part first aunswere rest wil confute place whē shall come nearer diuinitie glorious prelate afterwardes graue father inueigheth agaynst lyfe luther erasmus reporteth haue bene commē ded personserasmus commendable report luther whiche man hath reproued hetherto besides doctour dottipoll yet pike iust quarell agaynst manner hee somewhat sharpe writynges last shewe selfe colour foule mouthed gentleman depraueth defileth death godly man christian fayth men present wondred thereat pray god may accomplishe end approcheth haue spoken luther sufficiently whose lyfe doctrine vndertake defende person el onely purpose acquite famous iland deare natiue countrey vnmeasurable shamefull rayling luther golden couple father martyr bucer well enough shielded owne armour vertue pietie whose estimation bycause could meanes empaire affirme true credites sake graūt ye deny doe impudently deny wordes thyng whiche know bee haynously handled dayly practize much better bene osorius haue defended worshyppyng image well ye could though without colour truth thē stoutly deny woman childrē sée dayly hourely frequented church yea selues authours therof ministryng example others haue lost witte modestie dayly manifest abuse séeme idolatryezechias cōmaūded image taken downe broken peéces herein selfe wonderfully cōmende marre therfore owne matter osorius owne example ye graunt worshyppyng image damnable defiled poysoned idolatry ye deny men present euer heretofore tyme blockish senselesse beleue godlynesse included image withall yeld selues accoūpted madde buzzardly blynd iustified agaynst el ye whenas throw selues prostrate picture neuer make end almost embracyng lickyng kissyng deckyng presentyng giftes goyng pilgrimage vnto call vpon inuocate image dead person proper name saintes pictured keépe sturre stockes stone confesse neuerthelesse thē neither vertue sense selues surely worse thē rotten blockes geue reuerēce dead stockes sticke somewhat neare skinne matter people israell ye know chosen nation holy kinred peculiar elect people yet absence moyses forged golden calfe beleued image onely lyfe sense open mouth professe also god yea god brought land egypt commaunded image borne cōduct iourney added hereunto blasphemous wordes alsoexod 32 thy god israell whiche brought passe thou deliuered land egipt followeth yet aaron seyng erected aultar say osorius truely though conceaue neuer well selfe loue coūtrey meéte neuer much yet beleéue suppose countrey men soeuer deare vnto god child israell tyme deéme selfe holy thē aaron therfore seé manifest idolatry make proude bragges innocencie nation happely say dayes memory matter sticketh finger ye therefore bryng home euidently disproue ignoraūce vnaduised follie people testimony owne fraternitie truly contented doe paint idolatry playnly sight men seé willyng seé well disposed person may doubt thereof hereafter peraduduenture eye dazell corruption dayly custome happened cerberus sence hercul fur dogge hell sodenly drawen darcke doungeon bright sunne shyne firstthe papistes taken tardy committyng manifest idolatry graunt suppose papisticall godmakers yeld vnto transubstantiated white wafer inclosed certeine diuine essence onely substaunce bread flowen quyte away know whither accident bread remayne first witte roundnes white colour like hereof followeth necessitie euen owne argument soeuer doth worshyp ye white colour externall thyng therof subiect sens spectible view manifest idolatour aunswere place lord beseéch sparckle oftene fayth tell simple vnlettered people cluster heapes together altares heaue vppe handes knocke brestes reuerently behold humbly worshyp white rounde singyng cake holden betwixt finger lifted ouer heades lord sauiour christ iesu selfe say seély rude multitude doth humble selues moued affection discerne betwixt accidentes bread substaunce surely nation deépely seéne logicke cannot may rightly conclude vpon supposition owne deuines commit open idolatry bycause worshyp onely essence god farre hidden within wholy remoued sens also outward signes behold seé eye taken osorius neither escape either must serape decreés canōs procure mortall hatred el must neédes cōfesse dayly idolatry people except ye deny outwarde forme bread worshypped wherein witnes agaynst neéde shall require therfore fayned god may euidently founde culpable euidēt idolatry errour much apparant remayne wherein learned reader may desirous spend tyme second booke ashamed say vse many wordes confutatiō booke modestly done confesse fault vnmeasurable braulyng hath altogether weryed opinion others also haue séene writyng one cōsent wōderfully condēne idle superfluitie toung old man yet sée amendement ye procéede many fable vtter wherby men may perceaue induced writyng iudgement discretion enflamed excessiue malice violēt outrage neither yt person grayheaded yeares ought wise bee acquainted whereas reporte seeme haue taken wonderfull pleasure litle booke herein follow example wayward men whiche estéemyng men affection owne opinion scarse mā el well disposed bycause bee vndiscréete selues begyn quarell ouerthrowe sacramentes wherewith say also séeme somwhat defence ye therfore might well haue referred contention touchyng doctrine selues yet presume say much way deale vngently herein scold importunately agaynst good name plead owne cause adde hereunto mē learnyng vertue thē able remoue penne though bee neuer cruell bootcherly crueltie side neuer sauadge fire fagot cōsume myndes godly new maister dispatcheth thyngs scoffes petie questiōs demaundeth v vnderstanded sacramentes doe reteine first doe vse sacrament taken tardy common lyar agaynst v especially rayled litle earst sacramentes vtterly abolished preacher haue many witness touched yt place tyme massemōgers cowled lozelles whose eares wretched rude people might particularly whisper offence without goodly confession value pleaseth say rehearse confession christiā men cōcernyng confession truly ought haue made mention therof bycause cōmaundement cā restrayned priest onely extēdeth selfe person indifferently belongeth lesse common prayer mutuall confessioniames last chap euident iames owne wordes lastly say vse wordes christ manifestly commit vnto priestes iurisdictiō soule osorius ye well truly vse place would god would abuse corrupt fouly osorius laudable wholesome order apostle remittyng offence whiche vsed prayer openly spoken name lord iesu depraue certeine authoritie owne blynd corner either lucre powlyng penny someother worse matter straunge toung thrust v vnto market confession gather preceptes good lyfe massemongers cowled frier blynd guide blind maruell truely though sheépe siluain fall together ditche length hee bringeth forth inuincible argumēt doth testifie selfe earnest protestation mercena • ie confessiō holy ghost hath wrought goodnesse meane confession doth playnly confesse confession hath bene schoolemystres nurse godlynes much hath one sparkle loue god hee speaketh besides whiche hath bene reuealed vnto illumination eare confession first maister doctour easely persuaded bee true speake selfe next ashamed wery haue altogether hanged vpon cōfession neither prayer study preceptes holy scripture haue preuailed respect enduce mynde godlynesse beyng grayheaded deuine man threé score yeares almost also beleue either haue bene blockheaded scholer maisters confession vnlucky many yeares much buzzing eares many cō ferences godly matter could worke nothyng el thē shape madde byshop senselesse priest epicure know accustomed glory hee neuer instructour philosophie beleue quoth cicero bene taught thyng would neuer haue written absurdely euen like maner may beleue man better thē osorius selfe neuer schoolemisters besides confession wicked corrupt schoolemysters hatched proude hautie sholer standyng owne light despiser others importunate brauler prattlyng sophister shamelesse rayler vnmeasurable slaūder peruertour holy scripture true godlynes much better bene lesse conference massemongers bene acquainted paule hee would haue instructed sobrietie modestie iustice pietie fayth charitie patience meckenesse whereof seéme haue le • rned title sweéte confession much heard whether matter euer haue bene farre wyde doth speach reason dissent disagreé altogether estraūged yet ye proceéde notwithstandyng desperate trauaile confession beyng staggeryng ready fall doe vnderproppe workes least fall grounde thus ye write yet notwithstandyng doe content selues confession sinnes exact fruites repentaūce vse name satisfaction word scorne insolētly behold fine scholer confession well poolished ye schoole massemongers hee hath learned christian required bryng foorth fruites worthy repentaunce deépe profounde doctrine though cobbler carter euer deny ignoraunt point haue coupled hereunto new companion meare straunger christiā eares say fruites repentaunce named name satisfactiōs know well massemōgers frier schoolemen haue thrust church new wicked name satisfaction know also haue done great shame reproch manifest vntruth contrary holy scripture contrary doctrine sacred apostolicque church contrary iudgements approued auncient father heare iohn say exhorting confessed faultes bryng forth fruites worthy repentaunce adde wordes repeated great maister worthe pure chosen vessell god paule doth teache maner1 cor 4 guiltie thyng yet iustified hereby paules vndesiled conscience cleare crime auaylable iustification necessitie owne satisfactiōs sect lame cripled let v learne paule whe • ce true christian ought fetche full satisfaction absolute perfection christ sayth hath one onely oblation made perfect euer whiche sanctified one onely sacrifice christ offred vp altar crosse satisfaction perfection witnessing shalbe euer onely also shalbe made perfect tyme come doe beleue paule doe beleue iohn doe beleue christ beleue companion fit company withall namely pharisies whiche scorned christes preachyng vnto saydluce 16 iustifie selues men god knoweth hart whiche glorious sight men abhomination god take heéde osorius take heéde say yt nūber pharisies lest god abhorre turne face frō glorious satisfactiōs shyne neuer gorgiously sight mē cauill old maner tell agaynst vanitie deuines wherein braule lest fill whole uolumes superfluous matter meéte thynges onely wherein seémeth matter cōtrouersie bryng sit elegant cause surely whereby would shewe confesse god alone rather fleé confessours god say easily perceaued v hee hath appointed vicares earth whiche exercise authoritie would refuse would refuse god selfe c first ye deny god cā clearely perceaued though sight god necessarie ye dānation sinner lumpish osorius fit cowled asse companiō you1 tim vlt ad heb • vlt mā euer hath sene god cā seé yet christ offer vnto god father sacrifice thankesgeuyng magnifie holy name matter apperteineth sight eye apperteineth mynde inward seélyng soule clyming vnto god harty sorrow sighyng neuer throwen downe beholdyng infinite goodnesseezech 33 liue sayth lord take pleasure death sinner rather wicked conuerte wicked way liue ye conuerted therfore ye conuerted wicked wayes wherfore ye dye ye house israel like gētlenes doth sauiour iesus christ call v vnto come vnto ye laden refresh geue thirstie well life freely yet osorius beleueth bycause ye absence christ uicares must substituted paule taught v farre otherwise sayingapoc 21 lord neare vnto call vpon name christ teacheth farre otherwise selfeapoc 3 behold stand doore knocke mā heare voyce opē vnto gate enter vnto suppe hee sweéte comfortable voyce lord sauiour iesus christ may throughly rooted inward partes soule easely rase abolish priuy blind buzzyng eares massemongers frier osorius sticketh fast substitution mainteineth earnestly apostle assigned christes uicares earth whiche supply iurisdiction enterlace owne definitiue sentence false god ielous god geue honour hee hath appointed uicare holy scripture doth acknowledge word neither apostle entermedle iurisdiction surmise false quite contrary heauenly prerogatiue apoc 1 christ onely hath keyes hell death christ onely slayne lambe lyon tribe iuda roote dauid openeth booke louseth seuen seales therof neither besides heauen earth vnder earth could open booke looke apoc 5 lord iesus beyng raysed death appearyng vnto apostle spake vnto manermath 28 power geuen vnto heauē earth power neuer iote empaired respect neuer shalbe commission apostle christ selfe doth open selfe place goe ye therfore teach nation baptising name father sonne holy ghost teachyng obserue saying haue commaū ded embassie apostle commissiō iurisdiction speake playnly bluntly function office authoritie keyes heauen remission sinnes whatsoeuer el kynde must applyed paule doth comprehend briefly wordesad cor 4 let men esteeme v minister christ stewardes mystery god uicares thē osori minister ye iudges constitute lawes wickedly take vpō ye stewardes dispose ye mystery god lest ought bee belongeth doctrine christ apostle massemongers confessours haue romishe doctrine whereby doe receiue seély rude people runnyng heapes vnto rehearsing sinnes priuily close corner superstitiously haue vttered listeth pronounce ouer power absolution straūge language steade satisfaction enioyne fastyng dayes long would god sweéte peter alyue agayne heare franticke slaunder agaynst forsooth would easely suppres brawlyng toung chaynes holy scriptres tame waywardnes therfore albeit god hath called hence vnto selfe let v imagine hee alyue fewe wordes confutyng cursed declamation maner first allthe aunswere peter martyr agaynst prolopopo • ia osorius may take reuerend prelate beyng old man deuine byshop first choppe call wicked man whereas knowen vnto haue euer bene sene • haue deserued euill brotherly loue christ requireth disciple mildnesse modestie byshop wherof paule maketh mention haue written confesse haue spoken commō argument religiō seémed good vnto haue offēded thyng neither haue disputation touchyng matter religion neither contention betwixt v tyme wherfore doe storme agaynst vnciuilie ye call wicked duely charge wickednes maners naturally euill disposed inclination ye choose oppresse brother infamous reproches duetie ought gently haue admonished beyng errour ye haynously offende cause whiche haue vndertakē must neédes stampe manifest lye begynnyng ye write sacrament euchariste defaced defiled peruerted false herein iniurious slaunderous call witnes myne owne bookes let brought forth perused shall euidently appeare haue beautified excellent sacrament honorable title haue spoken therof alwayes greatest reuerence whereas demaunde maisters face durst attempt execrable fact contrary many former age also demaūde many martyr many religious men haue strayed truth onely haue seéne truth truely cā coniecture maisters martyr religious men doe meane neither doe presume thyng vpon selfe derogate man neither cā iudge sober enough matter nothyng cā gush sea idle word come somwhat nearer matter would bee certified great matter lord iesus christ last supper sweéte interpretation yt nothyng cā thought mylde apte cōsolation offended wordes sayth louyng lord sweéte sauiour iesus must ascēde vp vnto father whence dyd de • cēd vnto ye first body must neédes take vp wt may frō thenceforth hādle earth therfore case witte conceaue mysticall eatyng flesh whiche haue commended vnto behoueth necessitie bee endued spirituall vnderstandyng spirite doth quicken flesh pro • iteth nothing iohn 6 say spirituall feédyng vpon body geuen shall nourishe life euerlastyng fleshly eatyng doth trouble much profiteth nothyng last lord iesus cōcludeth place wholy vnto wise wordes speake vnto spirite life iohn 6 wordes christ spake eatyng flesh spirituall flesh profiteth nothyng may beleue lord iesus speaking selfe let v therefore take hold quickenyng spirite whiche may make v partaker euerlastyng lyfe beyng authorized hereunto christ selfe sithence disgest sweét comfortable foode heauenly table fayth spirite leaue carnall grosse banquet euidently treatize vpon distribution sacramentall bread two haue bene alwayes accoumpted learned auncient authours presse whole forest full slaūders affirming sacramēt fowly deformed body bloud christ troden vnder feete power force wonderfull sacramēt dusked vtterly extinct demaunde agayne wordes botch doe lurcke bookes haue written haue done meanes ready either repulse errour cōfesse mine haue cō mitted fault craue pardō matter rather cōtrary mine innocēcie blameles herein call witnesse god men heauen earth agaynst wicked toung whiche hath practized falsely condemne credite brother greéuous accusation horrible crime fie fie osorius vnbridled licentiousnesse scorpionlike stinge make guiltie body bloud christ naturall brother hath offended though written neuer wrate though done yt heé neuer though haue affirmed proue euer iustifie nay rather haue endeuoured proue haue alledged myne wordes sentence haue noted writyngs lastly one thing haue explaned whereby may bee adiudged men shamelesse slaunderour notorious rayler processe ensueth stuffed full demaundes wherein albeit dyd pittie singular amazednesse much yet could scarse hold laughter cold friuolous variable speake mynde word altogether like osorius selfe first question though myne eye dazeled matter diuinitie cōceaue wonderfull chaunge earthly bread nature heauenly bread yet would notwithstādyng quarelling peruert wonderfull benefite god truely doe confesse right reuerend prelate yt myne eye sight hath bene alwayes dymme could neuer discerne counterfait trāsubstantiation ought haue beén pardoned herein bycause hath beén generall disease blindnes tymes age nation apostle neuer saw foolishe thyng auncient father could neuer discerne cloudy forgerie last sathan opened eye schoolemen made sharpe sighted vpbrayde blindnes sharpely sith selfe say selfe know world blind laterane coūcell ye list part continue blind still wt christ apostle aūcient father commendable company godly deuines laberinthe question also playnly seé doltishe blockishe patrone transubstātiation ye honesty open packe amongest owne pedlers neuer cease demaundyng aske doth trouble mysterie sacrament truly nothyng graue prelate troubleth vnmeasurable vnskilfulnes great mysterie small reproch profession dignitie yea gray heares also ye know yet whether doe mistrust power clemencie god neither finewitted gentleman doe trust selfe yet transubstantiation bycause ye goe throw vpon v contrary meanyng holy scripture god father hath fully declared vnto v power sonne lord sauiour iesu christ lastly ye demaūde cause thinke wherefore beleue body bloud christ cōteined sacrament wonderfull meane selfe beleue whereunto annexe witte learnyng ye doe farre surmonte hard matter holy father descry peculiar cause whiche moueth beleue defende transubstantiation gesse somewhat nearer chiefest forsooth addicted wholy schooletriflers confessours litle scripture meanes wherof come passe ye skyppe ouer open oracle truth entangled weuett errour peraduenture also ye become apprētice romish seé ye meane procure prety marchaūdize pedlers pilfe cardinal hatte may likewise countenaunce sake ye face false packe carde often bycause ye thinke empaire credite gray heares ouersene thyng besides custome perhappes many yeares made iudgement rotten ripe men vse say common lyers redouble lye often often rehearsall beleue true length euen may thinke establishe countenaunce imagined transubstantiation alledgyng defence therof continuall allowaunce long tyme none haue moued thinke surely ouermuch pride hath blinded wherewith ye swell sort dare boldly without blushyng make vaunt selfe like vnto bragging thraso thing cā vayne thē thraso like deuinea shew osorius pride doe exceede witte say excell learnyng truely compare selfe person neither professe selfe know thyng iesus christ also crucified one droppe christian humilitie ciuill modestie hautie bragge braue witte learnyng would neuer haue escaped consider selfe good earnest holy father foolish communication learne somewhat christian humilitie lest almightie god besides vnsauory errour transubstantiation adde heauie plague vpon vnmeasurable arrogancie accuse doe trust much naturall sens doe direct course life fayth churche doe shake shoulder yoke christ take vpon doe forsake benefites god doe leane stedfastly fayth cleane contrary apply sens ye vnderstādyng transubstātiatiō wherby haue christ felt tasted swallowed downe ye stomacke accordyng ye doctrine approued vse true catholicke apostolicke churche doe vtterly renounce sens accidētes substaunces transformatiōs aduisedly behold comprehend mynde ye sacrament mysterie spirite cast away yoke christ embrace licentious outrage romishe bulles poore miserable exile christ afflicted seruaunt doe choppe chaunge benefites christ peéuishe trinckettes schoolemen search true doctrine christian fayth approued preachyngs christ apostle ye snarle conuersation lyfe wicked wherin though doe great iniurie yet ye geue selfe deéper wounde open manifest lye doe put credite hassarde losse albeit miserable sinner sight god yet hope haue led whole lyfe onely great mercy neéde feare ierome osorius myne accuser could call witnesse innocencie italy germanie england euery regiōs haue behaued selfe hauyng testimony good commendable personage may easely despise slaunderous shameles rayling wherfore way friuolous insolent custome scolding last empaireth estimatiō honest person whiche though vnknowen vnto yet haue commendable report el abroad rather hurteth profession diminisheth credite loseth estimation doe prayse sacramēt plentifully many good wordes beautifie benefites therof wherein doe well thing vnder heauens founde prayse worthy comfortable honorable precious heauenly sacred supper lord whiche onely call name synaxim euchariste doe also bread come downe frō heauen angel foode neither deuise speake fully aboundauntly displaying excellent worthynes singular sacrament gladly consent therein cyprian say cyprian accustomed geue heauenly foode martyr would lykewise remoue heauenly banquet men notorious great crime doe acknowledge godly vsage cyprian myne owne part imitate much may know whether haue employed great endeuour one thyng much pure naturall honour sacrament might established dayly frequented church let bookes bee perused let enquirie bee made familiar haue bene conuersaunt withall let continuall course maners lyuyng bee examined shalbe founde men haue bene humble dayly folower guest heauenly supper wherfore thē immorderatly exclame agaynst doe mainteyne combate agaynst ordinaunce christ agaynst doctrine paule agaynst excellencie delicate fruites agaynst knowen experience wonderfull commoditie pleasauntnesse agaynst vndefiled fayth vniuersall church wherfore adde hereunto haue reprochfully abused body bloud christ outragiously peruerted benefite god mercy knitte vp knot length say doe sport selfe mischiefes doe infect many person poyson pestilēt errour god cōfounde vnshamefast blasphemous mouth horrible plague cursed semei whose cancred toung finde end measure rayling haue alwayes reuerētly esteémed ye euchariste precious fruitefull sacramēt christes death assured pledge seale redemption precious treasure mysterie fayth hereunto haue bene enduced ordinaunce christ sauiour doctrine paule iudgement aūcient father discipline receaued custome vniuersall catholicke apostolicke church touchyng doctrine therof haue oftē tymes spoken therfore touchyng custome perceaued dayly custome disciple christ takē vp heauē continually perseuere together doctrine apostlesactes 2 participation breakyng bread prayer appeareth wordes vpon day sabbaoth actes 20 disciple came together breake bread c awake ierome awake heare holy ghost call bread bicause doubt therof heare agayne ägayne yea brokē also much ye finde disciple christ continually remayned holy custome yet bare bread wickedly diffame sayinges therein mysticall bread sacred bread finally participation body christ maner body christ may bee deliuered sacrament fayth spirite therforethe confutatiō transubstantiation much lord iesus hath instituted sacramēt euerlastyng remēbraunce death passiō sithence paule doth make mention sayd institution maner sithence auncient father haue applied doctrine sense sithēce primitiue apostolicke churche hath confirmed perpetuall custome awake ierome lēgth shame awake rid stomacke dronken schoolesurfet trāsubstantiation neither christ ordeine paul acknowledged father euer thought ne yet apostolique church euer medle withall new deuised mockerie foūded first innocētius proclaymed schooleianglers scattered abroad sathā rootyng true remembraunce christ soules vtter ouerthrow power euerlastyng sacrifice ye crosse lastly erecting damnable idoll myndes supplying place christ selfe worshipped v el meaneth transubstantiated bread much adorned ceremony religion reuerently carried abroad superstitiously reserued kept boxe lastly blasphemously holden vp gaze worshypped christ sauiour teach euer tyme paule first primitiue church auncient father christ gaue bread disciple paule pronoūceth ye name bread twise thrise apostolicke church brake bread remembraunce christes death perseuered custome father name bread sacrament mysterie figure christes body yet pope innocentius commyng lately hell detestable superstition horrible sacriledge doth transubstantiate mysticall bread sauiour iesus christpope innocentius thyrd followed certeine phantasticall schoolemen wickedly defile pure supper lord durtie schoole dregges length starteth osorius braue champion schoole tromperies ierome osorius say great maister israell deépe incomparable deuine whō man exceédeth witte surmounteth learnyng man may beleue hee reporteth selfe wherfore would aske one question good maister proctour transubstātiation whether lord iesus christ hee first institute sacrament euchariste make mention speach remouing substaunce bread accidentes remayne whether substaunce body supply substaunce bread paule touche primitiue apostolique churche receiue thyng haue auncient father made title founde holy scripture custome apostle bookes auncient father wonderfull straunge matter bishop exquisite diuinity would seeme would yet vndertake desperate cause obtrude vpon v cold schoole dreames steéde apparaūt knowen thynges ye seé pitthily peter martyr hath aunswered thyngs whose soule would haue teazed quarell witte worthely esteémed excellent deuine amongest chiefest deuines age whose scholer might haue bene knowledge litterature except eloquence onely latine tounge leaue peter yt length whō neuer prouoked done better neéded doe great iniurie challēge familiar acquaintaunce thinke ye may honesty keépe company vse frendly familiaritie doltish calfe angrence hauyng vtteraunce witte sence vnderstādyng rather acquainte selfe man onely excellēt learnyng replenished comlynesse ciuilitie maners make choise familiar osorius please suffer enioy myne owne neither reason limitte kynde affaire humanitie cōmon course mās life requireth choise made frendship liketh eche man owne iudgement best ruled others phantasy squeymish therfore cōmēdations godly learned men especiall frendes martin bucer peter martyr loued thē lyued forget beyng dead frequēted purest age church might also haue bene let slip ouer v say vnmeasurable brabler quarell bitterly ye contumeliously stomacke agaynst report proue nothyng make thyngs euident example ye finde fault sequele thyngs none greater assured finally ye reiect sayinges meére false falseshoode wherof ye endeuour one sillable much discouer vnlesse paraduenture opinion bare braules shalbe receaued infallibe truthes whiche neuer yeld vnto haue sayd added also litle might lacke papane monarchie well enough yea ought without aswell bycause gospell interditeth also bycause reason reclaimeth agaynst wordes gospel enterdityng syr ierome set vp bristle although know meaning yet mooseleth wordes accuseth expresse myne meanyng sensibly say osorius ye sodenly fallen old doctour diuinitie punie scholer carper wordes ye sodenly disgraded reuerend prelate become malitious hungry fawconer title sillables grauitie beseéming byshop fūctio agreable gray heares let v view matter selfe ought lacke papane monarchie gospell interdityngit yt say bycause gospel doth enterdite forbid cōmaū deth ye contrary letteth hindereth withstādeth resisteth openly exclaymeth yt monarchie admitted speake ye latin phrase doth euery wordes properly playnly expresse thynges meane enquire amongest massemongers betlehead dalmada familiar companion condemne tomme trifler sweét piggesnye emanuell smoyle close sleaue somewhat founde world last exceédes filthy commentary blockishnesse aristarchus proceédeth notwithstādyng peacocklyke requireth proofe whereby countermaunde may manifest subiect onely great vicare christ first aunswere sufficient deny thing bare nay affirmeth thing bare yea differēce authority betwixt estate ye • urisdictiō bishop whiche may hold charge siluain consent toucheth therefore packt together tedious epistle queénes maiestie full reproches slaunders vttered cankred malice agaynst professours true religion yet while vsed thereunto neither proofe probabilitie sufficed haue confuted pestilent inuectiue fortified bare affirmatiues onely euen contrary therof witte bare negatiues asmuch haue stopt vp fewe shardes last tedious commentary though hardly quyte purpose yet well could thought good reply likewise argumentes thereby ouertake euery loupe hoale haue entāgled snarled fast coupe lordly ierarchy force holy scripture euē ye tooles beleued haue erected established neéde nothing doubt ye consent ye godly yt fully satisfied herein nothyng content yt captious title wordes slippe diuinitie extreme sophistrie affirmed italian monarche could aptly ruler ouer v alledged cause wordes head cā conueniently distaunt member farre asunder osorius playeth man vttereth skill brunt beleueth monster cā tell lurketh wordes therfore rusheth vpon pretie young question must ye taught speake latine sayth hee meaneth cōueniētly distaūt agreeth selfe doth dissent wherfore say one thing conueniently distaunt conueniently distaunt ye doe speake true latine vse keépe grammar schoole shoulde haue felt smarte hereof hee made foule escape grammer principle truely wery long sithence gentle reader bee childishly occupyed siftyng title sillables wordes maner may seuered italy farre distaunce region matter religion iustice equitie could bee ministred must bee procured immesurable charge tedious pursuite many yeares whiche inconueniēces good remedy prouided defende fatherly loue seruile subiection referred consideration owne profite publicke sauetie subiectes therfore sayth false kyng doth rule lord vnlesse take tyraunt rather kyng harken pray harken promise authoritie kynges yt say though gouerne subiectes yet lordes ouer cause yes deéde good sir lordes ouer cause aswel ecclesiasticall temporall may seéme apperteine good gouernemēt cōmon chief armyes yet haue vnder centurians lieutenaūts serieauntes corporal meaner officer trayne due order exercize whole affaire rest souldiours doe maisters nauies shippes appointe vnder mate length come peter wordes ye way spurnyng calling filthy person wherin small iniurie like wicked sophister demaūde wordes peter framed sentence vouched touchyng superioritie kynges whether enduced bycause peter doth name kyng excellent onely graue gentleman whole processe peter communication doe argue wise men many tymes called excellent either nobilitie learnyng bycause notable therein bycause set authoritie aboue men god name pleaseth produce example though may bee opiniō excell knowledge ciuill law yet forthwith vnder title yeld vnto lyke commendation interpretyng holy scripture matter resolued word counterfait grammariā accordyng doctrine peter paule certaine degreés bee limited eche dignitie doctrine likewise determined ye royall dignitie kyng doth excell aboue power manifest decreé authoritie kyng must honored without cōparison chiefest wonted guise ye runne raundon many wordes concernyng meanyng paule distinction bee made betwixt ciuill ecclesiasticall authoritie first mā snaffle vnbridled toūg roue raunge triflyngly whether lusteth yet meanyng paule peter bee vnknowen men haue vnderstand doe make diuision speciall distinction magistrate certaine degreés doe precisely manifestly ascribe chief rule highest authoritie kyngs albeit ye triumphe iolylye differēce tymes yet nothyng preuayle ye beleue speache apostle ought applyed christiā kynges bycause 13 prince sayth fearefull well doer wicked wilt thou feare power doe well thou shalt haue prayse minister god appointed thy wealth thou doe euill feare thou beare sworde vayne bee minister god take vengeaūce euill say could speach paule touch nero respect whiche embrued sword ye bloud innumerable christiās alwayes oppressed innocentes wallowed lyfe long maner outrage crueltie discreét sober person thinke albeit apostle beyng enspired holy ghost gaue preceptes time tyrannous emperours yet relation thereby christian godly kynges vndertake defence subiectes nurse congregation christ hygher power amongest kyng chiefestrom 13 math 17 • uce 20 therfore ye byshops together soeuer ecclesiasticall order holden subiect vnder authoritie kyng vnlesse ye bee without soules perhappes maistershyp ye subiect kynges ye ought obey commaundementeswherein office kyng consisteth vnlesse prescribe agaynst god yet beare function church • church ruler administer sacramentes may ought chastize reduce good order happely ye neglect dueties behaue selfe vnseémely function approued authoritie old new testament oftētimes repeated cōfirme assertiō bryng example core dathan abyron singular blockishnesse ignoraunce made rebellion agaynst moses vse wordes holy scripture gathered together agaynst moses aaronnumb 16 sayd vnto ye take enough much vppon seyng multitude holy euery one lorde amongest lifte selues vppe aboue congregation lord behold execrable speach ouer besides pernitious rebellion heare also one onely equabilitie degree asmuch therefore abrogate maner authoritie magistrate beyng appointed god anabaptistes age practize accordyng desert swallowed vp ye gapyng gulfe prouided god purpose ye thrust person stage cā occupy part play doe neither entreate rebellion trayterous suppression magistrate cōmunication tendeth ende whether kynges haue lawfull gouernement ouer ecclesiastical person lesse foolishly haue ye patcht purpose oza ozias balthesar ye affirme haue bene greuously plagued lord bicause rashly handle holy thynges thus ye say done accordyng deserte likewise kynges worthely punished lord would vndertake minister baptisme infantes would owne person distribute lordes supper clymbe vp pulpittes vsually preache entrude men function namely minister elder god hath peculiarly chosen execute order ministerie euen lord hath aduaunced kynges hyghest superioritie bycause commaūde prouide matter executed others subiectes due conuenient order doctrine beyng • ounde profitable approued testimony example purest age applyable ordinaūce holy scripture yet pelting prelate seémeth squeymishe spareth curse v pitte hell bycause agreé friuolous assertion ye maruell much hatefully bent agaynst byshop rome doe alwayes inueighe truely doe hate byshop rome hee neuer iniurie personally extraordinarie superioritie write agaynst bycause opinion manifest rebell agaynst holy scripture agaynst saluation whole state christianitie neither doe reproue canon especially whiche established first purer age churche ne yet later canon meane doe concerne iudiciall courtes teach good commendable preceptes rule administration iustice vtterly detest much lyeth abhorre ambitious flatteryng constitution pestilent dispensation like infinite filthy absurdity erected procurement dignity pillyng pollyng coyne alledge two holy constitution example sake wherof one described wordesdistinct 22 cap omnes lord hath committed charge earthly heauenly empire vnto peter beyng appointed porter eternall life christian hart willingly suffer sathanicall arrogancie yelded vnto mortall creature yet shewe one stampe farre horribledecrees ful blasphemie pope hath heauenly thinges bent vnto must bee taken law neither man say contrary doe may dispence beyond law make bee right quyte cōtrary amendyng alteryng lawes bycause fulnesse power resteth golden decreés sooth wherewith syr ierome would haue v yoked notable iurisdiction papane seé whiche osorius waxeth whotte though burst sonder yet ought christian nation subiect vnto affirmeth contrary part iustifie papane supremacie mentioned scripture meare straūgerthe pope power altogether vnknowen vnto peter vnto paule rest apostle succeédyng course primitiue purer church neuer one worde spoken vntill reigne tyraunt phoca tyme first hatchyng afterwardes deéde litle litle pride pillage peltyng flatteryng enhaunced selfe farre aboue measure claymeth iurisdiction ouer heauen earth sea haue declared somwhat doth plētyfully appeare blasphemous decretalles published mouthes holy pope selues wherfore extraordinarie iurisdiction pope friuolous paynted disguised deformed frameshapen chaungelyng though osorius would hange selfe therefore kingly authoritie shall beare chief preheminence vpō earth accordyng sundry euerlastyng testimony old new testament vnto whiche peter paule expresse wordes subscribe whereunto cōmēdable antiquity approued aūcientie haue willingly yelded agreable cōsent hath alwayes exercized gouernement well disposed moderation beyng contented owne limites territory hath licentiously presumed vnlawfull clayme ouer worlde arrogant chaire pestilēce doth challenge whose vnsatiable greédy gapyng filthy lucre heauens earth hell selfe able satisfie affirmed epistle abolishyng canon feare care vtterly rooted harte made aunswere many men wonderfully enriched canon fewe enduced haue especiall regarde feare god ye knowledge trustyng discredite myne aunswere demaunde question whether ciuill law doe instruct men feare god whiche albeit doe say yet monumentes therof ought consumed fire matter osorius hanges together question moued canon lawes eche parte vbrayde agaynst v ciuill law communication concernyng feare god deny ciuill lawes ought burnt ye starcke dronke doe ye bable dreame ye ashamed monstruous talke truely irkesome throughly tyred blockish aduersary affirmed authoritie canon lawes dyd farre forth preuayle v founde agreable godlynes iustice ministred decreés therof ecclesiasticall courtes maruaile cā true much luther already burnte first demaunde question ye maruaile thyng earste ye constauntly deny wtout shame dissemble matter euident wherewithall neither portingall maistershyp could bee acquainted consideryng dayly entercourse continuall traffique betwixt v agayne moueth name luther herein uerely partes haue name luther great admiration firmely beleue might likewise haue easely bene scholer diuinitie notwithstandyng name selues lutheranes christian neither doe iudge man absolutely perfect amongest whole ofspryng adam whose wordes deédes may accoumpt without exception vnreproueable furthermore founde fault bycause accused preacher though taught publicke sermon vnpunishable libertie sinning herein likened saucie malapertenes litle better blasphemie horrible reproche infamously slaunder ye doctrine gospell preached deuines whiche sentence wonted guise turne peruert thyngs person say doe ascribe deuine godhead luther bucer martyr monstruous vermine euer speake thinke matter esteéme deéde lyued famous worthy personage respect learnyng godlynesse like maner dead defend remembraunce name much may namely bucer martin bucer martyr peter martyr familiarly acquainted know auncient godly father exquisite vertue learnyng much furmountyng diuinitie excell drawlatche derlyng dalmada deintie delicacie ye latin toūg sithence hath pleased grosse foolish lye forge new god whō worshyp bold leaue disclose idollthe idoll rome maugre teéth ye shall deny selfe doe worshyp deuine honour meane romishe prelate papall seé whiche asmuch accordyng owne saying hath authoritie dispence sinnes vertue bulles day moneth yeare onely euer euer also keépeth keyes heauen pleasure wherewith geueth kyngdome heauen vnto person others locketh fast inuested fulnesse power ye vndoubted uicare god whose royall maiestie euery power magistrate must humble yeld submit selues whereas say allowe title dignitie onely teache defend vnbridled insolēcy also lustely couragiously vaūte rayse vp crest doe el blazyng brauerie speach coyne selfe others manifest idoll may worshyp may prostrate selfe lowly humbly make intercessiō vnto therfore dissemble ierome ye liste yet romish idoll selfe also manifest idolatour must willyngly endure trauaile neuer hard attaine fauour blessyng god perhappes may picke vp crommes thereby promoted highe ye may nearely behold yt earthly god enstalled vnder elbow palace wherin may sacrifice vnto maiestie say prouoke disputation vntrue prouoke confute false accusation wherewith charge v mainteinours fayth voyde vertue religion euer amōg thrust name luther perteineth v cast challenge one deuine england namethe bookes osorius de iustitia tenne shall seé quickly take vp gloue labour crush sophisticall cane peéces wish peruse bookes entitled de iustitia thē say may throughly satisfie selfe touchyng iustifyeng fayth truly haue perused uolumes deuided threé bookes entitled de iustitia first wherof ye speake much commendation fayth therein vse testimony argumentes doth reprehend herein pray yet endeuour hath obteined shewe selfe vnnecessary arguer vndoubted controuersie stampe also second booke wherein commend much worthynes good workes herein nothing dissent aduaunce much wish v thyrd booke almost altogether pelagian beyng throughly poysoned heresy greéke church doth blasphemously inueighe agaynst freé mercy god father christ iesu namely agaynst augustine vnvanquishable patrone heauēly grace therfore gaye poppet gorgiously paynted whiche liketh selfe well partly friuolous ouerwhelmed much tattlyng partly wicked execrable while practizeth trāsforme v naturall men almost god neither alone opinion cardinall poole also part iudgement whō although rome maruailously disguised yet men knew farre better man liuyng much expert diuinitie alwayes withstand attempt publishyng printe delicate impe thē louyngly embrace great estimatiō owne derlyng accomptyng perillous pestiferous gaue famous verdit thereof worthy deépely engrauen entrailes christian hartescardinall poole iudgement osorius bookes possible sayth cardinall poole possible yelde much mercy god abase strength man much much grace haue conceaued emprinted braynes doctrine humilitie abacement would neuer haue nakedly stripped christ grace hautely arrogantly enhaunced power man ne yet proudely boldly reproued despised augustine worde osor signifieth bolde portingall toung aschambut dare osorius doe accordyng nature name dare boldly presume vpō thyngs peraduē ture demaunde knew pooles mynde herein tell familiar frēd vnknowen vnto ascham sondry tymes aduertize therof affirmyng yt heare ye vttered mouth cardinall selfe also doth trouble much bycause affirmed errour imagined braynsicke mazer would falsely lay others charge say truth herein owne lye owne haynous acte owne slaunder yea owne errour fayned coyned imagined selfe though afterwardes would poast ouer others without cause yet spare pinche cruelly saying amongest scornes reproche stammeryng speach though speake playnly meane while wryng selfe nose geue selfe two foule blowes first matter selfe euen el haue declared sufficiently maner speache steéde barbarous endytyng ye reprehende stammeryng toung neuer person would doe hath bene enured write pure cleane latine surely syr speake playnly distinctly inestimable benefite godstāmeryng • toūg turned vpō osorius necke toūg doth stammer stutte report true haue conference blemish bycause proceédeth nature would neuer haue obiected first vpbrayded ye fault wherewith selfe naturally encombred length entred treaty iustification first ye snatche sentence scripturesof cause iustification haue set downe without reason certeine cōtinuall crooked vsage cauillyng ye writhe wrest ouerthwartely therfore bid adewe vnmeasurable captious sophistry sift diuinitie while wil appeare say foolish detestably corrupt rehearse writing euē workes vnprofitable iustification yet ought despised bycause paule doth seéme verifie position let v seé doctour ierome sayth sooth raungeth abroad originall sinne altogether besides cushian doth cruelly accuse luther caluine melancthon bycause cōdemne workes holy men cōpared glory god could forgeuen merites iesu christ doth paul affirme truly iewes gētiles cōcluded vnder sinne doth ye propheticall kyng dauid likewise lōg pronoūce trulypsal 13 one righteous person one one vnderstand one seeke god gone way together become vnprofitable one doth good one one righteous mā much one shalbe come worthynes workes yea euen amōgest perfect godly bee man vnderstand also best workes godly value mā seéke god duly performed person haue declined way haue walked perfectly right way lastly person doth good whether excellent workemaisters vanished god name say well iewes gē tile say generally concluded vnder sinne pretie holy men bee founde ye neédes haue paule vtterly none sinne one man sinne poured vpon fleshe condemnation expresse wordes paule admitte startyng hole yet mastershyp notwithstandyng vrge certeine perfection workes contrary manifest authoritie sacred scripture prelate doth make accompt wordes christ sauiour saying sayth lord lord doth father shal enter kingdome heauen hee demaundeth yoke sinne bee alwayes fastened vnto shoulder meanes remoued may obteine state righteousnesse grace goodnesse christ selfe haue told wise man truely euen grace goodnes christ haue named therfore dauid full ye holy ghost lifting hādes vp vnto god cryeth manerpsal 50 wash throughly wickednes clense frō sinne knowledge faultes sinne euer desire bee washed welter filthy puddle sinnes require bee clensed throughly purified corrupted wholy defiled ye stinckyng dregges sinnerom 13 fall one mā sayth paule sinne deriued way propaganaciō vpon men vnto condēnation euen righteousnesse one good extended vnto men iustification life agayne paulerom 11 god hath shut vp men vnder vnbelief might haue mercy vpon frō selues therfore proceédeth euill vnto damnatiō god commeth iustification vnto lyfe selues riseth vnbelief mercy issueth god let v heare lord sauiour iesus christ selfe sweétely cōfortyng v wordesmath 11 come vnto ye doe trauaile heauy laden refresh therfore anguish grief sinne burden trespass wherewith ouerladen haled onely groūde euen hell gate spryng owne selues euen asswagyng sorrowes ease importable burden come iesu christ onely bee ignorant sentence good syr wherewith holy scripture doe euery swarme plentyfully pray vnderstand gospell doe know doe ye maliciously inueighe agaynst learned men singular seruauntes god without cause especially departed life agaynst could speake selues ye durst mutter one worde beyng compared let passe vndertake defend extreme amazednesse rehearse wordes cull purpose carpe glaūce away luther caluin quarell let alone ye liste striue also cauill doth reason require request allowable surely extreme maddenesse challenge vnto barrier sckyppe ouer away others pursue venymous toung say seemeth maisters doctrine pleaseth tearme thē force sinne yet extinguished v bloud christ truely may acknowledge men whose name recite maisters diuinitie onely practize pietie also whereas ye would haue teache force sinne yet extinguised bloud christ doe expresse owne wordes onely horrible shamelesse slaūder agaynst vnto marke alwayes bent whole endeuour expresse vnto iesu christ liuely eye also crucified emprint throughly bowel soules precious bloud iesu christ shed v vpon ye crossegallat 3 preach vnto v remission sinnes bitter death passion beate blind deafe eares world glad tydyngs gospell beyng ouerwhelmed oppressed couled generatiō massemongers confessours men tradition altogether choaked buried vnder grounde silence holy scripture disclose agayne abroad open light put miserable captiues remembraunce sayd doctrine beyng vtterly subuerted tyrannous trechery gallauntes therfore sermon lesson writynges vsed like speaches1 iohn 1 bloud iesu christ doth clense v frō sinne know redemed vayne conuersation receaued traditiō forefather transitorie thyngs gold
