god heare men clensed sinne redeémed vayne conuersation washed sanctified iustified bloud iesu christ ye know likewise men take vpon alwayes infinite labour trauaile establishyng enlargyng gospell christ ashamed obtrude vnto grosse errour whiche ech euidently conuinced whole discourse gospell treatise holy scripture cākred malice hath onely blinded osorius bewitched sens ye seé truth selfe yet arrogaunt waywardnesse frowardly kicke agaynst preacher truth rom 7and yet notwithstāding true sinne doth alwayes dwell within v alwayes law lurking mēbers rebellyng agaynst law mynde draweth v bondeslaues sinnyng lord doth deliuer v body death bloud iesu christ rootyng sinne v altogether christes sake pardonyng sinnes repent hereof arise comfortable reioysinges faythfull spared onely begotten sonne deliuered slayne v bee possible geue v thynges together rom 8 agayne shall accuse elect god thirdly lord doth iustifie shall condemne v spoken end set innocencie perfection whereunto aspire while pilgrimes miserable fleshluke 5 doe expresse vnto v god doth geue v freé remission iesu christ set whole affiaunce hope vpon pronounceth selfe hee sent righteous sinner bycause repent amende lyues well disgest sayinges lord beyng old byshop allow scripture haue bounde selfe apprentice bussardly schooledregges yet confidence death bloud christ rayse v vp heauen dreadfull day couled generation peltyng trinkettes superstitious workes shalbe throwen headlong hell vnlesse ye repent tyme doe assuredly knowe confesse mouthes lord iesus beleue stedfastly hart god hath raysed death lyfe shalbe saued rom 10 hart beleue vnto righteousnesse mouth confesse saluation yet confession fayth doth neuerthelesse want testimonie good workes withall alwayes accompanied indebted fleshe walke accordyng flesh liue accordyng fleshe shall dye spirite mortifie sinnes body shall liue guided spirite god sonnes god rom 8 wherfore renoūce length lothsome communicatiō withall lyke filthy hogge mooselyng durtie swynesty epicure vse wickedly scorne deride faythfull seruauntes christ ye write maner thought good case enough acceptable vnto god fayth wherfore righteous peter paule yea holy mother god ye goe amasked altogether osorius faythfull minister christ doe acquainte selues vnsauory hautie spirite pride rather doe earnestly call remembraunce sayinges paulerom 13 night passed day come nye let v therefore cast awaye workes darkenesse let v put armour light let v walke honestly day light eating drinking nother chambring wantonnesse c let v put iesu christ make prouision fleshe fulfill lustes thereof c hitherto walter haddon residue aunswered f begynnyng maister haddon left agaynst osorius apelles famous painter worldeplinius lib 35 cap 10 endeuouryng curious exquisite maner expresse feature venus coe greécethat say cōmyng sea called greéke 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 preuented death plinie reporteth whē yet drawen halfe ye portrait thereby cōpelled relinquishe residue vnperformed man arte neuer expert durst tyme presume pencill pursue president like lot albeit vnlike endeuour ouertooke apelles amiddes blazing beautie venus seémeth haue encountred noble gentleman walter haddon displaying veritie gospell hee vndertaken commendable prayse worthy defence truth agaynst ierome osorius albeit neither obteined beautifie part begon accomplish purpose rest yeldyng ouer nature amyddes race constrained surcease exploite yet hath hee poolished part whiche hee left vnfinished apelles pencill say hath framed singular paterne excellencie arte sight therof whole posteritie may afrayde set hand attempt determinyng selfe aunswere slaunderous inuectiues ierome osorius compiled threé bookes although graunted performe whole yet hath singularely endited one booke halfe agaynst confuted reason none discouered lye whiche shamelesse daunted hauty pride vtterly discomfited vaine glorious peacocklike rhetoricke grauitie wisedome well disposed stile supply made truth gospell beyng selfe otherwise vnuanquishable might seéme haue neéde patronage wherefore long enioyed lyfe excellent learned man selfe endured amongest v churche christ worthy valiaunt captaine osorius also couragious puissaunt enconterer meéte conquerour monster sithence taken v albeit veritie selfe haue iust cause dispayre yet chose vnderfully dismayed haddons sake yet losse chiefly concernyng haddon hee happy estate god good prouidence hath mercyfully trāslated furious wretched world blessed quyet calme euen especially beyng conuersaunt race perfect godlynes employed vertuous endeuour sacred cause neither ierome osorius braulyng barker henceforth disquyet molest himthe decease haddon greater cause rather moue v learned much sorrow grief mynde haue lost great learned ryngleader learning losse doth much encrease heauynes respect present entreprise vndertaken agaynst osorius chiefly much feéle selues bereft singular patrone altogether dispoyled herein without wonderfull difficultie scarse person knowledge wilbe founde able supply rest aunswere like successe commēdation matter great importaunce easie refell reason osorius wherin substaunce triflyng toyes manifold also despise slaunders wherewith ouerlauishe bycause person easily hee founde suppose learned haddon dare presume entermedle cause ioyne owne deuises haddons writynges feare haddon dead wil come passe discourse plutarch maketh relation certeine mā well thought rashly youthfully seémeth coūteruaile politicke prowesse themystocles bycause atteyne haddons actiuitie shall therfore like dastardes fleé field leaue truth gospell succourles campe enemy quarell much apperteignyng haddon almightie god selfe suffer shame preuaile v pietie godlynesse bycause one champion takē barrier approued assayes shall therfore yeld ouer conquest whole challenge osorius permit glorious thraso triumph treade downe cowardize bycause preferre haddon first onset armes shall therefore beare brunte battell shall valiaunt attempt rather teaze prouoke v pricke courage yet neither speake thinke wise though either mistrust tyme wittes age plentyfully florishyng season especially wherein doe know many skilfull enough mainteyne quarell would either vouchsafe yeld endeuour thereto could persuaded thinke trauaile would counteruaile study yet albeit happely may founde one nymble mynde endued learning iudge selfe able enough performe yet scarse shall ye finde mā beyng otherwise exercized weightyer affaire litle esteéme losse tyme vnprofitable contention snarlyng snatchyng spend one houre vpon osorius osoria melancholycke brauler say vpon wayward melancholicke aduersary beyng nothyng el raylyng brabler whereby neither profite may redounde reader prayse victor cause therfore gētle reader thou shouldst require handes exact absolute furniture supply commyng forth haue bene perfited haddon either bycause easie matter reach vnto exquisite plot singular presidēt table apelles el bycause chiefest aduersaries argument haue bene sondry person long sithence crushte peéces already effect deserue rather discretion scorned reason scanned touch onely certeine chief place controuersie scattered come ye chase seé auayle challenge reteinyng selfe within lystes neoptolemus law say briefly summary pointes touch away neither doe thinke neédefull stay long vpon debatyng euery particular point especially bycause threé wordes onely may suffice ouerthrow whole battrye threé inuectiues neuer tedious forasmuch authour hath vttered nothyng confused worke el sauoreth lyesthe summe osorius worke briefly cō prehended three wordes slaunders errours reasonable aunswere may discreét person require threé wordes onely haue spoken shalbe thought haue expressed wordes soeuer huge rable scoldyng triflyng sophister doth conteine 1 mentiris 1 doe lye 2 maledicis 2 slaunder 3 falleris 3 doe erre end shall bee sayd charge lewde deuise myne owne imagination cōtrary truth matter alledge certeine euident proofes although infinite labour number sandes sea whereby diligēt reader may easily descry wonderfull vanitie lyeng execrable wickednes slaunderyng monstruous blindnes diuinitie first one place offereth selfe viewe wherein two especiall pointes full haynous accusation contained say two detestable lye whelped one lytter pregnant worme one wherof hee doth accuse martin luther though hee wickedly teache extreme desperation bold presumptuous confidence saluation truely greuous perillous accusation true afterwardes two monstruous falsely forged proposition stampeth conclusion forth lesse false thē malicious wherein exclameth luther exclamat • ō osorius agaynst luther onely subuertour vertue studious industrie carefull endeuour wondred osorius doth argue wise whereas euen begynnyng booke hath accustomed selfe nothyng el cōtinuall course lyeng maruell great deale hee would altogether chaunge typpet vnlyke selfe begyn speake thyng truly matter goeth well luther workes extaunt yet vsually frequented whiche true witness doctrine cā testifie truely maisters innocencie herein whereupon two thyngs may easily coniectured whereof one great likelyhode suspected either osor hath neuer read thynges whereat hee cauilleth nature hee notably shaped sicophauntosorius pag 141 martin luther sayth doth teach extreme desperation would fayne know whence haue pyked luther preached many sermon cōpiled many bookes published owne coūtrey lāguage many also turned latine toung readyng perusing hath recouered many person doubt standyng vpon brincke desperation greéuous anguish mynde amongest vnfained simple humble conscience thankefully acknowledge god selfe bee one neuer heare one person much hath perished desperation readyng luther bookesthe doctrine desperation whether proper papistes lutheran hearing doctrine contrary part diuers monumentes history replenished example haue runne headlong vtter dispayre haue gaynesayd withdrawen selues doctrine luther touchyng frauncisce spira reuolted participation doctrine whiche receaued luther preachyng bycause recorde thereof somewhat old present omit remaineth history willyngly vse fresher example later age yet ingenerall neédeth neither one man able doe rehearse notable first certeine mā called iacobus latomus man sometymes wellbe seéne amongest deuines louayne tell whether selfe knew osorius liued mā mainteinyng quarell wherein turmoyle selfe agaynst luther reported departe life selfe desperatiō whereof make mention last gaspes brayeng horrible feareful roaring noyse vttered none sounde eares men heard vtterly damned forsaken god hope saluation layed vp store bycause hee wilfully resiste manifest truth knew true couple two others hym fraternitie guarlacke reader diuinitie lecture amōgest gertrudianes arnolde bomelye scholer tilman first whō sayd euen last panges death spake maner liued desperately could endure iudgemēt god bycause acknowledge sinnes greater could obteyne geuenesse hauyng fully gorged selfe doctrine desperatiō wherein instructed schoolemaister distrust surprised lēgth intollerable gnawyng conscience practised first kill selfe owne dagger last beyng wholy swallowed vp desperation dyd cut owne bowelles body man knife shall amisse ioyne vnto sadolet cardinall rome sondry disputation mainteined agaynst luther gaue vp ghost without horrible trembling torment conscience suppose also ignoraunt like happened cardinall crescentius legate apostolique seé president tridentine councell beyng astonyed sodeine horrour troublesome abashement mynde citie 1552 iohn sledan hath made relation commentary shall speake castellane archbyshop aurelia ponchere archbyshop turone procured selues god indignation vengeaunce appeared wonderfull fearefull passiōs wherewith oppressed tyme death bicause heare luther read bookes bycause cruelly persecute doctrine ye beadroll may reckoned remēbraūce iohn eckius iohn eckius others whose whole course lyfe nothyng el continuall mortall combate agaynst luther yeldyng nature altogether voyde spirituall consolation euen last gaspes hee vttered wordes money certeine thousand crownes neéde rehearse recordes aūcient chronicle minerius cassianus renestenses martinus miserable mōcke called romanus prattes lysettes rusius morines beyng horribly plagued seuere iustice god may sufficiēt presidentes teach insolently kicke agaynst pricke god vnsearcheable prouidence history french kyng henry ye secondhenry second frēch kyng death yet freshe memory deépely emprinted myndes onely eye also men extremely boylyng inward hatred agaynst doctrine receaued deathes wounde selfe eye wherewith determined view execution others forced selfe become manifest spectacle god iustice world could bathe eye bloud ye innocēt long sayd henry followed also kyng nauarre procured vnto selfe iust cause onely desperation death also none occasion persecutyng doctrine doe slaunderously reproche doctrine desperation could make register infinite nōber englād onely region also receaued wonderfull cōfort ye sweéte iuyce doctrine call lutherane fell headlong miserable anguishe gnawyng conscience reuoltyng doctrine could neuer attayne one sparckle quyet mynde reclaymed selues first apostasie last many thousandes men wemen child young old age truely recorde haue shewed selues willyng yeld carcass fier fagottes sword rackyngs maner horrible torture rather would recante renounce comfortable doctrine enstructed suppose would neuer haue done suspected neuer small embres desperation haue lurked therein perceaue osorius doth meane word desperation could either expresse mynde aptly distinctly willyng deale simply playnly ende therefore may frame myne aūswere hauing regarde meanyng man rather speach examine maner disputyng somewhat aduisedly affiaunce assuraūce saluation wherein placed luther doth teach sayth mā ought place affiaunce righteousnes merites good workes goe concluded hereof therfore luther doth teach doctrine desperation new founde straūge maner argument framed perhappes rule concludeth staffe corner suppose men syluane vse kynde arguyng wooddy forrests make aunswere argument god determined saluation haue bene purchased godly action vertuous endeuour man life altogether without reason osorius doth speake much hope confidence limited within boundes fayth christ foundation thereof builded vpon rocke onely suppose surely person doth allure v home vnto christ confidence workes teacheth v repose whole trust onely sanctuary shoteanker saluation doth declare rather true way assured hope abolishe neither doth rende sunder sinewes man endeuour doth embace disable part mās power doth properly apperteine sonne god thinke discouereth rather well sprynges comfortable glad tydynges gospell lysten pray osorius disputation wonder while deépe insight logicke matter past recouery sayth assured confidēce man wilbe enduced rayse vp mynde earnestly vertuous endeuour haue geuen v right rhetoricall position marke concludyng determination catholicke ergo saith whereas luther doth partly dispoile v hope righteousnesse partly doth place wholy righteousnesse christ hope ought proper peculiar ech person doth herein el vtterly subuerte extinguishe dueties endeuours godlynesse v truely deny maner enterprise happen vsuall dayly practize well conceauyng hope doth minister wonderfull courage mynde man whole force lyuelynes wherof desperatiō distrust many tymes vtterly daunted purpose alledged agaynst luther whose teachyng lesson tende onely marke much instruct v rule good lyfe onely peculiar office law lead v know whether ought good workes repose affiaunce elles ascribe wholy freé mercy god iesu christ bycause godly endeuours vertuous workes prayseworthy whether workes great estimation may satisfie god iudgement deserue eternall lyfe establishe consciēces sauetie grounde principall point controuersie ought place decided much therforetwo kynd • desperation two kyndes desperation haue sayd behoued osorius haue distinguished raysed battrye agaynst luther person doe vtterly dispayre forgeuenes sinnes mercy god towardes example desperation cain saul esau antiochus iudas minerius latomus sadolete others kynde desperatiō belongeth properly vngodly wicked whiche altogether estraunged god nothyng agreable luther doctrine besides kynde desperation attempt enterprise man wholy discomfited attaine maistrie foremost yet bee discouraged wil employ abilitie much lieth may second left archer shooteth somewhat neare sticke deserueth prayse though hitt pricke lyke manner euery one v doe marche onwarde paynefully warrefarre god law runnyng game trye maistric wherein albeit neuer founde man whiche could lyfe assure selfe attayne appointed goale yet therewith throwen downe conceite bee dispayre saluation neither ought interprete law though practise guidyng thereof onely meanes elles could obteine euerlastyng lyfe law hath purpose endes direct v vnto whiche osorius might haue learned paule augustine diuers others would wittyngly wilfully haue bene blyndthe ende office law first rule vse law represent vnto v inestimable righteousnesse creatour whose image created next condemne vnrighteousnesse abate pride bee tyme steéde schoolemaister lead v christ whiche albeit could selfe geue full righteousnes people vnto deliuered first might neuertheles meane space wholesome seueritie hold backe keépe feare restrayne vnbrideled licentiousnesse fleshe orderly comlynesse lestthey runne headlong execrable wicked impietie truly seéme bee principall v law absolute exact perfection wherof neuer man race hetherto able satisfie though vpholdē altogether gracious ayde god osorius remember one man sithence tyme sonne god onely except hath throughly performed euery part duetie required law beseéch name cā name one ofspryng adā hath perfectly accomplished whole law moueth furiously rage agaynst luther teacheth righteousnes vnperfect hath likewise affirmed truth righteousnesse onely vnperfect condemned righteousnesse lothsome thē defilynges foule menstruous clothe euen esay prophet accordyng saying lord iesus christ hee adiudged onely deédes wordes soeuer though neuer precisely handled tyme old law onely commyng christ also neither v alone rude vnlettered multitude euen apostle selues performed bee altogether vnauaylable purchasing eternall lyfe yea thē selues also better plighte condition seruauntes vnprofitable bondeslaues sturre would da •• haue kept sithence man ignoraunt manifest saying christ apostle either must osorius cite felowes vnto chapter house together lutheran acquyte must henceforth quarell luther cause agayne lord gospell doth promise teacherthe lawe vnprofitable saluation holy ghost cōuince world sinne righteousnesse shall thinke mente sendyng teacher hee purposed establishe two thynges especially osorius doth seéke chiefly discredite say godly harte beyng enlightened inspiration holy ghost may bee instructed feéle owne weakenesse selues frō owne power haue hope saluation attainement thereof nothyng wanteth christ iesu without christ euer haue dispayred casea wholesome kynde trust mistrust thynges rest safe assured one wherof ariseth vnto v cōfortable desperation floweth holy affiaunce desperation say one doth exclude true trust iesu christ doth abrogate vayne confidence workes onely neither doe meane confidence whiche doth let louse reynes licentious boldnes vnpunishable libertie confidence doth minister necessary comfortable gladsomnes godly afflicted conscience porting wise allow confidence fearyng thyng forsooth lest way swift osori pag 141 easie attaynement saluation whiche drawe awaye variable mynde man labour slouthfulnesse therfore much better euery man beyng vncertaine owne sauetie holden still feare rather perhappes might seéme haue spoken without reason eternall lyfe thyng depend vpon couenaunt condition workes whereas consisteth wholy freé mercy god whiche neither deceaue hath respect worthynesse receaueth gracethe trust saluatiō depēdeth vpō promise vpō law ergo assured resteth vpon onely credite hym promiseth apportioned good workes freély geuen whiche deserue vnto doe beleue doth iustifie vngodly remayneth osorius must either strippe scripture naked god promise towardes v necessitie conclude trust assured affiaunce vnder promise selfe vtterly ignoraunt promise gospell purporteth bewraye singular blockishnesse herein whiche rather likely bee true would haue first make aunswere vnto whether god haue made v promise allpromise made law without law whether promise law selfe thyng ordeined besides law hereof paule seemeth bee fitte interpretour reporteth promise first geuen abrahā ii • c xxx yeares lawe published therefore could meanes make frustrate testament geuen first inheritaūce came law promise galat 3 thinke good beleue paule rather osorius promise saluation free simple without conditionthese thinges beyng graunted demaunde gentleman vouchsafe teach v kynde couenaunt promised inheritaūce vnto v whether confesse freé freé deny freé paule forthwith cry agaynst doth ascribe promise made vnto abraham blessyng seéde inheritaunce kyngdome eternall lyfe vnto grace vnto law yea also onely law euen hee yet circumcision confesse neédes must bare promise proceéded couenaunt made respect workes freély offred freé goodnesse geuer onely reason osorius render vnto v receaue assurednesse certeine assuraunce called greéke 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 fayth osorius hath described bookes entituled de iustitia bee deriued hauyng affiaunce vpon may man settle affiaunce safely vpon god assuredly promiseth simply without condition certeintie promised god father almightie men without exception freély owne accorde yea fayth onely freély say whereby bountifull mercy god poured vpon fleshe may shyne liuely comfortable chearefulnesse afflicted conscience fayth say bycause thynges depende vpon one condition say beleue sonne procured droppe righteousnes notwithstandyng sophister say fayth righteousnesse abrahamand first let v behold workes holy patriarche abraham inestimable godlynesse neuer condignely enough commended v yet ye heare osorius testimonie apostle touchyng patriarcherom 4 shall say sayth hee father abraham finde accordyng flesh abraham iustified workes hath wherein may glory sight god rom 4 obteine god bee called righteous yes veryly let v seé meanes workes sayth apostle commendation fayth onely maketh v appeare worthy sight godgene 15 abraham beleued god imputed vnto righteousnesse manifest therefore accoumpted righteous meanes forsooth simply respect workes way imputation onely soeuer commeth imputation proceédeth meére mercy imputeth geuen reward proportion duetie dette man imputeth duely owyng vnto let v testimony scripture cōcernyng whiche imputed bycause hee thynges commaunded albeit many thynges wonderfully well bycause beleued god sayd imputed vnto righteousnesse righteousnesse imputed vnto aswell respectes bycause sacrifice vnto god bycause forsooke natiue countrey bycause hee offred onely sonne slayne neither doth apostle ouerskippe conceale cause especially bycause parente posteritie ye also authour doctrine written sayth paule videl imputed vnto righteousnesse sake onely v also shall likewise bee imputed beleue raysed lord iesus death life c rome 4rom 4 thus much concerning abrahā though alone may suffice place others neéde none example yet let v ioyne holy patriarche holy kyngthe fayth righteousnesse dauid dauid abraham beyng deare vnto god equally endued like excellent ornamētes godlynesse vertue whereof one nothyng whereupon glory god disclayme altogether righteousnesse besought nothyng carefully god prayerspsal 142 hee would enter iudgement seruaunt rendreth reason earnest prayer bycause flesh shall iustified thy sight thyng meant paule affirmeth selfe wordes almost man iustified workes law goe wonderfull fruites workes glorious shewe righteousnesse finally shall osorius selfe appeare cleannes good disposition temperaunce mynde singular humanitie lenitie patience chastitie vnfayned charitie absolute huge chaos bountyfull vertues vnseparably vnited linked together chayned fast yron rope dauid great kyng prophet choyse vessell accordyng god owne hart dare presume offer selfe iudgementthe righteousnesse iob iob man commended god singlenesse hart approued holynesse beyng asked question god durst aunswere one word fayth righteousnesse pauleit impertinēt matter speake somewhat paule selfe whose conuersation whiche led vnblameable beyng yet pharisie tertullus selfe could charge fault beyng afterwardes engraffed christ liued vprightenesse conscience osorius cā iustly reprehende worthy crime yet great many ornament holynesse nothyng auayle righteousnesse hee selfe accompted drosse wherefore consider christian reader good felowshyp much difference betwixt osorius paule workes whiche osorius doth glorious pompe grounded vpon fayth fayth christ c fayth righteousnesse cornelius god cornelius mention made actes apostle holy man feared god together whole houshold dealyng much almes poore makyng continuall intercession almighty god great glorious commendation truely excellent godlynesse sensible mā would say ought referred ceremoniall law morall law rather yet selfe cornelius beyng neuer notable commendable bertues vnlesse ye aduertizement ye aungell sent peter might haue endued fayth christ profite gotten towardes attaynement righteousnesse helpes aydes pitie shalbe sayd riche yoūg man proudly vppon trust workes gaue thankes god others lyued spoyle fraudulently deceaue man contractes prodigally cōsume owne goodes defile neighbour wife committed adultery murtherer wrong doer neighbour neither sorte like vnto publicane fasted twise sabboth gaue tenth goodes poore c neéde produce nathanaell nathaniell true israelite christ selfe acknowledge true israelite praysed vnfained simplicitie ye perceiue person besides duetyfull obseruaunce ceremoniall law vtter shewe expresse certeine resemblaunce good workes studious endeuour morall law notwithstandyng ye valewe one myte regarded sight god albeit alledge thing end would extenuate fault iewes paule affirmeth inexcusable osorius doth seé groūde paules accusation agaynst first apostle well forseé law god partes perfect requireth exquisite full absolute obediēce conceaued could possibly performed industry mā neither ignoraunt vnmeasurable arrogaunt pride nation lynked lyke vanitie beyng wonderfull farre way distant meane obseruation law yet swell puft vp false glaueryng conceite owne excellency perfection though left part therof vndone persuadyng vnto thēselues saluation thereby wherein much rather deserued vtter destruction incurre double offence first bycause sundry wayes horribly dishonour defile god sacred law though materiall perfitely accomplished whole law man might iustly marueile wonderfully flattered selues though trimmely behaued selues assayes seemed owne conceite bee prety holy men despising certeine pharisaicall hautines nation besides selues wherfore apostle indifferētly tenderyng miserable errour eche nation aswell gentile iewes doth earnestly debate threé thynges chiefly placethe scope paules disputation romaine first might conuince iewes also gentile indifferently sinner god might remoue false opinion affiance lastly hee might emprinte true way confidence last purpose apostle osorius doth openly bewray blockishe ignoraunce swaruyng varyeng altogether entent apostle although iudgement bee sounde agreable apostle trust whiche iewes reposed law moyses lesse vayne voyde reason confidence gentile framed life law nature yet question moued touchyng assignyng true righteousnesse paule teache one thyng osorius workes ceremoniall morall law excluded frō iustificatiōfor whereas paule doth bende whole force disputation onely marke excludyng deédes workes endeuours whether apperteine ceremoniall morall law rule doctrine maners hee might referre summe iustification hope saluation wholy onely fayth sonne god thyng el doth ciceronian tertullus discourse bookes entituled de iustitia wherein playeth much philosopher though ye schoole morall philosophie el doth breath practize greédely mainteine persuade v wheresoeuer paule doth exclude workes iustificationosori doth take workes excluded frō iustification ceremony law doth exempt nothyng el ceremoniall law conclusion true righteousnesse righteousnesse sight god whiche christ doth impute beleuers fayth righteousnesse euery man doth properly procure make peculiar selfe owne vertue sinceritie innocencie good conuersation offryng combate pardy paule whether quarell iustification paule shall probable argument exclude confidence workes osorius driue fayth vtter exile vnto fayth bookes leaueth maner place truly yeldeth litle credite thereunto neither maruellpag 142 • 140 • matter may lawfull deriue conclusion part wholeosori obiection confuted kynde argument instructed frame argument sorte place osorius sporteth bitterly enough vsing rhetoricall digressiōs sometymes quareller whosoeuer whiche nooseled youth logickeosori doth erre rule logicke taught foolishly senselesly make bald argumēts fetche conclusion vnsufficient numbryng partes affirme ye whole disordered order arguyng place paule twise perhaps speakyng oftentymes law hath relation ceremoniall law ergo wheresoeuer hee maketh discourse law god meanyng tendeth construction euē whole discourse epistle nay rather vnderstand paule throughly would crookedly wrest meanyng owne grosse sensualitie ye easily perceaueosori paralogisme insufficient enumeration partes way negatiue hee doth orderly proceéde surest maner arguyng whole partes vniuersall particular vniuersall proposition may iustly denyed followeth necessitie particular propositiōs may admitted doth say workes law iustifie ye may duely conclude hereof ergo neither ceremoniall morall naturall politicke ciuill law doth worke iustification marke osorius much doe beare doe cut much myne owne right vnto whiche could neuer bee able argument wynne handes admit foundation argument otherwise altogether false yet present tyme graunt seéme true would selfe bee paule doth reason law doth chiefly meane thereby ceremoniall law yet monstruous argument whereby ye trauaile cōfirme affirmation one part ye nagation ye part wise paule doth deny ye ceremoniall law doth iustifie ye iewes ergo morall lawe doth iustifie nay rather much soundly haue reasoned turning cōclusion backward ye ceremoniall law ye principall substaūce moyses law doe iustifie ergo neither part law doth iustifie albeit deny swathlyng cloutes primitiue church whole force eloquence without great commendation witte singular prayse ingenious inuention whole laudable trauaile therein ought chuse accompt prayseworthy men desirous emparte posteritie worthy mo • umentes atchieued excellencie learnyng nymblenesse capacitie seuere pursuyng vertue vertuous discipline wherewith wouderfully beautified returne osorius whose diligence also imitation doe commende hath made choyse especially may direct imitation whereas doth nothyng el affect heathenishenesse doe onely prayse vtterly disallow refuse order study herein men hauyng none commendable exercize wherein might bestow tyme meanes possible beautifie giftes ornamentes nature allure men thereby honest seémely ciuilitie worthely deserue prayse whiche earnestly pursued therfore tullius cicero hath right obteyned garland honest citizen learned philosopher bendyng power excellent vnderstandyng blazyng dueties office men lyfe defence vertue agaynst beastly swynish pleasure epicure esteémed matter worthy study trauaile wherein bestowed diligence actiuitie witte selfe neuer better theame man el could haue handled aboundauntly euen dyd accordyng necessitie present tyme singular learnyng yet besides orderly course naturall doctrine preceptes purer discipline extaunt amongest nation wherein fine nymble wittes might exercize selues therefore maruell hee beyng man endued wonderfull instinct nature embrace thyng chiefest felicitie worthy whereupon might discourse whiche sawe notable greatest prize amongest workes nature neither could rayse mynde beyonde limites nature stretche force capicitie outward righteousnesse obteyned speciall pursuite vertue state tyme altered haue receaued schoolemaister frō heauen whose maiestie surmounteth glory worldly state condition doctrine straighted within boundes nature doth disclose vnto v thynges farre passing reach nature whose scholer ought haue bene osorius especially sithence ye aduaūced high dignitie church haue receaued discernable father vnto v define reason distinguish arte propose order morall principle prophane phisolophye albeit doth describe many tymes occasion offred commeth forth farre higher mystery instrustructing v kyngdome god eternall life true euerlastyng felicitie neither instructyng v onely doctrine powryng also blessednesse v obteyned death confirmed rising agayne doth dispose dayly raignyng ouer v doth enseale vnto v sacrament promiseth word conclude doth geue felicitie owne liberatie without respect reward freély beleue vpon name therfore since tyme altered schoolemaister earst concerning good maners godly action bycause euangelicall philosophye doth call v higher farre deéper mystery doctrine whereof consisteth greater better rudiment study therfore must haue regarde marke say must onely learne seriously know direct course transitory lyfe alsothe end christian philosophie meanes may attayne euerlastyng lyfe much righteousnesse auayleth sight men thyng doth iustifie v sight god beyng addicted altogether rule old maister ethnicke philosophy heape together many good commendable preceptes perfect righteousnesse wherein much misliked ye doe nothyng el selfe thyng whereof haue treated much cunnyngly plentyfully tymewhom osorius doth chiefly imitate cicero bookes office aristotle ethickes plato bookes de legibus many learned men bookes likewise herein surely cā excusable voyde blame bycause agreé good preceptes whereof dispute well bycause fast tyed opinion ye skippe away christ obstinately resist gospell bycause imitate accompt learned ensuyng whole studious industry neglect much imitate prophane writer ye seéme doe nothyng el imitate thē though paganes would become professed pagane disputyng carefully righteousnesse good workes ye make stay rest selfe wholy whence ought haue stept degreé pursued better way higher mystery matter greater importauncevertue embraced men though difference betwixt morall philosophy christian diuinitie ye agayne osoriustrue innocencie mankynde loste long sithence integritie innocent vndefiled lyfe whiche require earnestly yet performe nothyng lesse lost long agoe onely whole nature mankynd generally also altogether lost neuer meanes restored good life beleéuyng onely say righteousnesse though altogether lost v may bee restored grace boūtie christ many time restored faithfull ueryly would graunt vnto much ye speake osorius would either aptly define graceosor obiection cōfuted whereof ye make mention rightly distinguish rigthteousnesse doubted comfortable grace christ doth purchase vnto v perfect righteousnesseby meanes doe recouer true innocencie righteousnesse ye know good syr consisteth doe procure well doyng onely forgeuyng imputed wherefore righteousnesse blessednesse whatsoeuer v blessed sayth whose sinnes forgeuen whose iniquity couered blessed man lord hath imputed offence psal 31 furthermore whō mysticall melodious psalmiste doth call blessed man onely bernarde doth denounce blessed meanyng thereby thyng deéde true meane ayde whence mā may hope eternall felicitie besides onely alone ueryly bycause whole nature mankynde ouerwhelmed sinne vnlesse continuall mercy god dyd preuent v winkyng wickednesse praye could stand iudgement yet selfe osorius haue sinned haue neede glory god yet notwithstandyng onely mercy pardoning v offence case though neuer bene committed wherein beyng old raynebeaten souldiour dare geue credite new gospell let loathe yet least heare bernarde selfe witnesse gospel iudgement herein albeit reported haue seéne thing yet discerne perfectly enough thus speaketh whatsoeuer hath decreéd imputebern sermo 23 super cant though neuer hereunto addeth saying would wish note aduisedly sinne righteousnesse god righteousnesse man mercyfull indulgence god sentence hee doth reiterate agayne place selfe wordes least doth cōfirme wordes much differēt ye sinne sayth committed vndone yet god doe impute shalbe though neuer done c surely sinne shall accompted sinne hath bene committed shall sinner bee taken sinner hath committed sinne followeth necessaryly hereupon must neédes righteous blessed whereby perceaue suppose whence sappe iuyce righteousnesse saluation springeth workes righteousnesse none onely meére mercy god freé pardon hath bene declared testimony bernarde authoritie bernarde cā obteine much credite yet let founde pure immaculate without spotte sinne yea though hee infante dyeng day borne agayne augustine booke de ciuitate dei 19 booke 27 chapteraug de ciuit lib 19 cap 27 purposing declare accompt may made righteousnes transitory life affirmeth ought rather valued forgeuenesse sinnes perfection vertues agayne augustine first booke retractations 19 chapaug retra lib 1 cap 19 commaundementes sayth hee reputed performed whiche left vndone pardoned know whether ierome haue declared ye euidentlyierome saluation consisteth owne righteousnesse free mercy god referryng thyngs freé mercyfulnesse god forgeuyng v speaketh wise christ iesu lord haue hope accesse affiaunce faith righteousnes whose fayth sinnes forgeuen v doe stand long vpon matter ought without cōtrouersie generall consent agreément learned authours antiquitie founde constaunt part consonaunt one thyng much matter therefore beyng playne remayneth two meére contrary allow one vtterly forsake ye say either doe cauill touchyng righteousnesse el doe teache v touchyng god gracious forbearyng two farre different eche admitted righteousnesse obteyned integritie workes neéde haue forgeuenesse come vnto u onely freé benignitie forgeuer beseé loue ye beare myter integritie workes vprightenesse may make righteousnesse perfect farre gesse pardon geuen well deseruynges reward rather offred duety neither truely sayd pardon must craued offence committed ye say paraduenture imperfection doth lurcke secretly deédes though wrought grace god yet wanteth mercyfulnesse god well sayd truely doth darkyng penne cruelly rage agaynst luther franckely accorde doth professe selfe thing though wordes driuē force yeld vnto whether ye say deédes vnperfect lame blynd naked altogether barren hungry vnlesse bee clothed vpholden mercy freé pardon defence wilbe pleadeable iudgement seate god shalbe accompted rather place sinnes seéme deserue reward vertue ye satisfied testimony obstinately persiste opinion still workes may absolutely perfect deserue beseéch make proofe therof reasonable authoritie either vouched holy scripture approued auncient authours ye make soūd proofe behalfe deale yet somewhat soberly v reproches rebuke lye scoldynges outcry spyttynges cursinges glorious hauty speaches triflyng wordes make nothyng purpose part ye neither make proofe vnto v perfect righteousnesse workes demonstration owne workes mā el besides dare presume offer selfe iudgement tryed workes el doe ye chargyng luther sharpely ye condemne franticke braynesicke mā tertullus sometyme accusing paul bee seditous person sauyng accused paule one tyme penne vomityng nothyng el besides fury frensies madnes luther doth continually crawle ragyng degreés seéme neuer make ende thereof vntill ye bryng selfe amongest iewes last crye crucifige vpon crucifige vpon iob euen perfect workes men valew godiob vpright lyuear stand doubtfull feare workes life esay prophet doth cōpare righteousnesse foule menstruous cloth christ selfe doth pronounce endeuours workes vnprofitable paule loathyng remembraunce owne righteousnespaule glorious euer work appeared yet adiudge farre distaunt true righteousnesse hee esteemed better doung dauid durst presume enter iudgement god dauid augustine feareth god behold workes shall finde offence meritesaugust psal 94 shall deale v accordyng desertes shall finde nothyng v damnable ierome doth call v backe frō confidence deédesier esay cap 64 boldly pronounceth cōsider nature vtterly dispayre may lawfull luther vtter mynde christ godly prophetes holy apostle learned auncient father commēded old gospell spake well shall luther melancthon bucer caluin • reproched scoffyng wise new foūde name new gospeller bycause thinke speake selfe thyng luther kynde felow would take part epicureluther defended agaynst osorius would practize let louse reynes voluptuousnes turning men myndes vpsidowne carry away quyte vertuous endeuour loue godlynesse duetie honest trade godly lyfe lust licentiousnesse would place man felicitie corruptible body vayne ticklyng delightes therof altogether purpose ye speake osorius much blamed makyng companion epicure neither would refrayne penne christ helpe would inueigh agaynst power sharpely selfe peruse luther bookes searche sift consider ponder luther writynges exhortation doctrine lesson sermon imagination yea prye narrowly lyfe conuersation shewe say one place example one worde sillable much doth sounde agaynst loue practize vertue may seéme rende sinowes righteousnesse holynesse breéde dislikyng embracyng therof doe bruyse fruites good workes weaken serious trauaile breake honest industry hinder godly enterprise doyng well maner meanes doe extenuate feare due lawes god man finally may seéme thinke lesse may bee seéne perfect deuine behaue selfe dissolutely maners thē resembleth honest iudgement nay rather employ care possible rayse vp men euery place dewe feare god law true obedience honest conuersation earnestly emprinte sight myndes men renowne dignitie worthynesse vertue pic • e godlynes shall haue conquest osori pag 141 euen thyng say epicurus confesse true osorius ye reporte epicurus haue finely pyked cicero cicer tuscul lib 3 doth deny thyrd booke tusculane question epicurus authour voluptuous sentence sayth vttered many soudry notable sayinges seémely enough true philosopher doe ye conclude hereof epicurus doth commende vertue place luther doth also lyke ergo luther epicurean osori accuseth luther epicurean doe ye also conclude agaynst paule hee epicurean bycause doth also selfe thyng rare singular sharpe witted chrisippus whiche altogether beéne nooseled old gospell could neuer haue knitte knot together meére particular propositiōs neither would wō derfull logician haue euer coupled luther epicurus bycause osorius hath borowed argument cicero open iugglyng boxe fewe wordes first shew cicero speaketh next west ciceroniā doth agreé cicero first concernyng cicero whenas maketh mētion epicurus sentēces doth reprehend quicknesse nymblenes witte rather prayseth therfore onely noteth scope end doctrine neither doth condēne sentēces epicurus spake well bycause define chief felicitie though cō sisted onely voluptuousnes herein founde fault without cause epicurus amongest sayinges wrate maner man lyfe could pleasaunt ioyned vertue denyed fortune force apall courage wise man meane lyfe poore better riche denyed also wise man also happy truely saying worthely spoken tully selfe reporteth let v see argument ciceroes ape shape pag 141 luther sayth hee doth offer order perhappes exhorte auditory writyngs sermon dueties lyfe c luther doe osorius doth well finde fault epicurus disputyng sometymes gloriously vertue absurdely osorius doth cōpare luther epicurus notwithstandyng preceptes vtterly wipe away vertue euen lyke craftie conueyaunce luther doth subuerte ouerthrowe dueties vertue godlynesse speake parrotte place doth luther subuerte dueties vertue doth hee blotte honesty godly carefulnesse good men may tollerable slaūders lye deface good name man neuer deserued also dead condemne writynges haue geuen cruell wounde voyde reason vnable alledge one title one place one sillable much iust accusation wherfore ye make slaunderous reproches carry shew truth let v throughly peruse begynnynges luther doctrine proceédyng dayly increasinges therof let v sift ende whole course purporte proceédyng doth forth plucke vp rootes vertue abateth affiaunce man workes ascribeth saluation onely bountie mercy god doth likewise affirme workes saintes world examined vttermost pricke able counteruaile god wrath satisfie iudgement preacheth partes neéde mercy directyng v meane while true marke assured confidence man coupled epicurus though hee authour ouerthrow honesty rather shal adiudged good phisition soule one doth minister wholesome medicine agaynst poysoned errours inueigh contrary maner doctrine admitted wherof luther authourosorius studious care cleare frō deadly sinne also atteine iustified pe • congruum condignum congruum cōdignum conueniencie worthynes knowe well enough fayre flower osorius deceaued glorious speculatiōs old diuinitie whiche agreably seéme accorde old gospell know sure christ neuer knew gospell apostle neuer taught euāgelistes approued auncient catholicke father euer smatche thereof nay rather christ paule apostle sauetie referre v ouer onely mercy god onely geueth kyngdome heauen deseruynges promise sake onely haue sayd enough herein let v proceéde cauillatiōs troublesome trifler though somewhat greéuous idlenesse filthynesse though honest well disposed person fatherly clemencie shall cause child sluggish duty though voyce mercy doth vtterly abolish morall vertues ende therefore doth christ much many vnchast corrupt person abuse nay rather ought net ye truth god greater reason generally openly preached necessary comfort godly neither behoueth v inquisitiue much doctrine doth worke certeine summe paules disputation comprehē ded one syllogisme commaunded god kept absolutely law requireth liuyng creature whether iewe ruled law tenne table gentile lyueth law nature able accomplishe law ought ergo man linyng able attaine true commendatiō righteousnes respect workes necessitie subiect iudgement curse god argument doth whole force pithe paules disputatiō cōsiste deceaued maior first proposition whereof setteth v seueritie god iudgement ye minor second proposition condemneth men generally guilty sinne conclusion allureth driueth men christ necessaryly argument may playnely perceaue vnlesse wilbe wilfully blind like want haue piked one scrappe much haue hitherto raked together salue credite cause finally make shorte referre note marke examine search whatsoeuer churche law steéde schoolemaister lead v hād directly christ law shut vp vnder sinne well iewes gentile promise might geuen vnto beleuers fayth iesus christ whiche title law construed haue apte agreément ceremony iewishe sinagogue workes law maister osorius vnto paule doth promise possession kyngdome exclude wherof luther preacheth sitheace paule selfe doth wisely carefully onely exclude presumption man righteousnesse inheritaūce kingdome also rēder reason wherfore doth law sayth lawe workes ye may beleue osorius therfore ye may better vnderstand matter confidence left consideration workes law law fayth sayth paule lawe consisteth fayth workes say beleue paraphrast law requireth nothyng fayth therfore sithence matter throughly debated holy scripturesright inheritaūce promised workes paul affirmeth discouered manifestly holy ghost shamelesse face dare osorius thrust workes doctrine freé iustification whiche spirite god doth openly reiect impudencie dare affirme paule doth promise right title inheritaūce whiche worke good deédes whereas paule mainteynyng challenge fayth workes pronoū ceth expressely god doth accept fayth righteousnesse whiche doth worke beleueth doth iustifie wicked two sentence beyng meérely opposite contrary eche referre reader iudgemēt whether paule shalbe accōpted vnconstauntosori takē tardy osorius false fabeler heare certeine gruntyng pigge beyng lesse enemy crosse christ thē paule assoone heareth good workes banished effect iustification doth straightway cite v consistorie though vtterly choake vp care studious endeuour liue vertuously cause disguiseth cause vnder title effectes effectes likewise misturneth cause workes properly effectes fayth neither owne nature good esteémed good iustification goyng yet osorius frameth discourse though chief especiall bullwarke righteousnesse built wholy vpō workesaccordyng workes work sake readeth scripture shall come passe accordyng workes ye forthwith cōcludeth done workes sake though rest disputation bycause haue spoken sufficiently suppose one two proposition calleth false whereof hee hath accused luther authour let v fyritte seé vermine able defende selfe first whereas luther hath noted saying ye chief piller foundation christian doctrine man ought ascribe meane saluation thyng el onely fayth iesus christ afterwardes proceédeth pointe ye fruites good workes engendred doe issue fayth euen fruite engendred roote good treé workes doe follow fayth necessitie none otherwise fertile treé budding first greéne leafe beautifull blossome doth last course force nature bryng forth fruite sentence osorius iudgeth haynous wise sufferable yet meane tyme denyeth good workes follow faythosori doth deny good work followe luther fayth cryeth opē mouth false good workes doe follow luther fayth well yet heare meane while good workes engendred fayth wise luther fayth would therfore learne osorius whose fayth good workes doe proceéde pag 146 forsooth fayth sayth hee luther haddones fayth bee luther scholer herein come hither osorius good fellowshyp may stroke ye smoath shauelyng while truely choose beloue beleue also speake truth suppose oracle apollo bee true oracle workes doe follow fayth say follow deéde apasse great cluster bycause ye vouchsafe selfe expresse vnto v kynde workes arewhat maner workes doe follow osori fayth shall greéue much behalf yet neéde make proclamatiō whenas owne bookes aboundauntly manifestly vtter man blynd deafe must neédes seé heare art thou desirous reader haue described vnto theé painted table blossom pregnaunt fayth osorius doth shewe forth peruse writynges bookes especially inuectiues compiled agaynst luther haddon euer man world hath heaped together many lye vpon lye hath compacted many blasphemy slaunders hath vttered many errours hath euer writyng practize imagined expressed vomited many tauntes reproches madde wordes vanity cursinges bragges folly thrasonicall crake much rascallike scoldyng mockes doggishe snarllyng beast hath brayed one booke wherein shall neuer finde luther named coupled together title reproche outragious frāticke madde trimme monument gay workes cleaue fast dayly conuersatiō ryfe founde euery bookes testimony witte appeale iudgement indifferent reader consideration may bee fayth whelpeth vnto v monstruous lytter good •••• growyng vpon sounde roote commonly bryng forth fruites vnlike stocke child doe vsually represent progenitours byrth lineamentes personage resemblaunce maners applyable feature nature gleade prouerbe doth hatche forth piggeons must surely follow necessitie either workes whereof vaunt crest meanes follow fayth el must neédes adiudge man scarse fayth therefore aunswere briefly glorious vauntes whiche make touching workes follow faith luther fayth meane workes haue rehearsed gladly agreé meanyng tende good workes truly owne writynges without witnes condemne great lyar go ye let v allow vnto require graunted say fayth doth necessaryly drawe good deédes southeast wynde doth draw along cloudes yet thestoppell meane space barre good deédes luther haddones fayth pag 146 bycause say fayth commeth hearyng hearyng word god acknowledge catholicke maxime sentence meéte true christian wonder monster moūtaines bryng forth last luther fayth commeth hearyng hee doth heare wordes christ wordes pray writtē forsooth christ sayth doth promise euerlastyng life repente doth man ace hell destruction impenitent seéke reader luther fayth yeldeth good workes accordyng osorius pag 146and bycause luther doth heare wordes christ ergo fayth commeth hearyng therefore yeldeth fruites good workes starke bryers bramble onely go doth fayth ye meane space osorius let v heare grape produceth fayth sayth say faith holy church whenas cōsenteth wordes christ whenas also christ hym selfe doth threaten destruction impenitent sinner fayth therfore wherewith doe beleue wordes christ causeth repentaunt heare osorus neédeth repentaunce manifold great treasure good workes doe flow plētyfully riuer fayth workes prepare assured way perfect righteousnes mā dare presume challenge ye name righteous man respect vnrighteous dealyng yt repenteth good deédes let v marke sequele tale ibidem agayne whenas lord doth say shall bee frendes ye thynges commaunde geue credite christes wordes fayth workes osorius doe earnestly desire receaued vnto frēdshyp employ power soule fulfill commaundements c truely commēde osorius accompt happy man also performe deédes ye protest wordes neédeth make playster repentaunce much accomplish god commaundementes say doe apply power soule may accomplish pray bycause doe beleue christes wordes therfore yeld carefull endeuour doe thyng amisse may purge repentaunce may obserue good preceptes vtterest abilitie behold reader platforme osorius fayth whiche succeédyng encreasinges dayly buddyng blossomes yeldeth continuall fruites beautifull holy workes cōteined sappe braunches barke pleasaūt stocke commeth passe first bycause hee endued fayth fayth proper peculiar holy church thē bycause doth beleue wordes christ furthermore bycause doth prepare selfe fayth may clense sinnes repentaunce shall become meane space righteousnesse workes confession sinnes lastly bycause doth addresse conuersation lyfe neare line leuell christes rule go let v compare platforme fayth fayth luther haddon together osorius god name doth credite christes wordes luther haddon distrusting christ hath geuen credit wordes christ osorius beleuyng christ esteémyng aright wordes gaue selfe repentaunce became good christian mā enured selfe thereunto hee abhorreth owne wickednesse become obedient christes commaundementes iollyfellowes haue raunged lyfe long carelesse securitie men neuer touched remorse repentaūce regarde amendemēt lyfe doctrine christ auaunte therefore cursed luther cōpanion haddon byrdes ill feather vnbelief could neuer enduced haue neither beleue christ come repentaunce yet accomplish christes preceptes might least haue taken example osorius patterne thereby haue learned fayth bytternesse repentaunce shewe osorius faythbut goe bycause osorius doth triumph gloriously credite hee geueth christes wordes let v discusse truth speach search difference betwixt fayth whereof maketh bragges luther fayth take example wordes christ gospell theseiohn 6 father hath sent euery one seeth sonne sumptuously obedient brother whenas carrieth vpon shoulder scattered lost sheepe looketh narrowly lost groate bindeth vp woundes fell among theeues offereth selfe phisition sicke gladlythe vynearde hee compareth setteth last first hee promiseth paradise theefe faithes sake onely fashioneth paule deadly enemie apostle whenas doth onely receaue mercy gentile castawayes nature excluded promise voyde hope reprobate idolatrie hath greater estimation naturall sonnes hee meane el example disclose vnto v secret mystery iustification consisteth rather forgeuenesse sinnes doyng good deédes righteousnesse imputed purchased workes neither worketh saith hee beleeueth christ iustifieth wicked yet seémyng bee much acquainted righteousnes imputation ye dare name worde imputation doe notwithstandyng stand much owne conceite though christ commyng finde fayth osorius playne demonstration osori geueth small credite wordes christ fayth luther man might bold vneasie matter pike diuers morall vertues vertuous conuersation wherein mā easilye determine whether doth shewe selfe iniurious luther bewray rather owne blockish grosenesse man euer taught soundlythe doctrine luther touchyng good workes man highly commended good workes luther beyng separated part doctrine iustification whereas doth extenuate force workes treatize iustification doth therein altogether derogate workes rather frendly aduertize whiche vayne confidence workes doe challenge selues righteousnesse sight god depende much vpon deseruynges workes though none foūteine whence saluation might deriued luther therfore vsing argumēt agaynst person doth boldly auow workes defiled yet simply respect application beyng considered without fayth mediatour whiche beyng truely spoken luther sinisterly wrested osorius though spoken simply good commendable thyng workes nothyng acceptable god though neuer duetyfully vertuously performed cause hee concludeth last vnuanquishable argument meanes possible luther fayth could bryng forth frutefull workes like barren figge tree growyng neare vnto high way whereupon grewe nothyng leaues osorius owne conclusion luther sophisticall cauill concludyng falsely paule extenuate despise boldly originall sinne decay nature wordes could neuer finde one able suppresse vtterly subdue strength therof deéde mortall lyfe except onely man written whiche doth accuse sinne proceede luther fayth ye logicke conclude likewise ergo nothyng world besides crowe blacke skill learned osor packe go let v chaūge name men let matter remayne place luther let v vse name paule marke wise reason rather onely name person beyng chaunged paule complainyng sinne doth accosiber flesh doth protest yt flesh dwelleth good thing ergo good workes engēdred paules fayth difference pray betwixt wordes paule luther positiō ye compare together rightly whenas eche vnelagreable assent haue relation selfe vnuanquishable tyranny originall sinne let v heare necessarily consequent must follow wonderfull reason wherewith hee would seéme proue luther fayth ye vtter subuertour good workes wise crawleth forward lyeng spirite mouth much man enterprise good action vnlesse doe first sophistey may somewhat allow ye behold matter thereof certes doctours diuinitie reiect faultie vnlesse sayth kyngdome sinne first vtterly cut c truly would much stand osorius first expresse vnto v apely distinctlya twosold kyngdome sinne meane worde kyngdome whereas deuines agreé two sortes sinne whiche call actuall sinne whiche also doe distinguish two maners wayes sinne reigning sinne rebelling must teach v whether two meane one thyng suffer thy selfe carryed away sinne yeld thy selfe willingly captiue tyranny vanquished sinne weakenes first cōmeth next infirmitie many tymes ouercome sinne neither liueth flesh offendeth sometymes sondry wayes yet notwithstanding ouercome agaynst willes drawyng backe chosen seruaunts god sondry tymes cast sinne reigning mēbers neuer yeld ouer wholy subiectes kyngdome uery well therfore doth paule counsell v let sinne reigne fleshly body rom 6 rom 6 yet paule alwayes bring passe good yt would worke many tymes euill would sinne dwellyng neuer humbly haue disclaymed god iudgement submitted comfort pardon onely freé mercy god let v annexe hereunto aurel august altogether disagreéyng osorius hee setteth downe much playnly booke de man life amongest rest innumerable ouerflowyng multitude sinner shalbe reply made beleéue deuine integritie one gentleman osorius wonderfull conuersation absolute holynes angelike chastitie culuerlike simplicitie linked together seraphicall humilitie incomprehensible innocencie alone amōgest child woman hath beautified whole world brightnesse righteousnes carrieth vertues fast lockt sacred cheéste breste dayly numbred hath quenched boylyng froathe originall sinne hath vtterly subdued brought bondage whole empire therof euen one pushe hath partes absolutely fulfilled eche tittle cōmaundemēts hath tamed flesh concupiscence thereof hath supressed affection hath well disposed order addressed whole course life euen haled hyghthe holy perfect life oso compared frācise certeine stretched reache mynde beyonde heauens rapted fraternitie frauncisce selfe enflamed vnquencheable desire deuine zeale hee treade awrye much wilbe blotted one spotte crime suspition crime bee neuer litle yeld temptation sathan infirmitie flesh seéne blemish suspition sinne one solecisme incongruitie yet idle speache wordes disorder whole lyfe conuersation whose mouth shall issue idle word lye dare boldly lord god meanes comfortable confession sondry time frequented great force popish cōfession haue escaped infinite wickednesse wherfore haue tyme subdued lust haue forsaken voluptuous filthynesse haue bene desirous embrace chastitie haue bene enlightened sparckle godly zeale wholy ascribe effectuall operation therof sacrament whiche holy ghost hath emparted vnto great store grace c test beyng first ouerwhelmed innumerable iniquity hee haue attayned righteousnesse length vertue sacred sacrament much hath shaken yoake concupiscence hath cut throate cut head kyngdome sinne neéde hath repeate cōfessiōs oft wounde whoale neéde playster surgery sinne bee abolished purpose serueth dayly custome confessiō end absolution craued feéle yet somewhat lurkyng within forceth betwixt while runne agayne oft confession ye drugges absolution affirmeth boldly ye kyngdome sinne wholy cōquered v couragiously fightyng agaynst luther doctrine wordes whereas life agreeth altogether wt luther finally osorius dare presume stoutely vpon owne conscience hauyng vtterly crusht peéces kyngdome sinne hee acquainted therewith may preiudice may forthwith frankely iustifie selfe phariseé say thanke theé lord heauēly father men like vnto publican luther seély sheépish bucerans fast twise weéke geue tenth possesse yea besides also dayly enure selfe holy cōfession c hereof enough let v proceéde remnaūt rable raked lye follow furthermore holy vnblameable god pag 148 euen truly voyde crime accordyng luther doctrine bee voyde crime hee denyeth sinne extinguished affirmeth flame abomination broyle therof whotte flamyng ouē scorching cōsumyng thing meanes whereof man bee founde vnblameable without spotte sutteltie sophisticall cauill tendeth last end god hath chosen v sayth apostle become holy vnblameable according luther doctrine man holy without fault lyfe therfore hereof ensueth vnauoydeable conclusion bycause man liuyng cleare frō offence therfore neither haddon lutheranes reckoned amongest god elect packe ye hence therefore banished outlawes ye vyle lutheranes packe ye hence torne ragged workes helles osorius damnable curse gate election opened vnto pope osorians phigianes hosianes eckyans others like lordynges whose pure choise behauiour droppe filth founde worthy reproch osorius selfe bene shamelesse beastly blaze abroad trifling argumēt would haue loathed haue rehearsed place would vouchsaued aunswere thereto thought good geue reader tast blockishe ignoraunce might smile while least learne esteéme poppet reason almost booke scarsely founder matter scattered part thereof osori argumentatiō discussedfirst apostle teache elected chosen become holy true whereby may perceaue osorius whatsoeuer holynes endued withall doth neither goe accompany election ought follow altogether order tyme onely respect end effect thereof apostle doth say god hath chosen v bycause holy afterwardes proue holy become holy god electiō cause effect good workes good workes follow electiō order time seé cause contrary reason iustification likewise necessaryly follow much consideration one hath chosen hath iustified grace hath chosen v hee sayd also haue iustified v one selfe meane one selfe ende god hath chosen v ye aske cause freé mercy accordyng good pleasure ye seéke meane christ iesu ye looke ende worke good deédes good deédes sake deseruinges prayse glory grace truly none otherwise fareth matter iustification god freé mercy hath chosen also hath freély iustified meanes christ iesu bycause foresawe would holy ende walke circumspectly holyly sight emporteth sayingto irreprehensible taken scripture become holy vnblameable paraduenture osorius bee opinion catharres celestines donatifies imaginyng herein full absolute regeneration renewed nature signified vnto v accomplish kynde thyng grecian call 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 without god election iustification could meanes consist ueryly could wishe withall hart could direct course lyfe sort accordyng puritanisme osorius endued integritie angelicke innocē cie part life might defiled blemish iust reprehension shall say condition man life weakenesse fleshe euery man hath infirmitie haue yet put nature man altogether bee forthwith transformed angel goe come passe brickle estate frayltie v doe folter falldowne therfore excluded forthwith electiō haue lost benefite iustification doe thinke osorius sence shall ye electiō god sayd permanent may cut haue ende shall called stedfast assured hange vpon vncerteintie frayltie true elect say fall tyme deserued rebuke thē shall euery one yt worthy rebuke forthwith cast frō electiō good felowshyp osorius fall happē baptisme say baptisme doth washe cleane away shall fayth christian repentaunce clense offence baptisme likewise forgeuenes trespass christian doe commit baptisme ende article christian creéde wherein cōfesse remission sinnes offence made purpose serueth pardon surely nothyng blameworthy pardon may goe play let v seé dispoyle v article fayth withall bereue v hope remission erste bosted boldly strong belief wordes christ say god chuse v vnblameable heare osorius allow obiection likewise accept myne aunswere whatsoeuer forgeuen guiltie pardon purged forgettyng forgeuyng nothyng remaynyng terrifie person imputatiō make dismayed controllement may bold glory paule dothrom 8 shall accuse elect god god doth iustifie shall condemne v may lawfully adde hereunto shall comptroll v seé therfore wise god elect doe appeare excusable righteous much cleannesse deédes bountie imputeth begynnyng vnrighteous natureaugust epist 95 speake augustine wordes conuersion sinne righteousnes nothyng blameworthy bycause doth please fatherly clemēcie exact sharpe narrow triall hath chosen sonne therefore apostle notyng thyng sayththe cause end election hath chosen christ iesu become holy vnblameable c wherein haue cause end electiō cause christ ye grace god christ end herein signed become holy vnblameable speaketh wise chuse thē lead vncorrupt life ende might engraffe christ chuse v christ iesu first liue holy vnrebukeableosori obiection meanes vnrebukeable say whenas elect selues free faulte luther doth say aunswere playne easie whereas luther doth denythe confutatiō obiection god true elect freé frō guilt seémeth therein haue regard ye frayltie mās nature making comparison therof doth set directly opposite seuere iustice god law weake nature bēding force much may agaynst ye assault sinne although get vpperhād sometymes yet besides yeldeth ouer oft vāquished euē chiefly whē hath obteined maistry doth neuer yet expresse ye immaculate sinceritie vndefiled vprightenes mainteinyng ye battell default may foūde perfect obedience pumples yet sticke fast ye flesh may easily espied curing wherof shalbe cōstreined necessitie pray ayde generall triacle church lord forgeue v sinnes c yt augustine wordes may well verified hereaugust de natura gra cap 53 ye possibilitie nature much presumed vpon woūded maymed troubled vtterly destroyed neédeth true confession false purgation c furthermore apostle maketh addition thar become holy vnblameable seémeth therein much respect ye naturall perfectiō innocēcy doubt whether may foūde angel ye zealous mynde godly earnestly bent affectiō euery v life vprightnes euery seuerall vocatiō meanyng nothyng placeels thē place thraldome vnder wicked rebellion voluntary yeld ouer member ye body sinne meanes bryng selfe bondage wickednes meanyng apostle suppose therfore chosen god delighted mynde cōcupiscence flesh fulfill lust therof become holy euery v world demeane selues callying soberly vprightly godly seémeth chosen holy one god whereby may sufficiently perceaue deceaued sentēceshow holynes frayltie concurraunt holy one paule hath written cōcernyng holynes luther touching naturall infirmitie repugnaunt one agaynst may admitted well enough hereof ariseth repugnauncie outward conuersation obseruyng rule function duely may sayd simple maner speach vnfaynedly say sight god man may demeane selfe honestly whose nature notwithstādyng filthe may cleaue may necessitie compell crye elect vessell god predestination freewill lvther affirmeth freewill thyng name onelyof predestinatiō freewill pag 149 150 151 name without substaunce mā patiēt agent drawen doth purpose deliberate thyng man instrument onely sawe axe whiche god doth frame force whether whereunto pleaseth mā hath power strēgth reserued either doe good cōmit wickednesse much able onely good euill also thinke thought meanes selues moreouer name luther vnderstād also withall melancthon bucer caluin rest iolly fellowes whose opinion writynges tend effect length difference may seeme betwixt man toole instrument uery good tyme syr blessed bee houre wherein come length combersome crabby treatie freéwill beyng heretofore oft tost fro common schooles assembly disputation deuines many combates turmoyles hath last founde champion hope whose onely force actiuitie beyng defended shrowded vnder target aiax shall able endure withstād assaultes coūtermoyles heretiques whatsoeuer whereas heretofore vnsearcheable gulfe hath encombred entangled wittes study many notable clerkes cardinalles byshops priestes bottome depth whereof could notwithstandyng neuer yet bee attayned vnto suppose onely let thereof hitherto hath bene osorius hatched produced proctour cause sithence vpstarte wrestler skipt ouer old barrier hath catcht collers hand may man doubt whole force enemy beyng vtterly discomsited compelled fleé field maiestie freéwill hauyng bene long tyme wounded weakened greéuous maladie yea feéblenesse euen yeldyng vp ghost shall presently recouer health stand vpon feéte strong lusty gallaunt disdayneth encounter bythus sometyme bacchius ecerinus pacidianus hercules agaynst twohercules able stād agaynst two yet osorius agaynst foure horarius agaynst threé brother one man hand hand onely valiaunt courage challengeth field agaynst foure choise tryed souldiours one choppe together witte luther melancthon bucer caluine yea also agaynst whole armye lutheranes agaynst neuerthelesse osorius durst haue cast gloue liued amongest v present aunswere challenge defende cause doubt iustie crake proude iacke bragger would carry small coūtenaunce moue godly displeasaunt withall rake dead graues pike quarell agaynst ghostes spirites common guise euery rascall varlet discreét well disposed hath bene accompted filthy contemptuous yea abhorred osorius present discourse freéwill alledgyng one thyng agaynst whiche writynges bookes fully aunswered satisfied yet though made aunswere crawleth hee foreward neuerthelesse patchyng together rotten motheaten trumperie wherein neither thyng owne inuētion new stuffe hath somewhat furbushed old rusty argumentes raynebeaten souldiours fresh glaze raylyng slaunderous tearmes like foolish choughe attiryng selfe wholy feather fowles respect also vyle lothsome doe arguyng make certeine shew reason vouched either scripture doctours wrongfully wrested part doth frame discourse rather accusing men discussing controuersie doth handle mattersosori couragious accusing arguyng one hauyng regarde rather person agaynst hee quarelleth cause ought haue bene discouered osori stinolous foolish treatyng free willthe man fully persuaded freewill ought mainteyned meanes possible choyse mā thyng freé freé man necessary difference betwixt freé necessary many maner wayes necessary taken doth neither discouer definition distinguishe argument deuide partition doth declare diuersitie difference ought betwixt braunche braunche many sondry person haue stoutely maynteined quarell freewill yea wt lesse courage would haue done ye state countrey bene hazard quarell long sithence celestines pelagians kept great sturre agaynst augustin amōgest many others late yeares wrate chiefly roffensis eckius agaynst luther cardinall pighius hath stuffed vp tenne inuectiues full agaynst caluine likewise many others haue written agaynst melancthon agaynst bucer others albeit preuayled litle agaynst truth yet end might easily deceaue vnder certeine visour ye truth shuffle amōgest owne writynges many sentence scripture many also approued doctours osorius intendyng vphold freewill beyng great ieopardie perish doth bryngeth vttereth length elles certeine simple croppes scattered fieldes holy scripture hath gleaned together wretchedly misordereth make assertion get credite yet nothyng auayleable purpose god knoweth meane while citeth one world much autenticke monumentes auncient authours augustine altogether busied decydyng controuersie ought chiefly haue bene guided cause either bycause hath practised science read nothyng writer el bycause wicked craftely dissembleth thynges whiche hath read yet notwithstandyng portingall champion carrion leaue knowledge scripture altogether disfournished doctours persuadeth selfe man good enough may 36 article well last maister inquisitour frame vnto v ergo pag 151 luther heretique dispoyleth man freewill traueileth chiefly end affirme man mynde alwayes holden captiue fast bound power workyng taken away much neither good euill cā thinke thought much meanes doth luther teach onely melancthon also aboundauntly yea much plentyfully caluine doth debate heare osorius aunswere luther luther shall aunswere fully selfe first touchyng whiche terme man choyse whether ye conster reason surely luther neuer deny dare boldly affirme behalfe melancthon caluine also certes men neuer reasonably madde despoyle man define endued reason reason reason cā operation sequested partthe repulse cauill vse reason resteth howsoeuer nature corrupted first originall sinne yet remaineth neuerthelesse thyng certeine sort within v still receaued treé knowledge good euillwill cā seuered frō reason thus must noted chiefly wise remayneth auayle way saluation hurteth rather thereunto therfore concernyng naturall property luther neuer foolishe lutheranes exclude nature meanes nature selfe engraffed men let therfore remayne vnshaken cōtrouersie touchyng substaūce freewill essenciall substaūce therof vnited together sensible reason doth alwayes cleaue inseparably naturethe substaunce freewill neuer seuered nature neither luther deny lutheranes euer deny say luther deny freewill tell vnderstandyng able conceaue adam created absolate freedomeit controuersie adam first creation endued wonderfull absolute freédome vpholdyng freédome grace god wantyng tyme without could stand fast good wherein created though would haue stand fast geuen left power freewill left hee would haue stoode fast hee neuer bene euill would bene euill yet neither could bee good force owne freewill without god speciall grace beyng thus left power owne freewill neither would stand fast could fall without sinne sinnyng abusing owne freédome brought passe lost cast away selfe freédome withall yet wise remained neither sense feélyng vse lost whereas immortall freé hath lost freédome also immortalitie righteousnesse withall whereby came passe wretched man losing pure freédome good receaued first creation purchased selfe posteritie miserable lamentable bondage therfore beyng clogged fastened state bondage cloyed claye albeit certeine sorte reteine still power vnderstandyng appetite whereby mynde freé motiō able discerne betwixt sensible obiectes yet neuer selues aspire agayne vprightenesse immortalitie haue lost beyng fast yoaked sold vnder yoake seruitude doe serue seruile thraldome fleshe turne selues one side force freédome shall alwayes bondslaues sinne death vnlesse grace christ helpe v set v libertie whereby may easily perceaue osorius state condition freewill man free free witte one sense may taken altogether freé agayne sense otherwise freé ye call backe nature mankynd first creation demaunde generally whether freé nature doe aunswere nature selfe created vpright first god good creatour endued freewill man selfe became enemy freédome destroyed ye nature vtterly proceéde make question demaūde kynde sinne entred man towardes naturall euill thyngs towardes deceitfull good thynges aunswere mās call freewill altogether prone enclined wicked euill thyngesthe title onely freewill haue bare title freewill demaunde mās affectioned good godly thynges luther doth affirme neither freé effectuall selfe inclinable thereunto boldly confesse yt bond seruile altogether captiuate vnlesse hoipen bycause mās vnable attēpt thyng selfe bycause owne power able well well thyngs yt apperteine vnto godthe name freewill without effect agayne may seé name freewill voyde vse substaunce concernyng proper qualitie operatiō freédome albeit reteine ye name freewill ye church respect title bycause seémeth alwayes freé either righteousnes free sinne yet ought alwayes holden sorte freé beyng alwayes good yea rather neuer good deéde vnlesse gouerned goodnesse almightie god thyng augustine doth notably expresse sayingaugust vpō wordes apost serm 13 freewill sayth nothing worth vnlesse god doe gouerne immediately effect thy whiche called free apt sufficient ill becommeth damnable bondmayde c harken osorius bondmayde freé thē ill bee damnable augustine reporteth selfe nothyng euill wherefore luther condemned saying freewill doth sinne deadly worketh cā selfe c selfe osorius discerne title voyde substaunce freewill wherein cā finde nothing effectuall purpose say ye worke saluation luther doth take away man freedome willfor much therefore request accuser maketh contendeth friuolously agaynst luther mooneshyne water title onely whether bycause hee taketh away men freédome touchyng substaunce matter quarell agaynst luther whole controuersie ariseth forme qualitie well luther doth deny man vnderstād freédome onely osorius yet may suffice accuser quilty shall make simple denyall onely behaueth consider diligently sense wordes deny made libertie hee meaneth maner person thyngs libertie may knowen neither doth luther vtterly abandone nature mā freédome though freédome though fait chayned yron roapes could moue selfe vse albeit say deny freé confesse thyng name title onely yet doth affirme bee simply title though man though neuer neuer neuer freé therefore article doth learnedly annexe wordes restrainte post peccatum sinne whiche wordes luther osorius doth craftely dissemble skippe ouerthe word luther touchyng title onely expounded besides also added thereunto exception tyme witte ante iustitiam gratiam righteousnesse grace whiche playne wordes might otherwise sharpewitted enough haue easely discerned freewill simply altogether taken away neither men order nature seyng state adam sinne perfect integritie freewill also seyng grace receaued freewill mighty persōs made freé christ rest yet stickyng fast cloyed old puddle sinne yet come bee regenerated grace person question moued freewill efficacie owne naturefreewill beyng grace while doth selfe sinneth deadly luther doth aū swere truely thyng title onely sinneth deadly worketh selfe though endeuour best meanyng hereby albeit freewill continue bee called freewill first de ••• mination state yet hath vtterly lost substaunciall operation thereof lost whatsoeuer enterprise attempt yet auayle one iote much substaunce matter vntill first nature beyng renewed fayth fashioned new new creature well haynous matter length conteineth sentēce may prouoke barke cruelly haue espied freewill may auayle person godward thyng declare pray bee nothyng wherein hath luther
