although arrogaunt insolē cy beyng long tyme reasonably well snafled greéke frenche emperours would yeld prerogatiue auncient constitution permitted vnto themthe wayward rebellion pope alwayes inuestiture temporall authoritie whē accomplished effect began attempt matter much waighty witte byshops owe due obedience become pope uassalles stand courtesie wheras byshops subiect ye emperour man clymbe state imperiall lawfull election pope hereof many decreés extaunt abroad shamefully forged much shamefully countenaunced faced maiestie imperiall subdued subiect popesthe maiestie empire beyng thus brought subiectiō worne quite countenaunce intollerable arrogancy byshops grew outrage contented haue pluckt owne neckes colier lawfull obedience drew also vnto selues emperours interest execrable sort moyle turmoyle oppresse enforcyng onely sweare allegeaunce obediēce vnto prostrate selues kisse euen stinkyng feéte also extollyng magnifieng owne absolute power monarchy meane space sowe treachery treason frederick addressing supply asia necessary defence christianes agaynst saracen calleth back frō iourney immagineth deuises lettes pyketh quarrells agaynst hym accuseth knowe crymes forceth make hys purgation rome putteth pennaunce stirreth vppe vnspeakeable conspiraces agaynst hym wrappeth horrible curse finally raged outrage agaynst depart without taking leaue circumuēted ye cruell cramp pope hindered hys iourney coulde intercession released blinde ridicoulous course payment hundred xx thousand ounce goldethe filthy gaynes pope stopt throate vnsatiable enforced ye archbishoppes treuers saxone determine vpō emperour chosen themperour sent embassadours pope receaued fauour pope drew instrumēt cōditions annexed witte confesse error heresy prince cytties none depart frō empyre committe hymselfe child goodes possession hys mercy thenceforth neuer meddle without hys permissiō sufferāce article albeit thēperour vnwilling yealde vnto yet pope perceaued state empyre woulde accepte hys owne sacred holynes vpon easter day appoynteth emperour charles 4charles 4 appoynted emperour agaynst ludouick true emperour procuremēt clement 6 last ludouick beyng poysoned without procurement practize mercifull clement departed thys lyfe ierome marius doth record within yeare election charles yeare 1347 length charles pope annoynted emperour contrary ordinaunce state thend confirme dignitie imperiall hys sonne hys successor ioyneth league elector fayre promise bribe passeth ouer reuenewes thempyre elector establishe succession hym hys posteritie aeneas siluius doth report agayne elector bound sayd charles oathe shoulde neuer require restitution reuenewes agayne elector enioy euen day meanes whereof came passe romayne empyre beyng thus embased reuenewes empayred turkishe outrage hath long sithence freely possessed great part christendome without resistaunce like preuayle yet much power force christianes beyng rent asunder skattered abroad none power potētate eyther able dare aduēture withstand mighty puyssaunce outragious furye verye cause mischiefes haue part issued frō pestilent sincke rome building hys rauenous neast none furniture scrappes heé skrapeth together violent seditious partaking faction dissentions prince hath brought christendome small handful ye last yt christian prince iarring alwaies emōgest thēselues seeme yt neuer willīg one agreé togethers prouisiō made turckes able tyme make partyes good agaynst cōtinuall inuasuones roades whiche tyraunt doth dayly make christendome haue shewed recordes example sufficient whiche true let osorius himselfe confute hys antiquitie whereof vaūteth singuler skill true deéde shall neuer able disproue thē become wonderfull obedience lawfull magistrate consideration maiestie sayth refuseth ordinaunce higher power doth yelde vnto cesar belongeth cesar yt vnto god yt due vnto god addeth moreouer beleeue according testimony paule lawfull magistrate established ordinaunce god resisteth lawfull aucthoritie outh adiudged much resiste man resiste god himselfe wordes hartyly vnfaynedly vttered professe honorably wordes meruayle thē frō whēce came cruell rebellionthe onely pope rome common pestilence christianes europe ecclesiasticall seignorie agaynst superiour power whence mōstruous turmoyles empire execrable alteration state many hundred yeares came first principall cause whiche tumultes commotiōs alteration • prang el fromout boyling fornace pope canckered contumacye agaynst liege lordes emperoures hence came warres emperour henry 4 5 fridericke 1 2 hence battell ludowicke bauiere ludowicke austriche vproares maiestie kyngdomes onely violated power weakened prince combatyng ech like brother cadmus destroyed church also miserably torne many godly conscience driuen greéuous anguish minde perillous staggering vncerteintie outragies byshops extoll enlarge false forged dominion conceaued false forged opiniō effect canker botch church europe besides stroake shall authority paule forbiddeth resistaūce beare amongest ruffling prelate delightyng sporting selues priuely seé prince subiectes together eareshow sheéding precious bloud fayle happely finde fauour hys father shall forthwith steppe forth help neéde become mediator sinnes people emongst saincts dwelleth sainct tho beckett archbishop deuises olde dottards onely occupy idle heades withall osorius doth stoughtly defend idolles necessary helpes meanes rayse vppe men forgetfulnes herein meete two occurrantes whiche neuer wonder gulfe phanaticall forgettfulnesse seéme owne conceiptes skarse religious vnlesse bedawbe temple euery side picture poppettes moreouer mawmettes signes sainctes erected church none ende put beholder abuse playne idolatrye ezechias worthely praysed banishing monument amongst people euen dyd prouidently prouide bookes salomon entituled de curandis morbis abolished likewise assoone common people beganne abuse wytchcraft enchaūtment reported greék commentary let v proceéde remnaunt catholicke description witte thinges appertayne fayth workes sacramentes sacred mother church neyther fayth catholickes playnly seen heretiques doth eyther diminishe hope attayning honest lyfe vtterly feare • afety osorius pag 171 doth worke thys rather make men willyng embrace vertue yet desiste neuerthelesse stand meane tyme alwayes feare seueritie god iudgement pray whosoeuer caried ardent fayth vnto christhow fayth catholickes ioyned hope feare doth beautifie aboūdant stoare vertue moreouer whenas men know christ seuere iudge hys commaundementes alwayes continuall feare well whereunto tendeth osorius maisterly debated touching fayth hope feare cō fesse playnely dul capacitie able cō ceaue asse vnlesse open thinges ye treate vpon distincktly playnely except ye come length somewhat nearer matter whereupon debate meane thus fayth doth weaken man hope may ought god assistaunce lyue godly vertuously worlde gaynesay herein nay rather one thing doth ye fayth gospell emprinte v deepely desire lyue godly doth teach carefully good worke coupled fayth begonne fayth sence meaning wordes tend ende ye thinke force fayth consiste onely thisconfidence workes osor fayth open euery man hope attayn perfectiō lyfe workes sake may make v righteouse sight god altogether agaynst dare boldly affirme voyce byshoppe deuyne filthy heretique moreouer annexe feare hereunto vnderstand thus christian fayth ought alwayes lincked together feare god man deny racke feare god seuere iudgement adding distinction extremityhow feare ought ioined fayth gospell leaue vnto v assuraunce sauetye deteigne men wauering mammering ye seéme affirmacion thē emplye thus much scripture promise euen though god would deale elect onely rigour law promise grace lesse blockishe also marcheth next rancke touchyng workesof workes wherein dignitie church deserueth singuler wonderfull commendation true beleéued true churchosorius pag 172 catholickes beleue sayth good workes godly personage defiled leste infection vncomelynesse partes vpright holy make men righteous holy whō exercized touchyng matter matter freewill also hath bene spoken sufficiently already ceremonyes sacrament pag 171the next fable ensueth concerneth ceremony sacramentes holy mother churche rome doth obserue order beleueth holynes ceremony religiō sacrament newly instituted yet deuised witte fine man haddon auncient greatest antiquitie preserued full generall consent holy father ought purely reuerently worshypped c man may dare bold without singuler impudencie much grudge agaynst ceremony holy aunciēt long continuaunce euen age euander suppose instituted sayth wonderfull trauaile holy father established autenticke cōsent though otherwise growen neuer huge quantitie may seéme ouerwhelme christian people vnmeasurable rable albeit many christian wedded vnto thē yt bidding adiew christian fayth small nomber repose chief ankerhold holynesse righteousnes trinckets yea though also striue preserue much stoughtly couragiously law selfe commaundementes god runnyng lightly ouer ceremony presseth foreward sacramentes confession first next euchariste whē fall sayth first meaneth word falle consideration righteousnesse settled interrupted course liuyng well giftes holynes righteousnesse powred euen christ selfe assertiō doth emporte reason falles spottes filthy life stand together great many ornamentes righteousnes receaued christ selfe great righteousnesse neédeth confession much men let v ascribe frayltie man natu • e men may lumper trippe go sanctuary ye afterwardes fleé reliefe forsooth rotten plancke may saue man amyddes swallowyng gulfe beyng throwen ouer boorde seaof confession iudgement priest say vnto christ ratherosori pag 172 forsooth bycause absence entreaty made proctours aduocates christ absent whenas iohn doth send v backe agayne vnto notwithstandyng speakyng wise1 iohn • haue sinned haue aduocate father christ iesu propiciatory sacrifice sinnes say haue priest vpon earth either first second table besides iesus christ onely deéde worketh embassadours sometyme taught mouth apostle wrought miracle euen also proclaimeth gospell godly minister yet doth neuerthelesse worke heauen continually though worke minister earth furthermore neither doth vse seruice seruauntes minister thynges whose externall ministery necessaryly employeth many thynges though could selfe doe nothyng without seruice lastly true embassadours forreine badge cognizaunce doe vaunt selues embassadours let v proceéde doe ye ye tumble heapes together confesse selues priest honorable vmpier doth geue lengthpag 172 making first straight inquisition sinnes doth force wisedome searche wounde beyng disclosed applyeth playster thereunto accordyng qualitie grief seemeth conuenient happē vpon priest dayes ouer many much vnlike vnto whō plautus doth describe certeine placeplaut bacchid fooles wittlesse naturalles blockisse doltishe ass dronckardes c let v admitte priest worthy function priest accordyng capacitie wisedome considering ye qualitie ye trespasse plaister doth apply ye soare wholesome one warraūt accordyng ye dignitie person representeth person christ pardoneth absolueth offendour cleane sinne yet enioyning certeine penaunce new clensed soule trespassour may vnderstād bounde make satisfaction ye trespasse doyng maruell enough manifest giddynesse idle brayne beyng barreine onely discretion voyde also altogether common sence feélyng almost offendour say acquited absolution priest undoughtedly absolued priest gay iewell true true deéde god doth geue absolution first assure v tell truth ye alledge scripture forsooth wordes gospellluke 10 heareth heareth despiseth despiseth heare acknowledge wordes wordes christ must returne againe principall pointe questiō shall assured priest trnly nomber christ doth point vnto v pronowne youthe charecter priest say shauen crowne ought sufficient warraunt vnto v ueryly neither doe reiect outward vocation made men neither ought expect maner embassadours sent christ fent apostle heretofore yet much beast mentioned ye apocalips character beast apocalips hath proper peculiar marke christ doth curse shew better marke priest bald scraped scalpe sithence christ sendeth v cōsideration fruites spirituall markes doctrine truth much striue let crowes white let absolution marked priest vndoughted oracle also pointe stand vpon demaunde whenas trespassour doth obtaine priest absolutiō wherof spake whēce doth absolution receaue effectuall operation priest marke fayth repentaunt rather priest marke onely doth fayth baptisme worke v whereunto serueth article creéde beleeue remission sinnes agayne depend vpon onely fayth repentaunt purpose priestly confession couple together imagination one force without kynde couple agreé doctrine makyng curious exact distinction partes penaunce sacrament leaue chinker fayth peépe acquainted name fayth part therof iew turke sorrowfull cōtrite hart ioyne confession mouth withall satisfaction guilt terme sinnes washed cleane away therfore thinke christiā man beyng endued pure fayth bewaylyng offence vnfaynedly withall hart lookyng vpon christ eye fayth vpon brasen serpent craue pardon without hochpotte priestly confessiō shall obteine salue soare deny lombardine questioner would fayne learne priestly confession first instituted innocent 3 thrust church frequēted 1215 vnaduoydeable necessitie whē christ spake vnto woman thy faith hath saued thee math 9 place speakyng woman forgaue many sinnes bycause loued much luke 7 agayne excludyng helpes willed maister synagoge beleeue onely mar 5 sayd vnto thing possible doth beleeue mar 9 sicke palsey sinnes forgeuen thee luke 4 without openyng mouth confession shall say sinnes therfore forgeuen bycause word confession neuer heard shall say god hath heard confession bycause wanted priestes tyme suffice open secretes hart vnto god wordes chrisostome emporte writyng vpō 51 psalme homel 2chrisost vpon 51 psalme homel 2 thou ashamed sayth confesse thy sinnes mā confesse dayly thy hart bidd thee confesse thy fellow seruaunt may reproche thee cōfesse thee may heale thee agayne place bidd thee come people thou accuse thy selfe others haue thee follow wordes prophet saying open thy sinnes vnto lord confesse thy faultes therfore vnto god open thyne offence vnto true iudge harty prayer thy toūg remorse consciēce c yet speake though priuate confession sinnes ought receaued church vnprofitable whereas counsell godly minister desired consolation required troubled conscience exercize priuate absolution word gospell authoritie gospell vttered minister yet doe allow name priuate confession wherewith haue wickedly entangled godly conscience may neither participate wt nature sacrament deliuered cōmaūded god law moreouer neither necessary tymes though without sinnes forgeuen contrite sorowfull hart groūdyng selues vpon infallible fortresse fayth wherfore farre loue sacred eare cō fessiō osori may god name go priest oftē much ye liste content selues washed ye bloud iesu christ repose hope affiaunce whatsoeuer alone trouble v hinder v beseéch thus directed authoritie scripture beleéue dypped ouer head care comfortable sacred fonte sufficient clensing purgyng sinnes agayne neither blessed bloud iesu christ wayes effectuall vnto v appliable comfort wayes fayth onely beleéue name whatsoeuer resemblaunce truth decreés expresse vnto v doughtlesse scripture cannot lyeactes 15 wherein taught harte washed cleane fayth remission sinnes receaued fayth christ iesu actes 26 addyng moreouer testimony prophetes must come passe many beleeue iesu christ shall obteine forgeuenesse sinnes actes 10 neédelesse stole catholicke confessours altogether fruteles towardes cleansing conscience meane space soule afflicted greéuous scrupule wherein brotherly consolation may seéme requisite gaynsay man goe godly learned minister nay rather hartely allow therof selues also many tymes yet repaire togethers tendeth rather seéke counsell comfort necessitie craue pardon sinnesthe reformation confession neither compell man make speake chrisostomes owne wordes necessitie freédome neither make sacrament therof yet require beadroll sinnes neither doe enforce person state tymes yeare finally burdeine clogge satisfactory penaunce horrible wherein wonder seé fallen vpon rest catholickes osorius thinke veryly dame folly selfe could speake toung would neuer vtter wittles foolerythe superstition satisfactiō hauing first pardoned acquited offendour cleare crime enioyne afterwardes penaūce whereby compelled pardon receaued make satisfaction notwithstandyng send purgatory must satisfie vttermost far thyng beseéch right reuerēd father honor great wisedome filthynes conscience thoroughly clensed necessity ye keépyng taken worst speake though thought simplymens traditiōs ceremony altogether sequestred christian man lyfe constitution men ceremony tollerable church without congregation church christian life present treaty concerneth ceremony brought kynde necessitie way superstition come decency order instituted especiall matter piety godlynesse many men haue grounded hope saluation chief foundation relligion hauen affiaunce wherein flatter thē selues condemne others vpon greater part catholickes dayes fawne ouer greédely onely dwell vpō euē bury thē selues aliue thē euē ceremony nothing agreé pure sincere relligiō christ pestilent botche deadly cōtagious vnto yt many famous godly men haue sundry tymes complayned bitterly without cause wise men men experience perceaue true true effectuall force gospell extinguished true pietie neglected conscience onely lyues also men endaungered none perillous contagion glitteryng pompe gorgeous ceremony amongest one reporte telleth two persōs fraūcehow great perill ceremony many yeares agoe daunger burned none matter bycause eate flesh two dayes lent beyng constrained thereunto necessitie sicknesse behold fruites ceremony witte men tradition shall breake cōmaundements god recōptyng murther tollerable offence leaue peltyng cōstitution pope vndone could rehearse six hūdreth like exāples ye monument martyr chiefly worthy noted sycophant thē accuser one passing ouer lazye drone waspes others chiefly ought haue bene beaten away farre hyues church ye rush onely vpō thē altogether whose worthy trauailes honest vntotho bilney apply mynde seryously doctrine namely gospell christ sauing excellency vertuous life iohn bradford seémeth worthy ioyned himioh bradford wholly altogether dwell feare lord certayne inward earnest meditation heauenly life liuing earth seémed haue bene translated heauenly soule violently taken hence leane spent worne often abstinence vnmeasureale trauayle spare dyette seémed anatomy nothing skinne boane earnest prayer continualy exercised burnt kneés handling seémed almost hard camel hoofes many others like vnto could set downe vnto gathered faythfull hystoryes report could certify thinges could could report lye vntruethes maruell aske cause tell weé carryed according wickednesse age sundry affection partes faction esteéme contreuersies reuerence simplicity hart beseémeth v taught prescript word god sinister corrupt affection conceiue euill opinion wrest wring truth selfe whether colour cleake sectes diuisions therefore part greédely carryed harken vnto plausible matter concerne owne commodity preferment rather glory sonne god neuer wanteth stoare notable talebearer skilfull purueyors itching eares notorious sicophantes euen purpose raysed vp iust iudgement god hetherto haue spoken onely famous learning doctrine dignity iudgement ecclesiasticall function besides could recken vppe vnto meaner sort people sixe hundred lesse consumed ash fiue yeares persecutionthe liues burnt queene mary raigne vpon whose bodyes although ye romanists furiously rage according sauadge brutish nature yet shall neuer able raze remembraunce posterity long world doth endure theyr vertuous liues cō mendable monumentes godlynesse left behinde packe popish prelacy priestes parasite neuer able reach vnto let bolde annexe somewhat luther himselfe reported euen much beleued seémed wholly seuered partaking doctrine maner erasmus writing thomas arch yorke certayne epistle concerning luther erasmus testimony cō cerning luther doth constātly affirme life lawes innumerable decree cannos partely sinodals partely prouincialls prerogatiues pope others peculiar seuerall bishopps wherewith christian conscience miserably entangled end tend last doe emplye vnder title church fortify kingdome tyranicall ierarchye vpon earth power potentate world may able counteruayle otherwise doe wordes decretalls emportextrauaga de maiorit obed cap vnam wherein chalenge vnto peter chayre authoritye temporall sword man gaynesay herein doe forthwith exclayme doth well vnderstand speake owne wordes saying lord putt vppe thy sword thy sheathe agayne force thone sword vnder subiection temporall sword must necessitye subiect spirituall sword last measuring proportion authoritye ynchmeale much many degreés surpasseth temporall authorityede maior obedientia cap solitae alledge profe wordes whereas earth seuē time greater moone sonne eight tymes greater earth remaineth therefore according proportion pope superexcellency must surmount dignitye kingly royaltye fiftye time sixtye degree length hauing maner enthronized ierarchye ye haue forced matter passe man hardy mutter agaynst maiestye triple dignitye haue decreés cannon farre worse cannonshotte hale thoughe speake howbeit deny tymes augustine ierome basile wanted great nomber men wemen either forced cruelty persecution loathyng losenes licentious life commō people abandon selues desertes thē nomber none lay people religion coates cowles colour rule vowes sequester company laytie soiourning ye city townes coucht close vpon toppes moūtaines vnhaunted woodes fennes lay snortyng slouth pamperyng paunche vpon men purse either liued moderatly reuenewes gatte liuyng sweate browes emongest foundation layed yet threé vowes three vow moūkerye trinckettes apperteinyng vowes namely wolle contrary prescript rule god word apparaunt enough many matter besides yet notably discernable iiij principall pointes chieflythe pope doctrine cō uinced foure principall pointes fyrst doctrine doth abolish quite doctrine law repentaunce righteousnes fayth commaundeth mammering doubtfulnesse puddle yssueth outragious ouerflowing sea papisticall error secondaryly doth transpose merites worshippings proper peculiar vnto sonne god adoration oblation application consecrated breade quicke dead merite meritorious theyr masking masse without theyr masse whereas deéd gospell doth playnely teach benefittes sonne god applied person respect euery theyr proper peculiar fayth thirdly manner infidel translateth dead men inuocation ought yelded god onely fourthly commaū deth tradition men mounckish vowes canonicall satisfaction pilgrimage innumerable dredge opinion merite worshyppyng necessary obseruaunce doth preferre commaundementes law god hath commaunded especially obserued beadroll appertayne dottered bussardly fable purgatory pardon secret compulsary confesūon pompous procession superstitious supplication wherein carryed abroad gazed vpon consecrated bread profaning lordes supper making sale thereof open fayre markette magicall consecration naturall thinges wytte water wyne oyle salt like pope church like earthly kyngdome kyngdome christwhat shall say whorysh shamelenesse pope without proofe probabilyty aunciēt antiquity certayne insolent arrogancy dyuyne authoryty theyr owne trayterous treachery haue raysed selues true catholicke apostolycke church christ iesu seraphycall ierarchy exceédyng earthly prymacy superiority potentaty wherein reygneth place christ proud popysh peacock apostle cormoraunt cardinalles martyres monstruous mounckes professor pestiferous persecutor father bellygod byshoppes gorbelly abbottes euangelistes cruell canonistes copistes decretaries summularyes seditious sententioners minysters sheépysh shauelinges pastours maskyng massemongers hauyng rauenously raked ryght church haue turned chaū ged newfangled fashion earthly kingdome may suffice serue chryst iesu pastor head onely settle selues vpon hym whollye depend vpon hys mercy onely unlesse become vassal bondslaues thys popysh byshoppe honour certayne chryst vpon earth vnder delycate vysor gloryous name coū terfaytyng horne immaculate lambe doth vnder person chrystes uycar earth attempt nothyng el deéde may chiefe monarch whole world others prince potentate earth may become buxam bonnair vnto hys beck commaundement may lawfull osorius man speake trueth franckely playne wordes call toad toad let vysor presumptuous pretence pluckt pate litle whyles turne downe tytle cloake church wherewith couer selues lette v behold ye thyng deéd wytte whole course conuersation treasury myghty maiesty gallant trayne pryncely pallaces stately dignyty pompous pryde terryble lawes lofty castle presumptuous power difference shal seé betwixt hyghest gouernemēt empyre supremacy pope betwixt courtes kinges reuelyng rout rome betwixt prince parliamēts pope generall councels lyst take view gallaunts themseluesa smale discription romishe ierarchye ye pope himselfe thē ye monarch chiefe ruler thys world sauyng worldly prynces crowned wyth one single dyademe onely thys ruffeler skarse satisfied wyth tryple crowne cardynalles represent el kynges kynges sonnes patryarches archbyshoppes byshopps abbottes pontificall kyndomea comparison betwixt kingdome pope kingdome world shew themselues earthly prynces duke earles equall rather exceédyng sumptuousnesse wayted vpon wyth stately trayne wheresoeuer goe ryde many also rynged chayned man may lawfully lyncke lubberly rowt monstruous mounckes false fryer stead gard finally one thing done common wealth pryncely courtes iolly rufflers haue conueyed church christ ambytious emulation kynges emperours enduced hereunto necessary preseruation theyr state doe ioyne vnto counsellor pier haue theyr ambassadours messenger haue also theyr pryuy ligiers skowtes doth pope want consistory hath holy father synodaryes doth lack legate nati legate de latere wheresoeuer sent vse lesse pompe thē piere potētate highest nobility yea though neuer sumptuous destitute skowtes spyes hath priuelye lurkyng euery armed wt treason pynche prince courtes theyr councels yea ye closettes pryuy chamber kynges queénes ye thinke thys comely concordaunce osorius reasonable resemblaunce chrystes lyfe commaundementes agreéable apostle euangelists auncient father wt ordinaunces primitiue church former presidēt elder lord cryeth gospelliohn 20 comparison betwixt pope kyngdome christ kyngdome lyuing father sent euē send thinke sent world establish new regyment earth like romulus builde stately emperiall rome ye thinke minister chryst sent sort sonne himselfe sent fatherluke 20 christ proceédeth yet foreward receaue ye holye ghost sayth whosoeuer sinnes shall forgeue forgeuen whosoeuer sinnes shall retayne also shalbe retayned power neuer entitle church withall yet gaue power vnto onely purposed endue holy spirite value church christ christ owne lawes decreés pope euident wordes spake vnto disciplesmar 10 ye know seeme rule ouer nation lordes ouer theyr prince haue dominion ouer shall greatest shall humble himselfe minister rest sonne man came ministred vnto minister vpon romish bunch toppe gallaūt pontificall maiesty cardinalles legate preuayling aboue prynces empalled mytred byshoppes order shauelings swarmes mounckes fryer lawes bulles decreés vse forcible cā non shotte theyr might power fearefull yea terrible also prince lord hymselfe cryeth mightely gospell kingdome world canne away thinges mighty earth pontificall prelate storme waxe wroth ye world enioy thyng subiect vnto power ierarchy meane while wordlythe counte • faite authoritie pope fayne god church whose becke sight gorgones vgly face make astonyed monarch tetrarches earth haue magnified name catholicke forsooththe church wickedly defined papistes vertue name haue notyfied congregation dispersed vpon face whole earth agreéing together one conformity doctryne worshypping christ whyche doth make true catholicke church meane hereby onely ierarchy haue tyed fast ye romyshe seé hereunto greater aduauncement authority haue deuised trymme tytle antiquity behold say euer church ye church rome church glorying vpon tytle antiquitye whereas neuer one thing doth differre antiquity wherein romish skippiacks seéme conceit much lyke litle boyes playing comedyes plautus vpon stage one playeth part chremes menedemus cremilus beyng yet come hoary grayheaded course yeares sette graue countenaūce vpon matter seéme olde men gazers vpon skaffoldes put vpon counterfayt trynckets witte white hoary beard vpon theyr chynne gray white locke vpon theyr heades counterfayting theyr gate stooping crooching rest handes vpon staffe shaking tremblyng fashion theyr voyces bigge like olde men doyng certayne witty crafty conueyaunce counterfayting behold theyr outward handling gesture would say olde men discharge theyr roabes plucke theyr vysours shall finde nothing lesse haue fayned themselues much vnlike dottrell ierarchy rome wonder seé many yeares vaunteth continuauncehow romishe stager doe counterfayt olde antiquitye wordes voyce countenaunce gesture outward resemblaunce fiftene hundreth yeares say predecessor beginne sitte chayre euen first foundatiō prymitiue church erected christ himselfe established apostle confirmed cō tinuall course neuer fayling succession receiued generall consent auntient father hath remayned bene deriued vnto v aperpetuall permanent deliuery succession church call euangelicall church euer seene heard time man verely vysours stagelike gugawes wherewith romish counterfaytes haue played tragicall partes wherewith haue beguiled many simple people hetherto lett v plucke theyr visor discouer bellygod pope whytes maye throughly behold manner puppette smoath apish church within fiftene hundreth yeares sithence say church wherein raygne like lordes hath vnchaunged continuaunce albeit small purpose cōtinuaunce thing false altogether vntrue confession passe ouer meane space erasmus place expressing meanyng playnly appeareth sayth tyme ierome priuate confession sinnes yet receaued church afterwardes profitably instituted church priestes lay people vse accordingly herein scarse skilfull deuines alitle deceaued bycause auncient father wrate touching publique generall confession doe straine secret whispering quite contrary kinde confession c passe ouer also many thynges breuities sake whereof generall collection made dought vysour antiquitie would easily pluckt sacrament romish churchthe sayd also sacramentes order annoylynges matrimony vse thynges albeit grew litle litle euen ye first age church also reteigned vntill day amōgest v yet vtterly deny yt registred amongest noumber sacramentes afore yeares sithence osorius shall neuer able prooue contrary hath bene solemne custome long tyme church rome entred order ecclesiasticall foreswearing coupled wedlock sweare selues obserue perpetuall vow vnmaried lyfe man opiniō tyrāny brought apostle rather directly agaynst ordinaūce apostolicke church much deceaued imagination whereas law neuer begon euer heard tyme hildebrand although deny many vnmaried minister many dayes agoe church christ tyme huge multitude priestes plentyfull giftes chastitie possessed christian church yet neuer man read heare yt necessitie vowyng chastitie became publique cōmon coaction hildebrād borne earnestly germaines set selues agaynst wicked prohibition decreéd pope gregory 7 tyme archbyshop mentz sollicitour popish decreé almost slayne let history beare witnesse touchyng done england note somewhat selfe wise writeth henry huntyngton chronicleout huntington 7 booke anselme sayth prohibite mariadge priestes england neuer prohibited seemed matter antiquitiethe greatest part romish doctrine newly foūd brought within th • 500 yeares deuises altogether men inuētions bastardes misbegotten chaungelyngs scholeianglers cowled crauens grounded vpon authoritie scripture altogether vnknowen vnto aūcient primitiue church part wherof hath bene hatcht thrust abroad world within 500 yeares within compasse tyme noumber yeares began fulfilled long prophecied lettyng louse sathan world whose libertie bottomles gulfe hellapoc 21 foretold propheticall scripture thousand yeares end might preuaile deceaue people dwelling vpon foure corner earth gog magog c meane pestiferous deceauing scarse credible spoken mō struous ruine dissipation empire kyngdomes 500 yeares alteration hath ensued yt church chiefly much christian force hath bene decayed ciuill warres priuate grudgynges greatly power foreine nation hath increased destruction vndoyng meane tyme while turke doth inuade christian church without seékyng foreine force vndermine popish prelate lesse busily bent builde vppe fortresse furious tyranny euen within bowel church fill vppe coffer treasure moyle turmoyle thynges procure warres bloudshed establishment primacy sturre vppe ciuill warres commotion turne thynges vpsidowne wherupō commeth passe doctrine nought sett much treasory aboundeth ouer flowingplenty much speake ierome vertues pyned away wt famine skarsity idolatry ambitiō superstitiō haue growne vnmeasurable excesse thing defiled abuse religiō ruleth roast violence cruelty finally thing come nought trueth turned playne lying treachery place sincere fayth possesseth false hipocrisie praying dead kneéling crowching image supplyeth place true pure worshipping god word lord troden downe man authoritye godly auncient ordinaunces transformed new fangled traditiōs simple meaning scripture entāgled wt scholetrickes sophystrye luste vnbrideled licentious outrage preuayle aboue godly conuersation seueritye discipline presūptuous pride greédy desire lordlynes superioritye doe wrestle agaynst lowlynes humilitye huge heapes new noueltyes increase dayly error falshode flocke abroad vnmeasurably finally whole state auncient church become stage earthly monarchye filthy forgeshoppe foolishe fond ceremony assoone lord louing mercy good pleasure towardes v vouchsafed amend dayly drowsy darkenes wt glymering dawning day refresh razed rent ruynous church restore recouery auncient recordes written veritye braynesuck beastes romyshe rowte ganne fret aud fume sweéte shauelinges seéke lengthtrueth suffereth violence render reason noueltye veritye euangelicall oppressed tyranny ye reuell sathās raunging abroad yeares eyther durst shewe selfe open world could heard plead selfe outragious vilaines quickened aboue beginneth display oryent beames called corā cloisterers though christe doctrine apostolicall straunger world commaunded iustifie chalenge antiquitye neither able render reason theyr counterfayt antiquitie iustify trueth cause recordes reportes probable auncienty testimonie president prymatyue churche whatsoeuer wherein seémeth behaue themselues modestly shamefastly theéues murtherers breakyng nyght man housea figure called hypotiposis whereby state romās church reformed churche expressed hauing violnce wrong either slayne thrust true owner dores chalenge vnto themselues title possession pleadyng possession wrongfull disseisin tearme certeyne yeares doe plead occupation prescription time agaynst lawfull heire hath right lawe recouer demaund iudgement thrusting true heire true inheritaunce ryght equitye demaundeth restitution thing doe herein finding cause way bettered vouching scripture make nothing thē fleé ouer forthwith yt father custome continued olde long prescription time cry agaynst v full mouthes haue enioyed possession church xv hundreth yeares commaund v tell church litle aboue xl yeares sithencein question churche many thing conteined aske tell conditionally distinctly tell first doe meane worde church meane people perhappes borne vnderstand roofes wall tymber churchespeople buildyng doctrine forme gouernement churche lutheranes fourtie yeares ago stand euen place wont stand enuironed ye churchyardes stood old yf speake doctrine verely word god scripture discernable enough also resteth rested euer heretofore shall rest hereafter euer demaund forme gouernment primitiue church many yeares asia greece affrick europe dispersed abroad church tyme euery particular church gouerned theyr peculiar patriarch pente vppe straighted one hole vnder commaundement one man onely also neither byshoppe called vniuersall byshoppe lord byshoppe rome called vniuersall byshoppe haue told church fourtye yeares remayneth bold demaund agayne especially osorius vouchsafe declare vnto v fine ciceronisme thys braue poolyshed speach thys exquisited eloquence writyng speaking gorgeous furniture fyled toūges pyked straunge statelynes stylea similitude betwixt restitutiō religion finest tounges fourty yeares agoe wonderfull increase artes mathematicall science eyther say newely found restored agayne rather deliuered long sithence olde auncient teacher confesse new speciall deuises proper wittes renewed reuiued rather auncient author let account selfe satisfied question touching state church newe vpstart reuiued olde garnished new coapes returning agayne old fryse gown doe build new church reason rē dered religion pure tyme church many yeares bring forth beautifye olde church man seéme maruell verye cause reason artes discipline rather dayes florishe agayne length long scylence long continuaunce exile banishment would neédes know ye true naturall cause hereof better aūswere shall make done speciall prouidence god inestimable goodnesse vouchsafed latter dayes rootes recouering olde beauty haue lesse cause wonder osorius deuines beyng enlightened thus wt opē light manifest scripture furnyshed great store bookes helpes learning doe seé much matter diuinitye wordes bring passe lacketh much thacomplishment promise haue left thing farre worse case peruerse filthy deformed meanes goodly trauayle men haue placed sacrilege stead religion crueltye stead lenytye sake lett v imagine peter hadd sonne borne vnto lawfull wyfe cephas resembling father discent course nature next heire shall say sonne shall clayme priuiledge father portershippethe nature gospell good face pretend authoritie christ byshopps church endued semblable fayth prerogatiue hath office keéping keyes challenge superioritye ouer byshoppes presidēts churche scripture doth certein place deny hath spirite christ christthe spirite christe spirite christ wheresoeuer resteth humble meéke regardeth thinges earth seéketh owne suffereth iniuries others offereth iniury none neither reuengeth iniury offred himselfe haleth man slaughterhouse thyrsteth euery man sauetye yea prayeth also enemy earnestly doth receaue weake fayth doth oppresse man endureth many thinges becometh person may winne vnto christ accompteth men chaunces good badde owne lyueth himselfe publique benefite many doth amend amissethe succession peter doth consist spirite externall thinges addresseth order recouereth lost recomforteth dispeired estate finally doth breake peéces shieuered reéde deéde spirite christe canne vnlyke christ himselfe therefore hereof may well conclude wheresoeuer spirite doth plant seate doughtles successor peter true keyes church doe presume iudge ye spirite pope hath iudge shall haue daye iudgement shall display abroad open light secret darkenes meane space touching pope pardon whereof prater preach presumptuously certen surepardons thorough whole scripture aūcient father one sentēce much cann foundsuccession make pardon iustifiable coulorable first touching whole allegation successionthe keyes playne fraude deceipt bragge singuler prerogatiue peter false power keyes doth belong seé rome vniuersall church christ keyes power binding lousing figured hath bene allready spoken keyes though peter receaued first deéde yet alone receaue euer tyme exercise power otherwise enioye together thother apostle asmuch confirmed many infallible profes established cōtinuall vnbrokē course auncient antiquitye also witnessed euidently testimony cannon councels ancyra nice whereof made mencion sayd custome church euery byshoppe haue order ouersight euery peculiar prouince vpon due consideration behauiour penitentiary might lawfully either mittigate shorten cutt tyme penauncethe 5 canon councell ancyra prolong according thinke necessary neédefull affrayd graūt keyes church despised penitentiall satisfaction weakened doe decree feast dedication saynt peter pallaice shall solemnized pardon shall graunted aboue one yeare foorth feast yearely dedication tyme appoynted pardon enioyned penaunce shall exceede passe fourty dayes imediately nū ber dayes pardon ex titulo de penitent remiss cap cū ex eo also commaund abreuiated graunted euery light tryfle forasmuch byshopp rome doth professe fulnes power accustomed vse moderatiō like cause c fulnes power first brought innocent 3 first authour therofand hence yf deceiued fulnes power deriued first romyshe ruffian haue raked shamefully themselues whether great reproch glory christ intollerable iniury brother easily determine sufficed vsurpe either equall power byshops encroche vpon thē somewhat higher vnlesse vnsatiable pryde must mount also fulnes power go may learne osorius seéke word fulnes sayd full whereunto droppe may iustilled question fulnes proper peculiar christ alone whose fulnes haue receaued fulnes power minister church onely deacones byshoppes onely chiefest apostle euangelistes number peter himselfe yea though neuer much prince apostle may exempted onely sonne god continuall flowing founteyne canne neuer exhausted spent whome father gaue spirite without measure full mercye trueth others beyng selues barraine hungry naked beggerly nature must neédes seéke reliefe aboundaūce esay prophet doth allure mē repayre borow come sayth thurstie haue money draw hence freely gladnesse founteines sauiour esay 5512 moreouer sauiour selfe also doth generally call whosoeuer oppressed penury distressed anguish labour come sufficed come foūteyne plentyfully flowyng largely set wyde open ye house dauid inhabitant ierusalē resort vnto cleansing ye sinner defiled romish rutterkyne must call v backe filthy cesternes durty dytches selfe filthy durty sinner cleanse v fullnes much therfore mouth god hath spoken cōsent also prophetes haue testified god hath geuen fulnesse onely begotten sonne wherewith onely able willyng also wash away filthynes corruption whence commeth fulnesse absolute power romaine prelate one prelate alone may certeine superexcellent prerogatiue bryng passe byshops doe namely may franckly graunt full full yea vnmeasurable full pardon maner offence common barrettours world stile pardon many tymesout decree lateran councell anno 1215 wild bull innocent 3 vpō solemne decreé enlarged would fight holy land would geue ayde thereunto wherein promised full remission sinnes fulnesse porterly power increase lyfe euerlastyng full partaking fellowshyp saintes maner boniface 8 graunt vnto person would pilgrimes come visite holy mother church peter paule rome decree boniface 8 extraua full fuller abhominable full forgeuenes sinnes also clement 6 bulles pardon doth powre plētyfully fight holy crosse onely remission poena culpa much bountye liberalitie doth graunt vnto euery threé foure soules purgatory withall geueth also especiall commaundement aungels heauen warlike pilgrimes chaūce dye iourneya shamelesse abuse keyes forthwith transport heauen wondrous efficacie keyes surely able performe deéde bragge vpon arrogauntly word vaunt full perfect power doyng tell farre exceédyng church byshops prelate councels whence fetche full power haue yet taught fully say christ christ beyng selfe onely perfect founteine fulnes able made empty doth neuer powre forth selfe fully one man alone leaueth selfe accessible indifferently others whose fullnes euery person accordyng portion draw forth much grace sufficeththe byshops rome challenge themselues fulnes power argument proofe hath one man alone made cleane ridduāce selfe neither possible receaueth one thyng whereof ioynte parteners alone shall possesse wherof others haue ioynte interest possession agayne difference power shall betwixt christ pope ech lyke fullnes power neédeth man apply vnto christ may otherwise fully satisfied full fullnes pope shall remaine heauen henceforth christ lieutenaunt christ dispatch thynges vpon earth fullnes power conclude word porter heauen supercelestiall power want nothyng may without resistaūce open shutte let scoure coast cleare proclayme cleane gayle deliuery purgatory set soules libertie fiery lake make quicke dispatche horrible flame send paradise performe would fullnes charitie wherefore annoynt thine eye precious oyntment thou mayst see c one interrupt say keyes heauen geuen vaynethe wordes august vnto peter haue playne application vnlesse referred churche neither gaynsay herein eo nostro thomas aquinas doth deny person peter keyes committed apostle whole church herein surely horrible abuse romish challenge doth bewray notorious fraude scraping selfe full prerogatiue power great offence vse keyes whereas power bindyng lousing wherein whole force efficacie keyes consisteth receaued preacher minister word none end necessary consolation comfort church executed tyme apostle hard weighty necessitie onely man dispayred mercy christ cōmitted haynous notorious offence publiquelythe keyes geuen necessary benefite church mēs lust yet reuenge power employed either comfort rayse vp fallen suppresse bridle insolency seémed manifestly iniurious rebellious agaynst glory christ kynde iudiciall vse keyes commonly frequented apostlesthe iudiciall vse keyes yet applyed great vrgent necessitie besides tyme vsuall execution keyes commonly vse euery well ordered congregation whereas preacher doth openly proclayme authoritie word euerlastyng lyfe whosoeuer truly vnfaynedly repenting beleéuyng christ jesu doth el open kyngdome heauen mē key close fast agayne neéde shall require euen materiall keye witnesseth thomas doores openedtho lib 4 dist 18 barres gynne beyng forced backe forclose passadge would enter euen hearyng word fayth ariseth blockes barres sinne turned waye keyes therfore rightly sayd cōmitted minister church wherewith vnlockyng locke vnloasing obstacle sinnes lead conduct sinner heauē open eye blind power paule also furnished lord selfe beyng sent vnto gentile actes 2 • thou mayest open eye sayth whereby may cōuerted darckenes light paule sent vnto gentile shall say rest apostle disciple christ small slender authoritie wherein committed vnto whole world taught word god whereby also wrought many miracle great signes emongest remissiō sin church without vse keyes wherewith may deteigne release sinnes accordyng power cōmited vnto yet ought power narrowly streighted either one byshop onely emparted also minister wise though none remissiō sinnes besides churche vnlesse come minister keyes pope pardon though man could make selfe way passable heauēhow much publike keye much euery man fayth effectuall remission sinnes vnlesse admitted popish porter minister minister doth open deéde yet doth open ye euery one may open also selfe owne fayth also doth voyce authoritie minister breake bandes sinnes sunder hartely repent yet neuerthelesse sentence remayneth alwayes vnreproueable iustified fayth haue peace god lord sauiour iesu christ rom 5 luke 8 also feare beleue onely thou art made whole thing thinke lord gaue vnto minister large commission opening keyes remayne none meanes attayne forgeuenesse sinneswhen vse key ought ministred may sometimes come passe euen happeneth often voyce coūcell applyed necessity hereof came lord would vouchsafe furnish minister power opening shutting make perfect full worke iustification onelye necessarye reliefe comfort unbecillitye weakenesse thomas lib 4 dist 18and therefore thomas aquinas doth erre fowly deceiued many thinges notably reasoneth commētaries distinction keyes church releasing pardoning therefore committed minister mā able without ayde minister open himselfe accesse vnto kingdome heauenthe error thomas aquinas thus hee writeth man able open himselfe sayth therfore minister authorized forgeue sinne whereby kingdome heauen made open yeare 1515 yet osorius doth deny euer sale markettes made marchaundise romaine church either knowen pope allowed would desire thee gentle reader think vpon whereas disposing pardon pope vse like proportiō towards persōs wherof graūts large cutted short whereas person full remission geuen euerlastyng others third endeale sinnes forgeuē xij thousand yeares others viij thousād yeares many vij yeares xij yeares released purgatory vpon grew inequabilitie parcialitie dispensation stake layed downe game whereby came passe best purse escaped greatest curse man would geue pope would relieue euen full fullnes sowed thinne pardon scarse worthe pyane purpose rippe vppe remembraunce reliques example past noumber tell one owne realme england towne called boston pardōs boston borne nigh thereabout speake somewhat better thereof haue bulles remayning yet great lesse pardon purchased pope safety shipping solue agayne afterwardes others great profite aduauntage inquisitiue learne somme amounted vnto monstruous markett onely one thing would haue osorius throughly perswaded minde yet bulles obteyned gratis without money begged onely seé rome haue president sufficient custodye wherewith cann conuince vanitye folly many yeares sithēce surge swelling sea surrounded low countrye flaundersa history flaunders ministred lamentable spectackle whole nation behold flew abroad bulles highest liberali fulnesse case selfe moued men pitty much amongest rest fauour authority pope adrian germayne borne whose popedome pittyfull case befell legate sent abroad taking view place breach able make true report wreckes neéded reliefe charge thereof would amount vnto masse money leuied meanes bulles vnmeasureable vanished away could knowen yea knowne well poore countrey bare name others carryed away game penny therof employed ye vse foresayd collection pretended many pageantes haue bene played byshops rome mystres money made vpp alwayes peryode play let v call remembraunce age auncestors while sithence note well actes recordes within fewe yeares blockish meanely acquaynted late chronographers canne easily perceiue practizes whenas shall read many bloudy battels many preparatiōs ye recouery holy land shall heare many redd cross beautifully blazed embrodered pope trypie crowne skarlett boxe whenas shall perceiue perpetuall prating proctours frier beggers skill claw poore clownes croomes voasting much promising infinite performing nothing wherunto added sweéte name title renowme must leauy raysed agaynst turke pope great hassard force enemy come iubilee euery hundred yeare first long iubilee euery fifteth yeare last euery xxv yeare retourne speédy might also neédy call reliefe within while church saynt peter must built vpon hill called vaticanus mon rome began saint james compostella spayne waxe hūgry sometime holy ghost rome driuen extreame beggery also world went hard boord poore mounckes mount sinay compositiō offered restitutiō made loane money iustification good euill gottē cease open marketts deny true osorius canne cann denye face shame make warrant portesales haue bene made holy reliques time holy mother churche matter goeth well peraduenture fellowes much ashamed theyr powlyng pranckesthe papist flee denyals render reasonable excuse bribery pilladge beleéue shall able stoppe men mouthes dissimulation lye doubt shortly come passe wil stiffely deny hereafter euer worshippe holy misteries signes body blood christ holy sacrament steéde naturall bodye bloud sauiour iesu chryst let suffice pardon osori pag 196of image shall say sithence hereof hath bene spoken sufficiently enough already sith also alledgeth new matter olde bare name onely nazianzene basile ierome ambrose neither vouching place ye author meane space citing example theyr writinges goe nazianzene basile doctours say lenght sooth euen say doe extoll magnifye ornamentes eloquence holye sainctes godly martyres geuen high honour glory persist stoughtely face enemie testimony christ washe garmētes bloud lambe vnuāquishable constancy heauenly fortitude courage theyr name actes monumentes aduaunce studiously religiously pray night tombes exhort godly congregation read ouer actes monumentes celebrate theyr memorialles osorius whence fetch ye ware seéke good reader let tedious vnto peruse volume doctours ouer ouer way especially let haddon ashamed hath whollye addicted himselfe perusing accursianes writinges coulde spare himselfe vacant tyme read bookes doctours passe ouer trifle let v consider argumēt osorius auncient father doe honorably sett forth extoll magnifye holye martyres suffered death christes cause know know say bookes holy father full commendation prayses godly men doth basile describe famouslye vertues saynt iulitta gordius barlaa mamantes forty martyr nazianzene doth highly commend marcus arethusius cyprian chrisostome prayseth babyla ambrose also full like commendation doe many others extoll magnify aboue ye sky accoūpt prayseworthy ye purpose euer practised defraude godly martyr one title much worthy cōmendation neither doth discourse concerne saynctes martyr one thyng prayse martyr thing worshyp image picture image let holy martyres haue theyr cōdigne prayses let father aboundantly plentifully eloquent theyr commēdatory declamation yet garnyshing magnifiyng saynctes martyr vertues constancy tend none end expresse vnto v certayne liuely president thereby imitate theyr patience practize integrity life crootching kneéling worshipp neither auncient learned age euer superstitious bussardly blinde adore make intercession men stead lord theyr god woulde glorify god rather sainctes cause thinke auncient monumentes erected temple buylded wherein christian people might heare actes vertues holy martyres taught imitate example martyres deade shoulde worshipped afterwardes portraictes added perhapps wherin conflictes intollerable tormentes valiaunt martyr curiously paynted may uirgines besides many matter yt common people euery doth report owne knowledge whereof say vnder payne confession one thyng speake haue persuaded vnuoluntary uirgines coacted single lyfe enter honorable wedlocke without compulsion doe defile uirgines suppose dispoyle chast cō tinency rather prouide circumspectly honestie say truth complainte defilyng uirgines applyable iustly none owne catholickes best geldynges perhappes followeth touchyng memory vertue iustice abolished endeuour godlynes banished lutheranes cauillatiō osori memory vertue abolished cā well conceaue osori doth meane hereby much consideration righteousnes godlynes comprehended law god chiefly appeale secrett iudgementes godly farre lutheranes estraūged thought ouerthrowyng law lord say haue razed ransackt church cauillation razyng church church tell v consideratiō alwayes church alike church serue godly necessary v erected mainteyne idolatry superstition god hath peculiar church hath deuill also chappelles gentile sometymes temple dumme goddes selles also monckeries day mumblyng goddes neither turkes destitute tabernacle therefore raze downe particular church whatsoeuer speciall cause altogether haynous marke valiaunt martyr god tyme throwe downe ye temple diana arethusiū place thereof dedicate church vnto christ euē haue many godly prince done many place within rome selfe cōstantinus others yet doth man condemne tymes past emongest huge multitude iewishe nation one temple onely god allow one altar yet temple raysed builded owne appointement commaundement neither selfe agreéued haue vtterly defaced leauyng one stoane vpon abuse frequented therein doth man complayne short infinite multitude tēples religiōs scattered ouer face earth long sithēce among ye heathen much ruines foūd speake cōparyng monckes frier heathen paynymes holy church temple gentile bycause may make euident razing pluckyng downe church enough bycause osorius maketh complaint vnlesse make knowen first temple temple true religion tabernacle superstition idolatry hath proued yet euer able iustifie doe kill holy men spoyle tourmoyle infinite affliction others force exile c holy men sommoned ierome shall speake august lykewise taking vpon confute error donatistes emongest many reason forced argument chieflyaugustine conuent cecilian byshopp carthage constantine sayth lawfull vncontrollable namely himselfe hath spoken word euery whose wordes inuincible sentence goe osorius vpon superexcellent creditt doth warrant vnto v marke well wretched englishman outcast abandoned somewhat aduisedly place haddon wherein scourgeluther doth much whyppe haddon wise sayth haddon shall sacred doctrine gospell wherein haue alwayes cōtinued space xxx yeares together except haue cast prosperitye stayed estate prince presuming vpon politique wisedome councell kinges queénes chiefly aboue others gracious queéne elizabeth modesty ought attemper prosperous success happy exhortation queene elizabeth light followeth darkenesse calme come clowdes euen whole course lyfe hath continuall enterchaunges ioy sometymes surprised sodeyne sorrow agayne heauinesse chaunged honour thinges carryed certaine vehement whyrling vnstablenesse fleyng vane windemill forced boreas blastes thinges aloft sodenly throwen downe contrarywise thing simple base doe instant mount aloft commeth preserue lyue hadd great reuerence estimation farre forth osorius euen bowel hystories philosophy wherein much mislike good councell whereunto glorious flooryshes framed queéne elizabeth anye potentate prince world king portingall proper pigsnye pope place hath soueraygne lady whose princely mildenes doth surmount predecessor lenity temperaunce demeaned selfe fortunate prosperous calme happy reigne maiesty may seéme stand neéd philosophicall persuasion prince wherein hath euer vaunted royaltye sort must enstructed portingall solon haue regard slippery state fickle life declare good fellowshipp osorius matter haue noted anye time heard report done maiesty wherin may iustly reprehend want wisedome counsell lacke clemēcy iustice beseéming vertuous prince world boldely also adde hereunto wherein mayden queéne may worthely compare mighty auncient monarche famous memory thinke litle isle england voyd barreyne councell kinges queénes must necessitye enstructed osorius happened vtter skill signifye good rather queéne marye grace sister might haue persuaded temperaunce lenity whenas executed tyrannye without measure meane shedding owne subiectes blood thē portingall clawbacke whiche haue remembred queéne humayne weakenesse imbecillity forgettfull humanity owne fraylty reioyse therefore elizabeth noble vertuous soueraigne alcion dayes may well seé nowe howe muche indebted prosperous raigne mighty macedō king phillipp ioyously affected sonne alexander behalfe chaunced borne time famous philosopher aristotle ye rather clappe handes ioy respect happy happynesse alexāders felicity happeneth raygne time notorious solon eighth wise number third cato age able replenish eares wholesome preceptes life fashion fayth true catholicke institution doctrine maiesty cōfession compulsary single life ye sacrifice masse image picture reliques saynctes cann restore owne person auncient freédome tyrannous bondage false flatterer wherein grace holden captiueosor pag 211 freé queéne may last become seruile bondmayd pope vpon onely bunch thraldome hang keyes osorius freé manumission therefore sith matter come passe remayneth renowmed vertuous queéne finde meanes send new solon meanes possible assigne place emōgest chiefe priuye councell alter whole state realme directiō appoyntment guyde maiestye wise first renouncing religion whereunto haue bene enured euen cradle may straggle away trimme tradition romish religion osorius doth mayntayne haue begonne spirite may end afterwardes flesh may banish scripture subiectes hearing may conuert publique preaching mumbling massing subiects may beginn learne call vpō god vnknowen toung excluding righteousnesse doth consist fayth iesu christ people may noosled confidence assuraunce theyr owne workes merites dispoyle communion one part sacrament dissolue lawfull marriage christes ministerspestiferous councell owne realme establish kingdome pope rome may gouerne scepter carry crosier may haue full skope kingdome distribute benefice geue byshopprickes exact first fruites tenthes yearely pencions hath swept away cropp english golde may come gather drosse finally make cleare dispatch lutheran heretiques kill spoyle •• england full fagott fier english blood spilte name english nation vtterly rooted portingalles may freély propt vpp theyr possession surely notable councell osorius right well beseéming dignity whatsoeuer colourable shew pretend wordes doth trueth deéd sound breath forth nothing el slaughter bloud hereof ignoraunt romish counterfait could neuer receiued region without wonderfull disturbaunce state losse many liues cause suppose directed bloody murtherous inuectiues noble queéne whereunto would haue bene pliable whole realme bene long sithence replenished fire flame wherewith would haue made boanefiers ye blood many good preacher come late gentle synon fable bables may keépe breath keale potage late lauish lewdnes queéne maryes madd day hath made v well acquaynted romish iennettthe troiane horse graunt grasing within english soyle permitt pasture popish palfray christ iesu thanked euer euer romish ruffler excluded liue godly calme cann neuer hope haue anye footing concorde exiled peace vtterly banished wherefore superexcellent byshopp rome rauished hott zeale ambicion reigne without kingdome follow simple councell either lett seéke straunge vnknowen islandes may rule ouer know el lett chaūge state religion like maner would aduertize osorius courage stay outrage quill must neédes presume perke preach king queénes either recreate spirites exercize cease abuse gracious queéne elizabeth specially kinde trumpery wherein tell truth osorius haue lost labor cost preuayle whitt thereby seé successe may haue hereafter committ vnto lord certes hetherto yet may putt winninges eye seé neuer shine lesse proofe selfe doth declare osori pag 214 say preuayle nothyng herein yet wanted sufficient testimony well wishyng mynde ought vnthankefully taken emongest gratefull honest personage good meanyng shall say ready inclinable easily perceaue effect beseéch end shall iudge ready procure gracious queéne whose nature nothyng disposed lenitie gentlenes sett fire none otherwise flamyng firebrand contrary naturall disposition engrauē within royall brest finger god seéke spoyle natiue countrey cruelty tormentes destruction subiectes fier fagottes like vnto furious persecution madde outrage executed tyme sister queéne mary better successe could haue bene hoped wicked mischieuous counsell lett v suppose imagine conceiptes yet excellent maiestie could neuer haue suffred haue entred thought might haue preuailed obteined purpose least much hoped could conceaue mynde matter bene accomplished forthwith assoone entred castell fauour though maiestie alone onely enemy pope within dominion beleéue solon hereof assure selfe within litle island greater nomber many thousandes man would iudge rather yeld car • ass torture suffer thē selues defiled marke beast thinke become rest ye multitude whose conscience yet fully settled infinite noūber within realme say prince must vse force force fagotte obay coūsell geue queéne herein forsooth poore wretched englishman much beholdyng vnto sweéte fatherhood gentle reward fayth forced yea brought yeld highnes selfe queéne ouer conscience worldly creature el fayth wilbe enstructed constrayned say also moreouer vanquished death euen rather triumpheth although may lose lyfe world yet neuer yeld earthly creature god truth wherefore much whole discourse prosecute earnestly condition doth concerne christian prince whatsoeuer subiectes realme agreable maners people fayth religion haue determined selfe bestow trauaile like cause word writyngin matter religion meete deale men cōsciences rather prince iudge best withall aduise trouble maiesty henceforth matter proclayme forth challenge agaynst byshops rather agaynst doctours deuines finally agaynst subiectes england conscience people able enduce force firme doctrine pytthe substaunciall argument direction conscience shall shewe selfe herein honest man must frame v kynde bookes maner letter bookes haue hitherto receaued kinde ware neither delighte queénes grace like well subiectes cause therefore good lord ierome willingly aduize cease wrytyng henceforth nay rather write god name paynte deuise coyne much ye list lett long shall lawfull haue endite vntill ye last onely repente losse labour withall make ashamed much good tyme wickedly employed therefore take though would wishe surcease writyng throwe away penne rather wish write endyte vntill hoarse withall hereof neuerthelesse war • e vnlesse mainteyne quarrell haue vndertaken better furniture shall come late sayd lose labour also doe thinke gayne cause religion wherein hadd none aduersary yet lord selfe doth warre agaynst breathe mouth whole scripture fight agaynst authoritie auncient father haue bent force ouerthrow youosor quarrell pope doth endeuour meanes possible call backe agayne galathians onely righteousnesse fayth whence backslyden withall bycause seduced vayne persuasion counterfaict fayth doth discouer vnto kynde fayth doth meane fayth idle dead without workes doth worke fayth sayth respect true fayth alone maner concludyng argument liuely fayth alone without charitie ergo fallax diuision coniunction fayth onely coupled charitie doth iustifie argument deriued thynges setterer nature thynges coupled nature concludyng secundum quid ad simpliciter worthely reiected logician schoole called meére sophistication thyngs goe commonly certein maner together done together must coupled applyed one selfe operation̄ reason must come passe hath feéte eye eares haue selues alone therefore shalbe supposed goe vpon feéte onely walke vpon eyesonely faith worketh iustificatiō alone seé eares matter goeth none otherwise fayth hope charitie threé heauenly iewelles albeit instilled v freé liberalitie god remission sinnes cleaue fast within one subiect yet euery distinguished seuerall property function notwithstandyng examplein respectes fayth hope charitie coupled question demaunded thyng doth iustifie v sight god obteine v euerlastyng lyfe doe aunswere fayth yea fayth onely demaunde meanes aunswere iesus christ mediatour agayne aske kynde fayth aunswere idle dead fayth liuely fayth fayth doth worke loue workyng fayth demaunde markes may able discerne true fayth false fayth paule make aunswere vnto true fayth worketh charitie demaunde yet fayth worketh doe aunswere accordyng seuerall property thereof two maner wayes namely fayth worketh saluation thorough christ worketh obedience law charitie absolute obedience doe thinke vnperfect obedience fayth must neédes insufficient full measure absolute righteousnesse perfect felicity excellent integritie lyfe doth purchase v way kyngdome heauen effectualnesse charitie auayleable eternall lyfe solemne decreé tridentine coūcell doth ascribe onely righteous truely called righteous also truely righteous sight god annexing thereunto dreadfull terrible cursethe formall cause iustification accordyng tridentynes man dare presume say man iustified hath spoken aduaunced iustice excellēt integrity life skill cann yet shall neuer able bring passe contrary song dayly sing vnto christ shalbe vnuanquishable trueth thou onely art holy thou onely art treasure confesse vnspeakeable dispersed ouer face whole earth notwithstanding also boldly professe grace wherein doth cōsist highest honour perfect obedience neuer happen euer geuen vnto christ alone neéde circumstaūce vrge one reason agaynst osorius make end one prayer holy knitt vpp fewer wordes lordes prayer herein appeale conscience let pronounce one prayer vnto god sort faulty respect swarue thought frō absolute perfection righteousnesse whereupon doth bragg much vnremoueable conuersion mynde godward humble abacement himselfe dutyfull reuerence beseémyng vnspeakeable maiesty wyll yeld victory hartely desire wish vnto learned reader elect saynctes god whosoeuer professe name weare badge christ iesu departing iniquity gathering together one vniforme agreément sincere doctrine thenlightening inspiratiō holyghost may together receiued heauenly ierusalem kingdome immortall glory eternall felicity shall neuer haue end workes righteousnesse haue done loue lord sauiour iesu christ suffered death sinnes rose agayne iustification amen london printed iohn daye dwellyng ouer aldersgate cum gratia priuilegio regiae maiestatis anno 1581
